items.content:
SVP of Technical Product Management

Worldwide
Company: Crossover

FULL-TIME

Overview

We’re running an Exclusive Hiring Event on this coming Saturday to hire SVPs of Technical Product Management (USD $400K/yr).

This event will include all testing for the role. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

The Senior Vice President of Technical Product Management will serve as a critical member of the global executive team.

Our Technical Product Management roles are much more technical than what most companies call “Product Management” so traditional “product management” experience is not a requirement.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science is absolutely mandatory, (M.Sc. or PhD preferred)
  • 15+ years of hands-on production code development and architecture design in Java or C# on a commercial software product or end-user software supporting a service offering
  • 5+ years of recent hands-on experience defining and owning the tactical and strategic technical definition and design of software products for an engineering team to code and test
  • Extensive experience communicating requirements in writing and using diagrams (such as architecture diagrams, data flows, and system component diagrams)
  • NPI experience with startups or new/1.0 products within larger companies
  • Experience with the software development tools/platform space is a nice-to-have along with product management of products used by Fortune 500 sized companies
  • English language proficiency

We recommend that you attend the event instead of applying online, as our Saturday event process will be much faster.

Register HERE: 

Apply for job

EVP of Technical Product Management

Worldwide
Company: Crossover

FULL-TIME

Overview

We’re running an Exclusive Hiring Event on this coming Saturday to hire EVPs of Technical Product Management (USD $800K/yr).

This event will include all testing for the role. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

The Executive Vice President of Technical Product Management will serve as a key member of the global executive team.

We are searching for senior-level people who have been in CTO positions or Chief Architect roles with people management responsibilities. You will make important technical decisions on architecture, coach your team on how to deliver more simple technical specifications which meet the business needs and coach your team towards continuous improvement. You will hire, coach and manage 5-15 global Senior Vice Presidents of Technical Product Management each responsible for a critical product line.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science is absolutely mandatory, (M.Sc. or PhD preferred)
  • 5+ years of recent hands-on experience defining and owning the tactical and strategic technical definition and design of software products
  • 15+ years of hands-on technical development and architecture experience
  • Extensive experience communicating requirements in writing and using diagrams (such as architecture diagrams, data flows, and system component diagrams)
  • NPI experience with startups or new/1.0 products within larger companies
  • English language proficiency

We recommend that you attend the event instead of applying online, as our Saturday event process will be much faster.

items.title: Product Manager Trainee
items.content:
Who is the MOST inspiring person you know? What have they ACHIEVED that you really admire? Wouldn’t it be great if they would share their success secrets with YOU?

The obvious answer - YES - prompted us to embark on our mission, aiming to improve 10 million lives by 2022. By creating marketing campaigns, launching digital products or coaching our clients, PASSION.IO gives inspiring people the platform they deserve to share their message with the world and impact lives.

We are an international team with the majority of our customers in the US. We’ve grown from nothing to multi-million dollar business in under 2 years… because when you focus on impact, income will follow. We work together to not only make this company successful, but to transform our clients, our customers and ourselves into our best versions.

As we say, Do it with Passion, or not at all.

Do you think you’re the right fit?

We’ve created a software-as-a-service that allows you to build and launch native mobile apps with just a few clicks.

We are looking for an inspiring, engaged and motivated new member of our Product/IT team.

You want to become a great product manager with the vision to change the future of learning.

Your mission will be to define and further develop ground-breaking software-as-a-services and mobile apps for our partners and customers that bring the Passion.io learning experience to the next level and to millions of people anytime, anywhere.

*What you'll be working on*
* Supporting the Product Owner
# You will be assigned to the product owner who will be your mentor during the entire program
# You will drive focus product projects to leverage and bond with your mentor
# Define, structure, develop processes and tools, and show measurable results
* Benchmarking Products incl. UX/UI
# You work on product development while consistently sounding out the market to help refine the product while monitoring and optimizing key performance indicators (KPIs)
# You will have ideas for further developing our products, have a clear idea about the future product, and how it will transform the market
# You will successfully drive projects/features through the lifecycle from conception to launch
# Setting up and conducting UX tests and improve the platform
* Kanban / Scrum
# You are going to develop and prioritize product roadmaps
# Thus you are taking care of the product backlogs and prioritize them accordingly
# As part of this role you organize and set goals for sprints
# You are in charge of the technical demands of the product and make sure to motivate all stakeholders towards a common goal
* Design Thinking / Customer Obsession
# Be the user-advocate during the development process, subjecting early-stage designs to usability testing or expert review, and offering implementation suggestions from a user-centred perspective
# You keep functionality, usability, performance and quality of the product in mind
# You are in contact with customers and users to learn from them and optimize their problems
* Prep project for your new role
# In this module, you will identify and implement a complex project that prepares you for your new role

*What you'll bring to the team*
# You have first experiences with kanban and/or scrum and successfully operated sprints before
# You worked in start-ups in the product department
# You have got experience of working at the intersection of business and technology and have a basic understanding of IT infrastructure
# You are hands on and look for pragmatic solutions
# You are good at keeping the bigger picture in mind and can thus organize yourself and your team
# You have strong cross-functional communication skills

*What we offer you*
# Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

items.title: Product Owner/ Manager
items.content:
Who is the MOST inspiring person you know? What have they ACHIEVED that you really admire? Wouldn’t it be great if they would share their success secrets with YOU?

The obvious answer - YES - prompted us to embark on our mission, to improve 10 million lives by 2022. By creating cutting edge marketing campaigns, launching digital products on our SaaS platform or coaching our clients, PASSION.IO gives inspiring people the platform they deserve to share their message with the world and impact lives.

We are an international team with the majority of our customers in the US. We’ve grown from nothing to a multi-million dollar business in under 2 years… because when you focus on impact, income will follow. Our goal is not only limited to making this company successful - it extends to each team member and each client becoming successful, which means we strive to become the best version of ourselves every day.

As we say, *Do it with Passion, or not at all.*

Do you think you’re the right fit?

We’ve created a software-as-a-service that allows you to build and launch native mobile apps with just a few clicks.

You want to become a great product owner with the vision to change the future of learning.

Currently, the founder & CEO is the product owner. Your mission will be to take over this responsibility. You will define and further develop ground-breaking software-as-a-services and mobile apps for our partners and customers that bring the Passion.io learning experience to the next level and to millions of people anytime, anywhere.

*What you'll be working on*
# Lead the product vision, strategy and operations
# Define and oversee the product development process, incl. product roadmaps, releases, UX/UI, visual design, testing, customer feedback, positioning, and branding
# Own pricing strategy, market segmentation, and revenue forecasts
# Define, measure, and improve growth rates, usage, and retention metrics
# Lead, shape, and develop the product/IT team
# Drive a strong focus on product design, mobile-first approach, innovation, optimization by understanding user data, customer insights, and industry trends
# Be the user-advocate during the development process, subjecting early-stage designs to usability testing or expert review, and offering implementation suggestions from a user-centred perspective
# Take the time to deeply understand the problems and challenges that users face, and participate in collaborative product sessions with other teams
# Feel equally comfortable interviewing and onboarding new team members, discussing issues with other leads, and presenting
# Most of all, look forward to rolling up sleeves each day and inspiring others with energy and passion for our products
# Be an active user and thought leader, not just an observer

*What you'll bring to the team*
# Entrepreneurial mindset, ability to understand customers needs
# Previous CEO/founder experience is a plus
# Minimum 5 years of experience in Product Development in an online business or fast-growing internet startups
# Experience of leading cross-cultural diverse teams where different localization strategies and communications are required
# Strong awareness of current mobile & web technologies, trends, products, tools, and design standards
# Data informed decisions: strong ability to understand & synthesize data
# Ability and internal drive towards solving problems
# Outstanding team leadership and communication/interpersonal skills
# Fluent in English

*What we offer you*
# Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

Director of Marketing at GUILD

United States, Remote · Full Time
GUILD makes it easy for businesses to tap outside expertise. We are tweaking the business consulting industry, valued at $200Bn+ in US alone.Read More

GUILD makes it easy for businesses to tap outside expertise. We are tweaking the business consulting industry, valued at $200Bn+ in US alone.

Our team is constantly experimenting with exciting ideas. BIG IDEAS. Ideas sourced from our users (senior consultants & business executives) and other industries... and we execute on them faster every day.

Applied
Apply to GUILD
Add a message to GUILD
Apply

Job Description

GUILD is looking for an experienced digital marketing/ product management professional. For our unique B2B consulting service, the position will,

1. Create a high-value audience of business prospects
2. Build and optimize the online lead generation funnel
3. Support sales team members in converting online prospects to new clients

Responsibilities include, managing:

- High-level design and copywriting
- Content creation/curation/editing
- SEO
- Content marketing
- Email campaigns
- Social media
- Landing pages
- Channel partnerships
- Conversion metrics

The position will be "lightly" supported by our current staff, so an entrepreneurial/hacker mindset is a must.

It will start as a part-time position for a period of up to 6 months. This period will be used to experiment with new go-to-market ideas.

The fixed pay during this period will be a maximum of $1,000 per month. Performance-based pay is open to discussion. As a policy, all positions in our company are at least 25% "performance-based pay".

Skills
Copywriting, Marketplaces, Social Media Marketing, Affiliate Marketing, A/B Testing, Digital Marketing, B2B Marketing, Digital Strategy, Marketing and Branding, Funnel Optimization

What We're Building

GUILD (previously Mentors Guild) makes it easy for businesses to leverage outside expertise.

Not only do our clients get access to specialized expertise, in addition, through our vast member-base we bring to them the exact past experience needed to solve their most pressing challenges.

Our clients are not constrained by internal or locally available expertise, nor do they need to pay exorbitant fees to consulting firms to hire "generalists". By consulting specialists, on demand and always within budget, our clients shrink the learning curve in solving complex issues or getting to the next level.

GUILD connects them directly to Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) from all over the country. In select cities, our Growth Partners engage as onsite project managers, and take care of administrative overheads like contracts, milestones and payments.

In a $200Bn consulting industry plagued by high project failures, we offer a one-of-its-kind service which puts our clients in the driver's seat.

items.title: Product Launch Manager Trainee
items.content:
Who is the MOST inspiring person you know? What have they ACHIEVED that you really admire? Wouldn’t it be great if they would share their success secrets with YOU?

The obvious answer - YES - prompted us to embark on our mission, aiming to improve 10 million lives by 2022. By creating marketing campaigns, launching digital products or coaching our clients, PASSION.IO gives inspiring people the platform they deserve to share their message with the world and impact lives.

We are an international team with the majority of our customers in the US. We’ve grown from nothing to multi-million dollar business in under 2 years… because when you focus on impact, income will follow. We work together to not only make this company successful, but to transform our clients, our customers and ourselves into our best versions.

As we say, *Do it with Passion, or not at all.*

Do you think you’re the right fit?

This training program trains top talent in launching digital products globally. Program candidates will gain inside perspectives, drive day-to-day management and build deep functional expertise by rotating every 3-6 months to new functional stages with different challenges.

Duration: 15 months total, fast track: 12months depending on exceptional performance

Alumni will then build verticals globally from scratch to market leadership or become a key player in functions such as online marketing, product development, sales and operations.

You are responsible to excel in 6 modules. Modules can be conducted abroad if reasonable. During the program, you will be assigned to a mentor you report to on a bi-weekly basis and direct responsible individuals (DRIs) for each program stage where you lead diverse projects to lift Passion’s business.

*What you'll be working on*
* Assisting a senior launcher
# You will be assigned to a senior launcher who will be your mentor during the entire program
# You will drive focus projects to leverage and bond with your mentor
# Define, structure, develop processes and tools, and show measurable results
*Product
# You work on product development while consistently sounding out the market to help refine the product while monitoring and optimizing key performance indicators (KPIs)
# You will have ideas for further developing the business model, have a clear idea about the product, and how it will transform the market
# You will successfully drive projects/features through the lifecycle from conception to launch
*Marketing
# You will work on key projects in marketing, such as copywriting, CRM, mobile, loyalty, and others to deliver high quality traffic, optimize conversion, and improve retention
# You will support implementing the launch strategy and its roadmap across markets / verticals
# You will keep a close eye on the market, competition and use your research to continuously improve marketing activities
*Celebrity Key Account
# You will work with clients, including larger celebrities and partnerships
# You will identify opportunities to further improve the relationship, streamline operations and share best practices across markets
*Prep project for your new role
# In this module, you will apply it all by identifying and implementing a complex project that prepares you for your new role

*What you'll bring to the team*
# Have a track record of successfully building, launching and managing digital products
# Have a creative mindset and are passionate about building engaging products with user experiences
# Have great eye and passion for copy, copywriting, design, know your peers and come with many ideas on how to improve our product experience
# Are an extremely well structured thinker with a clear passion for action & results
# Have experience in managing complex processes, projects, and are an expert communicator
# Love data, numbers & have excellent analytical skills, experience with quantitative & qualitative research – all paired with demonstrated experience of turning data into actionable insights
# Fluent in English

*What we offer you*
# Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

items.content:
German Speaking Help Desk/Service Desk Analyst - Remote

Client : Global Customer

Location : Remote

Duration : Short term contract

Must be fluent in both English and German language

An exciting opportunity has arisen with a Global client of ours for a German Speaking Help Desk/
Service Desk Analyst on a short-term contract basis. This role will be based Remotely

You will be providing first line support to both European ( German ) and UK clients, resolving queries, some of a technical nature, or logging and transferring (and monitoring to successful conclusion) for more in-depth support.

The German Speaking Help Desk/Service Desk Analyst will be responsible for:

  • Accepting Help Desk, Service Desk requests and calls coming into the IT department from English and German speakers
  • Handling requests in line with SLA's and escalating up to 2nd/3rd line where necessary
  • Provide remote user support
  • Experience of supporting software applications or helpdesk/desktop experience, must have some technology knowledge
  • A thorough understanding of Microsoft Desktop operating system's (XP, Windows 7 and Windows 8)
  • Knowledge of MS server technologies (server 2008, Active Directory, IIS, exchange 2010 and SQL 2012)
  • Excellent communications skills with a customer focussed attitude

Call Centre, help desk or Service Desk experience is essential.

Must be fluent in both English and German language

Additional key skills:

Help Desk or Service Desk support

German and English speaking

IT hardware and software knowledge

items.content:
Product Owner

Company: Novate IT Ltd
Location: Cwmbran
Permanent

Product Owner - iOS , Android - Cwmbran

A brand new role with a highly successful and growing employer in South Wales for a Product Owner to work across a variety of video - centric projects for their platform. A generous starting salary is offered plus benefits such as up to 10% bonus, flexi time, a 25 day holiday allowance that will increase with service, life assurance, 3% employee 6% employer initial pension package and private health care.

The company have several applications that are used by consumers on a global scale across both mobile and web platforms, these applications handle huge amounts of data with no downtime or stress on their systems. They are now looking to hire a Product Owner to help drive product development with local and remote scrum teams.

You will have experience of working in an Agile environment helping local and remote teams of cross-functional developers understand user stories and promote the company's product vision. You will be working on iOS and Android projects so you must have knowledge of both. You will also be able to balance utilising good functionality, user experience and product design. On the technical side solid experience of understanding test automation, continuous integration and deployment as well as evaluating current engineering standards and suggesting improvements is essential. Any experience of working on a video streaming, digital television, media player or similar project will be a huge benefit. As you will be interacting with a huge variety of users, developers and managers excellent communication skills are extremely important.

If you're looking to step up into a Product Owner role or grow further from your current job, joining an established company who are looking to improve their user's experience through new innovative products across iOS and Android then send in your CV today!

Novate IT Ltd is a leading supplier of permanent and contract recruitment services for companies in the IT, Digital Media and Telecommunications industries.
This job was originally posted as www.cwjobs.co.uk/job/82532716

items.title: Marketing Coordinator
items.content:
Marketing Coordinator

Anywhere in the US
Company: SmartBug Media

FULL-TIME

Overview

PLEASE READ 

You must have hands-on experience with HubSpot to be considered for this position. 

Do you love digital marketing and online media? Are you looking to work with really bright people who respect you for your contributions and your character? Do you want to dominate your career without killing your personal life?

If so, you should consider becoming SmartBug Media’s Internal Marketing Coordinator. We’re looking for a responsible, accountable and driven marketer who can help enhance the capabilities of our agency marketing team. You’ll combine your existing skills and a world-class training program into success in an exploding market for inbound marketing, analytics, and marketing automation. You will be challenged every day and you will develop the skills and track record that will make even your mama proud!

We’re building a different kind of work environment at SmartBug Media – one where you can deliver great results, have a great time with people you respect and still embrace the things that matter in life. We focus on development and growth.

The Day to Day

You will work hand-in-hand with the Marketing Director, executing our inbound strategy. This means you’ll gain valuable experience in the strategy behind inbound marketing. You’ll work with our marketing consultants, strategists, writers and designers to create and distribute compelling content to our buyer personas. You will quickly become a SmartBug ninja and will spend part of your time ensuring you stay up to speed and learn how to use the newest tools. Technology-wise, you can expect to spend your time using HubSpot, Gaggle, Teamwork (for project management), and other awesome tools like Canva, Sigstr, and Lucky Orange.

Our Commitment

We’re a flat organization and we’re hiring you because you’re smart, driven and want to win – just like us. That’s why you’ll have a seat at the table and your ideas heard in making SmartBug Media the most rewarding inbound marketing agency on the planet.

Will your success as an Internal Marketing Coordinator make you our next rock star? We hope so.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Become an expert in inbound marketing tactics including blogging, social media marketing, conversion rate optimization, search engine optimization, e-book/video content creation, website updates, email marketing, webinar and event marketing, and others
  • Become a HubSpot and SmartBug process expert and keep up with software updates and best practices
  • Work with a team of content creators, developers and designers to execute campaign deliverables
  • Take the lead in creating monthly performance reports to highlight wins of campaigns you manage, areas of improvement and recommendations for future programs
  • Stay informed about inbound marketing industry developments
  • Practice your craft by contributing to SmartBug Media’s blog and social media presence
  • Have fun and make some great friends!

Experience and Education Required:

  • 1-3 years experience with online marketing and social media
  • B.A. or B.S. degree
  • Journalism and/or strong writing skills are required
  • Inbound certification or HubSpot certification a plus

Requirements

  • Strong hands-on HubSpot experience
  • Very strong attention to detail and ability to manage projects
  • Strong work ethic with a positive and enthusiastic attitude
  • Demonstrated ability to think creatively
  • Passion for the Internet and marketing with a strong understanding of inbound marketing
  • Demonstrate analytical thinking and independent management skills
  • Strong communicator with excellent customer service and relationship building skills
  • Understanding of major social media platforms
  • Strong writer
  • Basic design skills
  • Basic knowledge of search engine optimization
  • Basic knowledge of email marketing best practices and CAN-SPAM compliance
  • The desire to learn on your own and keep up with inbound marketing and Internet marketing developments and best practices
  • Great writing skills and storytelling skills
  • Proficiency in Google Docs

Our extensive employee benefits program includes:

  • Generous compensation package with performance incentives
  • Health insurance with company contribution
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Paid vacation
  • Paid time off
  • 401(k) with employer matching
  • Flexible spend plan
  • Company-funded short-term disability and life insurance
  • Long-term disability
  • Annual leadership conference, ‘SmartBugapalooza’
  • Training budget
  • Flexibility of working remote

About SmartBug Media:

SmartBug Media is a 43-person strong, award-winning digital and content marketing agency that helps companies grow. We’re one of a handful of HubSpot Diamond partners in the world and the highest-rated agency in the history of the HubSpot ecosystem. SmartBug Media is also a certified Great Place to Work, Inc. 5000 company, and the winner of 36 MarCom Awards in 2017 and 32 AVA Digital Awards in 2018, among others.

Our commitment to ‘Rocking the Customer Experience’ has enabled us to both develop deep relationships with our clients and realize growth outpacing the market average. As we support our continued growth and ambitious future plans, we are looking to broaden our range of strategic and creative services and are seeking an outstanding creative visionary to serve as our Creative Director to help us innovate across content, social, digital and mobile platforms.

Upingo facilitates one-to-one in-person networking opportunities for the London Startup community. The Founders have significant ambition for growth.

We are looking for an Undergraduate or recent Graduate who wants to join an early stage Startup with full responsibility for Marketing.

Who are we looking for?

We are seeking an enthusiastic, self-motivated team member to drive the growth of the platform. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to be awarded equity in the business (in the near term) and become a key part of the Founding Team.

Location

The candidate will work remotely, though it makes most sense to be based in London. Hours will be flexible, though the capacity to engage with the Founders within certain windows (to be agreed upon) will be important.

Role

-Architecting and executing the social media strategy for Upingo.

-Architecting and executing digital and email marketing campaigns.

-Analysis of marketing effectiveness and carrying out A/B testing.

-General sector research and analysis.

Requirements

-Experience/strong understanding of current online marketing concepts, strategies and best practices. 

-Excellent communicator (fluent in English).

-Self-motivated and proactive.

Why work for Upingo?

This is a phenomenal opportunity for an Undergraduate or recent Graduate to put their learnings into practice in the real world. For the right candidate, an equity award (in the near term) is very possible and moreover, the opportunity to join an ambitious Startup, making a positive impact, at the earliest of stages.

items.title: JavaScript developer for a new fintech product
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=4, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=41}
items.content:
JavaScript developer for a new fintech product

Company: Vox Financial Partners
Belfast, United Kingdom

[Note: we are open to remote work if you can spend at least a few days a month in our Belfast office.]

THE ROLE
You’ll be the person responsible for building the front-ends to Opal, a cloud platform to create and manage Structured Documents: documents represented as data, created and managed programatically.

You'll be using JavaScript, React, HTML, and CSS to make the user experience sing. We don’t want your typical ugly enterprise app: it has to be elegant, delightful to use, and enticing during a demo.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
You’ll be doing some or all of the following:

  • working with our product manager to refine the UI/UX requirements
  • coding the front-end for the web and Office apps
  • writing some basic test packs. We won’t go overboard but we aren’t flying by the seat of our pants, either
  • in partnership with the CTO, the technical lead, and the rest of your team, defining and implementing standards for how we work: our agile methodology, coding standards, development tools, deployment practices, and more. This is a green field development and we want to use tomorrow’s best practices today.

WHO WE WANT
We are looking for a smart person with initiative and good judgment, who works well with others, and who will always look to balance the urgent needs of clients with the long-term technical architecture for our product.

You need to have:

  • a minimum of three years’ experience using client-side web technologies with a solid knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3
  • experience with Node JS, and webpack, as well as a unit testing framework such as Jest
  • a desire to learn new things. For example, we have a Ruby on Rails back-end, so there is an opportunity to become a full stack developer (if you want to).

Any of these things will help you stand out:

  • an eye for good design. You won’t be getting detailed wireframes, so your role will be at least partly that of a designer
  • experience with ReactJS, or a similar front-end library or framework
  • experience with Bootstrap or similar – we’ll be using Office Fabric, a similar library from Microsoft
  • working with RESTful API back-end components.

WHAT WE OFFER

As well as the basics - competitive pay and benefits – we offer work on a greenfield product, in a small startup-like team. We’ll invest so you have good tools to work with and we’ll keep your skills fresh with a budget for technical books, training, and the like.

Apply now

items.title: PPC Advertising Content Writer
items.content:
Who We Are

The Urban Cowgirl provides competitive advertising strategies to the top 1% of Amazon Sellers. We create story-driven instructional courses to educate and empower Amazon Sellers to create successful Amazon Advertising campaigns. We are also a service business, partnering with our clients to scale their businesses and achieve their desired outcomes. We immerse ourselves in advanced advertising strategy.

Who You Are

You’re confident in your ability to write instructional advertising content with a strong voice and style. You’re a structured thinker and have experience writing step-by-step, detailed explanations of technical processes. In this position, you’ll be responsible for creating study guides, presentation slides, video scripts, and website content.

You have PPC Advertising experience and an understanding of advanced search marketing strategies. You’re interested in teaching others through engaging written content. You have the ability to work effectively as part of a team, take direction, and deliver assets on deadline in a fast-paced environment.

 

Responsibilities

  • Create digital written content that is bold, strategic, and on-brand
  • Translate complex ideas into effective written content
  • Research, author, and publish outstanding content under tight deadlines
  • Create and manage content for social media channels
  • Collaborate with the creative team remotely via Slack and email

 

Requirements:

  • 2+ years experience writing and publishing digital advertising content
  • Strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills
  • Technical and instructional writing skills
  • Advanced understanding of PPC Advertising
  • Advanced understanding of creating and optimizing PPC advertising campaigns
  • Experience creating multiple drafts and refining your work to achieve excellence
  • Working knowledge of Adobe InDesign, or strong ability to learn software basics
  • Experience collaborating with creative teams of 3 or more people
  • Strong time management and organization skills
  • Critical thinking skills to generate original and innovative ideas
  • Skilled at identifying challenges and proactively creating solutions
  • Digital storytelling and content creation experience a plus

 

Essential Software Experience:

  • Adobe InDesign (1+ years)
  • Google Drive (1+ years)
  • Microsoft Word (5+ years)
  • Powerpoint (5+ years)
  • Keynote (5+ years)

 

The Urban Cowgirl values loyalty and hard work. We’re committed to creating great work experiences for our team with opportunities for advancement.

items.title: Digital Marketing Manager
items.content:
Introduction

This is an opportunity to fill a much needed role that hasn’t yet existed at Apolitical and have significant impact on the team.

In this role, you will be a powerful amplifier for Apolitical’s work, leveraging resources across the company to get the word out about us and drive a key success metric for the company: network membership growth. You will be responsible for two levers that drive membership growth:

1) Optimising our presence in google searches – the way that most potential users find us and join.

2) PR and marketing around specific growth campaigns and pieces of content produced by the team to maximise their impact for user growth and sales.

You will manage a team on link building and work widely across the company to bring together activity relating to membership growth – and translate it into an effective digital strategy for Apolitical across online search, social media, email communications, and our distribution partners.

You will be analytical and driven by measuring and responding to success metrics of the campaigns and outreach activities you conduct, so that we continuously focus on the most impactful growth channels as a company.



Key responsibilities:

SEO:
Hit monthly targets for improvements in Apolitical’s search performance as a critical lever of membership growth, a critical company priority.
Manage a team of interns as an effective sales function to execute Apolitical’s SEO strategy.
Work with the rest of the Apolitical team to make our existing work optimal for search.

Digital content PR opportunities:
Develop and execute a strategy to leverage the company’s content, community, and growth initiatives to maximise publicity amongst relevant potential users and partners.
Develop and maintain partnerships with the whole range of press, networks, and organisations that are effective distribution partners for Apolitical’s content.

Digital growth ringleader:
Work across and coordinate initiatives across relevant teams to maximise the impact of any activity in the company for our membership growth and engagement.



Key attributes:

Must haves:
Autonomous and self sufficient – some prior management experience
Organised and efficient
Data drive and analytical – with a desire to experiment, measure and assess the effectiveness of communication strategies, and an appreciation for success indices
A desire to expand and develop a career in digital marketing and growth
Creativity, enthusiasm and a passion for Apolitical’s mission
Proven experience of using digital channels to build profile, from more traditional routes of selective content placement through to running online campaigns and using distribution partners
An excellent written and verbal communicator
Able to work effectively through other teams and get buy into your strategy
A hustler and do-er – being willing to roll up your sleeves to execute on your strategies


Strongly preferred:
Prior SEO experience and knowledge and communications
Experience of working in the policy space (govt, think tanks, NGOs, foundations etc)


Salary: Between £30- 40k depending on experience

Application: Please note that all applicants must have a right to work in the UK.

items.title: Clevertech: Sr. Route Optimization Engineer
items.content:
Sr. Route Optimization Engineer

Company: Clevertech
Headquarters: Remote
https://www.clevertech.biz/

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces.

REQUIREMENTS

  • You love doing puzzles
  • You have serious math skills
  • You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
  • You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
  • You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings

BENEFITS

Own Your Time
We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travelers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

Recharge Time
We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself
You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

Focused Work
You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

Learn at your edges
We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here. And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag
And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over Slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=22, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Devops

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: B2C, eCommerce, Retail
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Back Market | No office location

Technologies

amazon-web-services
python
docker
automation
ansible

Job description

WHO WE ARE ?

Founded in 2014, Back Market is the very first international marketplace specialized in refurbished electric and electronic devices. We connect certified professionals who work hard to ensure all electric and electronic devices get a second life with consumers looking for equipment that makes a difference.

E-waste reduction, planned obsolescence battle and circular economy are 3 good reasons to wake up in the morning. We have a challenging schedule and high business expectations, so you’ll need to be able to get up to speed without compromising on attention to detail. For the right person, this is a chance to gain valuable experience in building a star and to join a fast-growing, exciting and life-changing company that’s shaking up the consumer electronics business.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING...

As an OPS within our technical team, you’ll help to develop Back Market internationally. Localized in our Parisian office, you’ll work with our engineers, customer care, business development, marketing, a group of passionate professionals engaged to the promotion of refurbished products. Reporting to our Head of Engineering, your duties will include:

  • Collaboration with our provider who administers our server farms on AWS to further optimize our performance
  • Definition, implementation, supervision and continuous optimization of our deployment cycle on the different environments (IC, CD)
  • Automation of the provisioning to meet product and developer needs.
  • Definition, implementation and monitoring of technical KPIs: exploitation and quality of production.
  • The collaboration with dev teams to facilitate release.
  • The evangelization of DevOps good practices

THIS JOB IS FOR YOU AND YOU’RE IN THE PLACE TO BE IF…

  • You have at least 4/5 years experience as a DevOps
  • AWS got no secret with you
  • OS : Linux (centOS, Debian)
  • IAC : Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, Fabric
  • Containers : Docker, Vagrant
  • Languages : shell, Python
  • DB : Elastic, MySql, MongoDB, RDS, Aurora
  • Messaging: Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, SQS
  • Culture & experience
  • You Know industrialization processes, agile methods, gitflow flow and DevOps practices in general mixed with good system notions
  • You want to join a challenging technical environment and you’re comfortable with our stacks: AWS, RestFul API, Python, Django, VueJs, Algolia, NewRelic, Jenkins, Docker, Intégration en continue, Agile, SEO, Celery, SQS, ElasticSearch, Nginx, UWSGI, Unit Test

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US ?

  • Daily technical challenges : with us, you will forget what the word boring means !
  • A band of experts who will offer you their technical know-how and will allow you to build skills in your prefered technologies but not only ! (Backacademy, technical guilds)
  • A job that makes sense : you’ll tell people to buy products that have already lived instead of buying new ones. Which means reducing the production of electronic waste and fight against overproduction. It counts.
  • A high growth project : 3 years ago, we were 3. now we are more than 90 and we are lived in 6 different countries. Boom.
  • Lots of groove : you will have many opportunities to work with talented and super friendly people.
  • Attractive compensation, based on the profile and experience

Let’s have a quick talk ?




Apply now

About Back Market

Working at Back Market is an everyday mission, challenging and exciting. We’re looking for smart people who can help us create new solutions to develop ourselves.

We truly think that the world needs more companies like us; we’re not only trying to show the world that other ways of consumption  are possible but we’re also fighting against planned obsolescence by giving second life to electronics and reducing waste. We dare to create and follow our dreams, building solutions to make one of the greenest marketplace to rise up.

We’re growing up amazingly fast, and we want to keep it that way. As a member of the BOT, you’ll be in charge of building the best experience possible for our customers and merchants. You will build the growth by coding, reviewing, learning and sharing your knowledge with others. We have ambition, that’s why a big part of your job will be helping us setting up new processes to reach our goals quicker.


Human qualities are, for us, as much important as computer skills and the right people should fit with our values : 

  • #LOVE
  • #JAJAJA
  • #MARS
  • #REAL
  • #RESPHUMBLE
  • #SWEAT

Benefits

  • Meal vouchers (Tickets restaurants)
  • Gym (indoor football, cardio-boxing, yoga, meditation)
  • Macbook
  • Free coffee, tea and fruits
  • Fun everyday with cool colleagues, monthly big party & team buildings
  • 30 paid holidays
  • Remote authorized 2 days per week
  • Startup life with a lot of technical challenges and new technologies
  • Competitive salary
  • Great on-boarding and training programs

GM India - Product, Sales, Marketing, & Evangelism at Crowdera

India, Mumbai, Nagpur, Remote · Full Time

Probably there are a million ways to build promising career, but nothing beats being part of a compassion driven economy where abundance starts with giving. Crowdera has created world’s first truly free fundraising platform that does not charge any commission or ask for tip from donors. We are changing the way people give and align themselves with the causes and individuals they fund & support. Our continuos evolution will help fundraisers to add sustenance to their organizations, improve their lives, make a lasting impact. What we are set to achieve in next few years will make you fall in love with us. Plus, you get to work with & mentored by silicon valley business leaders and tech gurus with pedigree of eBay, Amazon, Google, Columbia. Ask us and we will give 10 more reasons to work with us.

Applied
Apply to Crowdera
Add a message to Crowdera
Apply

Job Description

As GM India, you will report directly to the founder and will be part of core management team. Your sole purpose is to set-up a strong presence of Crowdera in India by evangelizing, and to progress the vision of the company through action on the ground. You have to a self-starter, build the Indian operations ground up, evangelize & scale Crowdera's brand among all business associates and partners – philanthropists, social entrepreneurs, high net worth donors & investors, corporates, celebrities or government officials.

In this demanding and multidimensional role, you will serve as a trusted aide to the founder on planning and execution of all matters pertaining to Crowdera’s India operations.

Success in this role will be defined by your ability to think both strategically and tactically, exercise good judgment, build and manage excellent relations with clients, lead team and numerous assignments with perfection in a fast-paced and creative environment.

items.title: Sr. Route Optimization Engineer at Clevertech
items.content:
Sr. Route Optimization Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

routes
mathematical-optimization
implementation

Job description

### DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces.

### REQUIREMENTS

* You love doing puzzles
* You have serious math skills
* You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
* You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
* You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings

Apply now

About Clevertech

BENEFITS Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source

Growth Hacking, Digital Marketing Internship at Food Moves

Job Description

Food Moves is a real-time locator for Food Trucks and Farmers Markets. We are starting something special and looking for an amazing team to bring us to the next level.

Learn more here: foodmoves.me

Through this internship, you'll be working directly with the Founder, Joel Cettina, and VP of Operations amongst other cross functions of the business.

You'll learn all aspects of launching a business as we work with the press, create new marketing channels, and multi-city expansion. Social Media, growth hacking, content creation are all functions of this position.

We work remotely, but we do require you work in one of the live cities. Those are New York, Philadelphia or Austin.

3-days a week, non-paid internship, school credit preferred.

If interested, please do your research and send a thoughtful message to Joel, generic messages will be deleted. We want to know why you want to work with us and what you hope to learn.

Good luck!

What We're Building

Food Moves is a marketplace that connects Mobile Food Vendors, including food trucks and farmers' markets, to consumers and suppliers. It is our mission to provide clarity and efficiency to this fragmented and underserved industry.

Our app’s real-time tracking and menu system provides clarity to the consumer, while using data that benefits both sides. By connecting vendors with suppliers, like a smart battery company to replace generators, we improve the way the mobile food industry operates. Food Moves ties all these together under one platform.

items.title: Paid Marketing & SEO Specialist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Paid Marketing & SEO Specialist

Anywhere in the US
Company: Astro HQ

FULL-TIME

Overview

We are Astro HQ and we build hardware and software tools that unlock creativity and productivity. Tools like:

  • Astropad – Software that turns the iPad into a high-end drawing tablet.
  • Luna Display – The first hardware solution that turns the iPad into a wireless second display.

We are looking for a savvy and self-starting Paid Marketing & SEO Specialist to join our team. As a Paid Marketing & SEO Specialist at Astro HQ, you’d be part of a small and fast-moving team making products that are used by tens of thousands of creators and makers.

You would be responsible for finding and engaging with new customers in our product ecosystem. You would work to develop and manage paid advertising programs, drive website traffic, and optimize conversion rates. This role requires an attention to detail and a desire to bring structure to undefined processes. This position involves collaboration in a tight-knit team, but also requires a level of comfort in working independently. The ideal candidate for this position has a positive attitude, a love for data, and an appetite for growth.

You will…

  • Run paid advertising campaigns across various platforms:
    • Social Media (Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, Pinterest)
    • Search (Google Adwords, Apple Search Ads)
  • Forecast ad investment and return
  • Explore new tactics for conversion funnel improvements
  • Drive consistent, relevant traffic to our product websites
  • Optimize and A/B test websites for maximum conversion
  • Track, analyze, and provide regular reporting on KPIs
  • Collaborate with the rest of the marketing team to drive media and customer attention in a data-driven manner
  • Leverage customer segments for specialized targeting

Skills & Requirements

  • BA/ BS degree
  • 3+ years of marketing experience with an ecommerce brand
  • Experience with Google Analytics, Google Adwords, and Facebook Ads Manager
  • Comfortable making data-driven decisions
  • Experience in product launch and demand generation
  • Ability to be a high level thinker in one moment and jump into the weeds the next
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Comfortable working independently but enjoys collaboration
  • Bonus skills: HTML/CSS, familiarity with Shopify

About Astro HQ

We are a small, bootstrapped startup founded by a team of ex-Apple engineers. Our tools are used by tens of thousands of creative pros and some of the largest animation studios in the world, and we are just getting started! We are looking for people passionate about building the next generation of tools that unlock creativity to join our team.

We are a fully remote company with a small office in Minneapolis, MN. If this sounds interesting to you, please !

We offer:

  • Remote work (or our office in Minneapolis, MN)
  • Flexible work schedules
  • Competitive pay + equity
  • Health & dental insurance
  • Parental leave
  • 3 weeks vacation
  • Challenging and creative work
  • High impact and significant responsibility

Apply

If you’re interested in this job, please send an email to  and include your resume and a note answering these 2 questions :

  • Why us?
  • Why you?
