items.content:
Marketing Operations Manager at Happen To Your Career - HTYC

Remote | Freelance | International

At Happen to Your Career we are a small, rapidly growing, company that believes in doing work you love and doing work in your strengths.

We value potential over experience and give high preference to those are already familiar with our brand and how we help people live the life they want to!

In this contract project position you will be working closely with myself, our Content Team, our Partnerships team and our Director of Career Change Bootcamp for all of our products and brands (Happen to Your Career, Career Change Bootcamp, Family Passport, etc).

KEY RESULTS AREAS (THIS IS HOW YOU KNOW IF YOU’RE DOING A STELLAR JOB):

  • You’re continually improving conversions in everything you touch (funnels, nurture sequences, landing pages, emails, etc).
  • We are over achieving on our all our monthly goals (conversion, revenue and student).
  • We are increasing the amount of feedback from our audience that we care (and we are incredibly personal).
  • Removing anything that is extra that gets in the way of the three above! (And helping us prioritize how to use our resources.) Helping us eliminate what isn’t working and focus our time on what does.
  • We are making changes because of data that has been produced by you.

A SMALL SAMPLING WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

  • Faithfully executes the business plan, achieving or exceeding planned P&L Objectives.
  • Leads, manages, and holds the team accountable for achieving agreed-upon commitments. We run a remote team with team members spread all over the world.
  • Integrating all major operating functions of the business. Ensures everyone is rowing together in the same direction. Models the way, always working toward the greater good of the business.
  • Resolves issues effectively—seeing real problems, being comfortable with conflict, calling out the problems, and solving the problems in a practical and healthy manner. Ensures the leadership team is healthy, functional, and Cohesive.
  • Ensures that everyone is truly following, and adhering to, the company’s core processes and operating system with consistency. Demonstrates effective project management skills.
  • Effectively collaborates with the CEO and stays on the same page.
  • Confirms that all key messages are properly and consistently cascaded across the organization. Inherently ensures that everyone is in the know. Verifies that a high level of effective communication exists throughout the organization.
  • Optimizing all content and marketing to meet our goals: create all our content for the purpose to educate, give hope, empower people to share, allow for people to opt-in/continue to engage and above all be genuinely helpful, personal, and stand out.
  • Ideation and development: Work with CEO other content team members to give voice to our self-development concepts, frameworks, and tools in podcasts, blog posts, videos, live workshops, webinars, and online courses.
  • Marketing Operations: Work within brand voice to create, update, and refine blog posts, guest posts on other sites, teaching notes, course video scripts, slide decks, workbooks, bonuses, and ancillary materials as needed. GOAL: Making sure that what we put into the world is “Anti-Vanilla” and different material (and fits our values below)
  • Research: Research and expand knowledge base for Guides, workshops and courses.
  • Curation: Update and integrate existing intellectual assets into relevant formats (ex. old blog posts and podcasts into new guides and more relevant posts).
  • Production: Produce audio, video, PDF, design elements and other content. Populate course sites for multiple products. Coordinate any necessary transcription, copywriting, video, audio, and/or design needs.
  • Coordination and Project Management: Participate in weekly meetings with CCO and other content creators on team projects. Hire and supervise contractors (e.g., writers, audio/video producers, editors, designers, proofers, creatives, writers, etc.) to ensure clear communication regarding deadlines, deliverables, etc.

WE’RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHO:

  • Dependably demonstrates a relentless obsession with values alignment, focus, simplicity, and clarity. Period
  • It’s not your first rodeo with leading teams AND project management Many of our projects take weeks or months to complete and have multiple people involved. Being a leader and an executor simultaneously is something you enjoy immensely, especially when you have the freedom to decide how it’s done!
  • It floats your boat when you think about creating world class really really helpful content: We want to push the boundaries of creating incredible value driven highly personalized, highly emotional and medium snarky content for our audience. We only want to put it’s ok if you’re drooling a bit right now.
  • You can execute much quicker than the average person: You’re used to running laps around the other people in corporate America
  • You can’t help making things better: Continuous improvement is a stupid term because it’s just a way of life for you.
  • Loves creating and marketing: In fact you’ve probably talked to someone about one of these in the last 24 hours… You can’t help it, it’s cool! Let your Nerd Flag fly!
  • you don’t have to google SEO: You do understand SEO in content marketing and have used it (with the URLs to prove it)
  • Knows what the backend of a wordpress site looks like, when I say trade out the images on the About page or replace the Payment links on the sales page it doesn’t faze you, you either already know what it is or you are confident you can figure it out.
  • Understands Direct Response Copywriting: You have a proven ability to get people to take action thru content. You enjoy the challenge of helping people move to action with words and visuals. (we will look for examples of this)
  • You probably have a blog or a website or even a biz of your own (or all of the above)
  • You find solutions: You can’t help it, when something goes wrong you have a “I will figure this out and make it happen” mentality about you!

This is a 100% remote work contract project position. It starts with a small project contract and depending on how you do will grow from there!

It’s paid both on retainer for services and results generated for Happen to Your Career.

WHAT WE VALUE AT HAPPEN TO YOUR CAREER

Here’s the way we run our business, if you can’t get behind these things then please don’t apply. This is what we live and breathe.

  • Be Ridiculously Helpful; We take care our people… and their people too! We treat others like humans and we exceed expectations in every interaction
  • Signature Strengths – We do what we are the best at and use our uniqueness and what we enjoy doing, we enable everyone around us do the same
  • Personal – We want every single touch to feel like we care – because we do!
  • One Life – We go for what scares us; we intentionally get outside our comfort zones and push ourselves and everyone we interact with for growth
  • Leverage – We use technology and systems to do anything that a human doesn’t need to.
  • Give Pareto a hug; we fail often and fast and make mistakes early and are transparent about them, We remove what isn’t working and relentlessly seek out and prioritize the top 4% of what works; We call this out every opportunity!

STILL INTERESTED?

Is this you? Or someone you know? Send them this page or click the button and apply now!

Keep in mind we don’t accept just anybody, we’re looking for someone who is excited about what we do and the things above fall into their personal strengths and potential!

Apply by clicking this link and filling out the form!

Questions? email support@happentoyourcareer.com

Apply for job

items.title: Associate Dean – School of Public Policy and Administration
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=24, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Associate Dean – School of Public Policy and Administration at Walden University

Remote

Institution Walden University

City: Virtual

GENERAL SUMMARY:

The associate dean is a full-time administrator position responsible for all facets of the academic leadership and management of the School of Public Policy and Administration at Walden University. Reporting to the Vice Provost, this role requires a dynamic leader who is able to develop a strategic vision for the academic area designed to enhance students’ academic success and graduates’ career success.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provision of academic leadership for the school.
  • Oversight and leadership of school activities related to program and curriculum development, implementation, and evaluation.
  • Recruitment and supervision of the school faculty and staff.
  • Lead and build a community of virtual faculty and staff.
  • Oversight of student and faculty scheduling for all school degree programs for all enrollment starts.
  • Active participation in cross-functional teams charged with the responsibility for managing school business operations.
  • Active participation in budget development for the school
  • Chairs the School Curriculum and Policy Committee, and participation in other University committees as appropriate or as invited.
  • Active representation of the school in activities related to the development of university policies on academic issues such as admissions, transfer of credit, etc.
  • Resolution of student and faculty issues, serving as the official appeal position within the school.
  • Collaboration with all internal and external service units and partners.
  • Works closely with partners in Digital Teaching and Learning to ensure that Walden Academic Champions are involved in the curriculum process by program and that the program and course content being planned are aligned with the school’s mission and vision, as well as the University’s.
  • Serves as the academic advocate all activities that impact the School of Public Policy and Administration

MANAGEMENT/SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

This full-time administrative leadership position is responsible for all facets of the leadership and oversight of the degree-level programs undertaken by Walden University in this school. The individual filling this position will provide leadership for staff and faculty, working directly with Program Directors who manage all facets of programs within this school. This person’s leadership will be particularly essential in phases of new program discussion and design, as well as curriculum design, implementation, and evaluation. Working with the Admissions team, the identified individual will make recommendations regarding admissions and transfer of credit policies and decisions. The Associate Dean provides recommendations for the budget planning for the college and has P&L responsibility for school’s instructional delivery budget.

PROBLEM-SOLVING

  • Demonstrated ability to analyze alternatives and make recommendations in problem resolutions
  • Familiar with customary business tools of problem analysis and able to apply them toward school issues and challenges, as well as opportunities

DIMENSIONS

  • Works to mentor those within the school
  • Collaborates with those disciplines outside the school that impact upon or work inter-departmentally with the school in achieving its goals

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

  • An earned doctorate in public policy, public administration, criminal justice, or related academic discipline
  • A significant record of intellectual and professional contributions to and experience in public policy, public administration, criminal justice, or related academic discipline
  • Content area expertise related to the school’s degree programs
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and the necessary characteristics to work with a strong administrative team to assure the continued success of a growing organization.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Experience in working in a distributed, matrixed organization is preferred
  • Operational and financial skills to manage budgets for large organizational units
  • Statistical knowledge to analyze data for outcomes assessment and program review
  • Program leadership experience at the postsecondary level
  • Commitment to advocating for the learning and development needs of students, most of whom are mid-career professionals, earning their degrees in a distance learning environment
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.
  • Ability to resolve system-based issues to improve unit operations.
  • Experience with accrediting associations is strongly preferred.
  • Fluent skills in working with electronic communication and office productivity tools
  • Experience in a for-profit, online environment highly desirable
  • Faculty advocate
  • The ideal candidate demonstrates evidence of compatibility with the Walden University mission of positive social change, broad access and professional excellence and our values of quality, integrity, and student-centeredness.
Apply for job

items.title: Paid Marketing Analyst / SEM Manager – B2B SaaS
items.content:
Paid Marketing Analyst / SEM Manager – B2B SaaS

Worldwide
Company: Schedugram

FULL-TIME

Overview

Schedugram helps our customers schedule and manage their content on Instagram. We work with customers from small businesses through to global brands, and everything in between.

We are looking for an experienced paid marketing analyst to lead our paid customer acquisition efforts. You will collaborate with our marketing team to make sure we’re generating cost-effective and qualified signups that convert to being a customer.

We have a fully remote team distributed around the world. We work hard to keep our customers around the globe happy, and we’re proud of our success over the last 4.5 years.

Your mission

The core mission of the paid marketing analyst is to improve our new MRR rate through increasing the number of new signups we get through paid acquisition channels (search, social and display). You’ll do this through analysing our campaigns day-to-day, and continuously making changes to turbocharge success.

Your role

We’ll know you are successful when you:

  • Cost-effectively acquire customers through paid channels
  • Launch new campaigns every month to identify what works best
  • Improve our MRR growth rate through paid marketing
  • Collaborate with the marketing team on integrated campaigns
  • Can run reports and quantitatively show your success to the team

Your Experience & Skills

You’re a fit for this role if you:

  • Have 3+ years working in a paid marketing role in a B2B SaaS company (required)
  • Know SaaS metrics in and out (required)
  • Have previously worked remotely (preferred)
  • Have used Hubspot in the past (preferred)
  • Deeply understand the ins and outs of Google AdWords (required – our primary paid channel)
  • Can write your own copy and test different iterations
  • Are data driven to the point that you think PivotTables would be a great person to hang out with
  • Understand the different paid acquisition channels available and their likely utility for our product
  • Love to report back to the team on your success

Some understanding or experience in social media management and/or social networks (from a business users’ perspective) is a plus.

Salary and remuneration

As a guide, we’re looking at a salary of US$45-55k for this role, with some flexibility for the right candidate if appropriate.

Apply for job

items.title: Digital Science Writer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Digital Science Writer

Writing
California or Washington States
Company: Bulletproof
Full Time

Overview

Bulletproof is an omni-channel content driven consumer products company. Our vision is to make high performance a daily reality for everyone by upgrading the earth’s coffee and food. Our mission is to help people perform better, think faster, and live better using a proven blend of ancient knowledge and new technologies, informed by science, and measured results from our customers. BP products help people live better by using fat for fuel, saying goodbye to sugar and supercharging mitochondria.

Bulletproof has a team of experienced entrepreneurs and biohackers working to make high performance a daily reality for everyone on the planet. While our culture is casual and our workplace flexible, everyone on the team is passionate, smart, focused and driven.

Our customers know that our coffee, beverages, food, and supplements are the purest you can get anywhere, and you can expect to feel a difference in how you perform the first time you experience them. Environmentally conscious and ethically sourced products build a sustainable foundation for future generations to thrive

Bulletproof is seeking a dynamic and talented digital journalist with a strong background in science-based health and wellness reporting to join the blog’s content team.

The ideal candidate geeks out over the latest scientific research, has a deep knowledge of the wellness space, and experience working at an online news or lifestyle site. Candidates must live in Washington State or California.

As the digital writer, you will write engaging stories across all verticals and mediums. That includes video scripts, social media captions, viral news commentary, listicles, and deeply researched and footnoted long-form features.  You know all the buzzwords (lectins, nootropics, mitochondria) and what they mean — and can point to a more than a few studies on each one. You also know the nutrition space intimately and can explain to anyone the difference between Paleo, Whole30, keto and Bulletproof.  You possess impeccable grammar, organization, clarity and accuracy, and are obsessive about formatting, style, and voice. You are inquisitive, full of great story ideas, and know how to write an irresistible headline. You’ve also never missed a deadline.  Bonus points for basic HTML, SEO, and on-camera experience.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Write rigorously researched, science-backed articles, meeting daily deadlines quickly and accurately.
  • Turn complicated scientific jargon into snappy and engaging video scripts.
  • Pitchclickable, science-backed content (infographics, videos, articles) according to search trends and what’s resonating in the wellness and biohacking spaces.
  • Be a scientific advisor to the editorial and social teams, providing easy-to-understand answers to our readers’ questions about the Bulletproof lifestyle, with links to studies that back up the advice.
  • Work with the social, photo, and video teams to help shape storytelling efforts.
  • Build content in WordPress, optimizing articles and images for search.

    • About You:
    • You live in WA or CA, or are willing to move there.
    • You nerd out on research. You read PubMed for fun. You know what good research looks like, and you seek it out.
    • You have demonstrated experience as a video journalist – writing scripts for YouTube and social media.
    • Your writing is scientific but accessible. Think … explaining the Krebs cycle to a 5th grader. Or describing mitochondria to a friend with zero science background.
    • You take the reins and run with them, requiring little oversight to get things done.
    • You love learning — and you really love grammar.
    • You’re curious about the Bulletproof Diet and lifestyle, and might even be willing to try it out to better understand your reader.

      • Skills and Experience:
      • Science writing/editing background is mandatory.
      • 3-5 years of professional editorial experience in a dynamic, deadline- and results-oriented environment, with the clips to prove it.
      • You have a portfolio of videos that demonstrate your script-writing ability.
      • The writing style chops to shift gears — one day you’re working on a deep-dive biohacking piece, the next day you’re writing a Whole30 recipe roundup.
      • Highly proficient in WordPress, MS Office Suite, project management, and editorial calendar software.
      • Some sense of visual design is a plus — you think about how to engage the reader with images and infographics as well as good writing.
      • Bachelor’s degree preferred in a related field such as journalism, nutrition, biology, psychology, neuroscience, medicine, or similar.
      • On-camera experience is a plus, but not mandatory

        • To apply:
        • Send us your resume and cover letter, telling us why you’d make the perfect fit.
        • Include the following 2-3 writing samples:
          • One showcasing your deep-dive research skills. Show off your chops at making a complex subject easily understood and fun. This article should have plenty of scientific references.

            • This is a full-time, work-from-home position working with a team of seasoned, creative journalists and thought leaders. At Bulletproof, we value balance, fun, and continually learning in work and play. Being Bulletproof is being intellectually curious and making the most of opportunities to grow personally and professionally. You are knowledgeable, reliable, innovative, and open.

            Think you’ve got what it takes?

            Let’s talk!

            To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://jobs.jobvite.com/bulletproof/job/o7027fw0 →

items.title: Long Term Blogger for SEO/Linkbuilding SaaS Blog
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Long Term Blogger for SEO/Linkbuilding SaaS Blog

Company: Monitor Backlinks
Location: Remote

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Monitor Backlinks is exactly what it sounds like—a tool to monitor your site's backlinks (+ competitor backlinks) along with other important SEO metrics: https://monitorbacklinks.com

We're hiring expert writers to share in-depth knowledge of SEO, backlinks and linkbuilding strategies on our blog: blog.monitorbacklinks.com.

This is not a ghostwriting position. You'll get full credit for your work, including a short bio (with a personal link) at the end of your post.

Payment is done via PayPal on the 14th each month (we will pay for the fees).

We're looking for writers who can:

  • dig deep into SEO/link-building topics and provide tons of valuable information and insights — beyond the basics, no fluff
  • capture the "friendly expert" voice and bring personality and humor to dry topics
  • write 2-4 blog posts per month
  • work in WordPress and our content marketing platform (CoSpot)

If you’re interested and you do an outstanding job, this can even develop into a part-time or full-time writing or editing position.

To Apply

If you’re interested, please send an email to editors [ at ] monitorbacklinks [ dot ] com and:

  • describe your experience with SEO/link-building
  • send 2-3 relevant writing samples (URLs of published blog posts preferred)
  • mention 2-3 headlines of blog posts you think might work on our blog.
  • tell us your competitive rate per 1200-word blog post
  • tell us if you're interested in editing work! (we're actively looking for a good editor to join us part time or full time)

Application Instructions

Send us an email per the application instructions above.

items.title: Email Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Email Marketing Manager at CommunityCo

Remote

The Community Company is seeking a full-time email marketing manager to join our marketing/communications team and help us strengthen relationships with our customers and prospects.

If you’re the right person for the job, you’ll have a track record of improving email performance and related business goals through methodical testing. You’ll also be a self-motivated, proactive thinker who can successfully work remotely. And because it’s a small team, you’ll bring both the ambition to take on increasing responsibility and the lack of ego required to get your hands dirty with the day-to-day.

Sound like you? Read more about The Community Company and the job requirements, then apply below.

What We Do
The Community Company is a provider of community-driven programs for media companies and global brands. Our communities include YEC, a council for the world’s most successful entrepreneurs, and branded councils in partnership with Forbes and other world-renowned names.

JOB SUMMARY/OBJECTIVE

We’re looking for an experienced email marketing manager to creatively evolve our sales and marketing emails from a strategy rooted in data. Responsibilities include:

  • Assist in the development and execution of both customer- and prospect-facing email strategies.
  • Responsible for improving all KPIs, including deliverability, open rate, click rate, conversion rate, opt-out rate, and related business goals.
  • Own the email calendar, including automations, testing, and related approvals.
  • Assist in the creative development of emails, including providing briefs to copywriters and graphic designers.
  • Delegate email tasks, as appropriate, to create an efficient, scalable process.
  • Proof and QA email campaigns to ensure 100% error free execution.
  • Design, implement, and analyze testing strategies.
  • Monitor and report on email analytics.
  • Manage relationships across the team to determine and gather appropriate content for each email, and ensure cross-channel campaign execution.
  • Identify areas for improved efficiency and scalability, such as automations, list segmentations, etc.
  • Continuously strive to be the subject matter expert on email marketing best practices

MUST-HAVE SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:

  • 3 or more post-college years of professional experience managing high-volume email campaigns
  • Bachelor’s degree, preferably in marketing or related field
  • Superior understanding of how to find and analyze relevant email data
  • Track record of successfully impacting email KPIs
  • Ability to read and edit HTML
  • Experience with a variety of email marketing platforms and CRMs
  • Impeccable proofreading skills and attention to detail
  • Experience building processes for others to follow
  • Ability to work independently and as a collaborative team member
  • Strong critical thinking skills
  • Experience working remotely preferred

THE IDEAL EMAIL MARKETING MANAGER …

  • Is VERY data-focused and naturally inquisitive
  • Has great time and project management skills and doesn’t want or require micromanaging
  • Is constantly seeking opportunities to develop and grow
  • Is energetic and persevering

IMPORTANT DETAILS:

  • This is a full-time, salaried position.
  • $50,000/year salary (to start) with growth opportunities based on performance
  • Optional health benefits kick in after a 60-day probationary period (company pays $375-$475/month depending on the plan selected)
  • Optional 401(k) with up to 4% company match
  • Vacation time for all major holidays, plus 2 weeks of PTO every year
  • Additional vacation time is negotiable based on individual’s performance
  • Location/Hours: This position is remote for candidates based in the United States. Candidates in the Boston area will have the option to work from our office.

TO APPLY, SEND YOUR COVER LETTER AND RESUME TO THE EMAIL BELOW WITH “EMAIL MARKETING MANAGER” IN THE SUBJECT LINE.

Candidates MUST include the following in their cover letter to be considered:

  1. What email tools/software do you have experience with?
  2. Details on how you’ve impacted KPIs in previous email marketing roles.
  3. Finally, please use your cover letter to tell us what makes you stand out. We already know you’re “writing to express your interest” in the role. Don’t say that. Explain why you’re the perfect person for this job.

Please note that this job description is not designed to cover a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required for this role and responsibilities may change at any time.

Apply for job

items.title: Marketing Communications Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Marketing Communications Designer at ReCharge

Remote

at ReCharge

Remote

We’re looking for a confident, experienced, and talented graphic designer with strong interests and capabilities in the design and development of engaging user experiences. Our ideal candidate is someone who loves to focus on minimal, clean, and thoughtful user interfaces, while also ensuring that graphic elements are used intentionally to enhance the customer’s experience.

With over 10,000 Shopify merchants launching subscriptions and over 1,000,000 subscribers powered by ReCharge, your talents will be the creative force behind an up and coming brand and empower thousands of online stores and hundreds of thousands of shoppers.

Does this sound like you?

  • You thrive at providing both highly analytical and highly creative ideas to a design engagement.
  • You’re self-driven, great at running with ideas and executing them independently.
  • You’re resourceful: you figure out what needs to be done, and you find ways to make it happen.
  • You thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills.
  • You’re independent, with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication.
  • You work with a sense of urgency and get things done.
  • You believe in what we’re doing and you’re excited to help ReCharge grow.

Responsibilities:

  • Each day will be a new design/creative challenge on a variety of projects from branding and layouts to presentations and web design.
  • Create web graphics and marketing collateral consistent with our brand image
  • Solving design problems while wearing multiple hats
  • Collaborate with the marketing team and the front end engineers to launch projects
  • Design blog and email campaign assets weekly

Requirements:

  • 4+ years experience in a similar role at a B2B SaaS company
  • Experience in internal marketing organizations or marketing/advertising agencies
  • Expertise with industry leading software (Adobe Creative Cloud – Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator; Sketch)
  • Experience in a fast-paced and innovative development environment is essential.
  • Thorough understanding of contemporary user-centered design methodologies is a must.
  • A deep understanding of the end to end iterative UX process, including personas, scenarios, wire-framing, and high fidelity visuals.
  • A keen eye for good design, attention to detail and soft spot for the end user; advocating for them in all areas of your work is core to what you do.
  • Basic understanding of Javascript, HTML, CSS.

About ReCharge:

We have two missions at ReCharge: make it easy for people to sell subscription products online, and make our company an amazing place to work. The first mission began as three people working out of a small apartment, trying to solve one of the biggest problems facing Shopify merchants: recurring payments. Now we’re at the forefront of recurring billing software, empowering thousands of entrepreneurs to sell their products as subscriptions, and processing tens of millions of dollars in sales every week.

Our culture is remote-first and we stay connected every day using Slack and video chat. Being part of a small, fast-growing company is exciting: the opportunities to grow and take ownership at ReCharge are endless and we’ll make sure you have everything you need to do your best work and make a big impact.

ReCharge is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Apply for job

items.title: Public Relations Director
items.content:
Public Relations Director

Anywhere in the US
Company: The Humane League

FULL-TIME

Overview

WHO WE ARE

The Humane League is an international farm animal advocacy group. At The Humane League, we foster a high-energy culture of teamwork and mission-driven problem solving, and we have earned recognition as Top Charity from Animal Charity Evaluators for all of their rating periods. Over the past few years, The Humane League has strategically positioned itself for growth. We are currently a team of 70+ committed individuals, dispersed across the country and the world. We are looking for a PR Director to bring our mission, campaigns and meaningful stories to major media and influencers, for high-impact exposure and relationship development on behalf of our organization and the animals we work for every day.

YOUR OPPORTUNITY

Your position plays an integral role in building The Humane League’s credibility and exposing our mission, our movement and our work to media and influencers—those who reach and impact millions of people.

We want you because you have a mission and values-centered approach to your life and your work. You are ideal for this position because you have a rich background of experience in Communications and/or PR and media relations, with a proven track record in securing highly visible feature stories in leading national and international media outlets and local publications. Critically, you possess persuasive written and verbal communications skills, an active network of applicable media and influencer contacts, and a can do, relentless and inherently positive attitude.

This is a full-time, remote position with a preference for candidates in NY & LA, along with occasional travel.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Build, implement and lead our PR strategy, focused on securing prominent exposure with local, national and international media outlets and with key influencers.
  • Coordinate all PR activities, including: crafting and disseminating big creative media pitches, 1:1 outreach and press releases.
  • Lead media/influencer events, from start-to-finish, as needed, in-line with our agreed upon strategy.
  • Create and manage our target media and influencer lists, including those in mainstream news, business, science, animal welfare, food, philanthropy and activism.
  • Leverage existing media and influencer relationships, and cultivate new contacts.
  • Oversee our media speaking points and FAQ’s, including creating or updating the content.
  • Media train our Grassroots, Open Wing Alliance (and other) team members in talking to the media, managing interviews and conducting follow-ups.
  • Partner with, and support, our Int’l communications team members in developing local PR strategies and leading local media and influencer relations.
  • Work intra-departmentally with our Campaigns team and across the organization to ensure our messaging is powerful, clear, consistent and optimized.
  • Manage our press portal and update media mentions, as needed, on our website.
  • Collaborate closely with our communications team, our Grassroots team and others to reach our PR goals and support the broader organization’s aims.
  • Monitor and evaluate success on a quarterly and ongoing basis.
  • Ensure cohesive and consistent brand messaging across our media and influencer relations messaging, in-line with our organization-wide messaging.
  • Maintain a knowledge of changing trends in media and influencer relations and within the animal protection sectors.
  • Manage our strategic and day-to-day PR work with sensitivity, upholding and building our positive reputation.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required Skills

  • Experience working in PR / Communications with agencies, non-profits or for profit organizations.
  • Excellent persuasive written and verbal communications skills.
  • A knack for building relationships with targeted national, local and international media across a variety of mediums, including: online media, print media, broadcast and podcasts/radio.
  • A proven track record in securing highly visible feature stories in leading media outlets.
  • Influencer relations experience, working with celebrities and/or influencers.
  • Experience crafting big creative media pitches, 1:1 outreach and press releases.
  • A cultivated, and active, network of applicable media and influencer contacts
  • Experience leading others and proven ability to do so—ideally through direct management, or through project leadership.
  • Experience critically contributing to an overarching Communications strategy.
  • Experience conducting media trainings / providing strategic interview counsel for team members.
  • A can do, relentless and inherently positive attitude.
  • An authentic alignment with our mission and animal protection work.

Desired Skills

  • A strong working knowledge, and professional use, of social media platforms, such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, Pinterest, Tumblr, Reddit.
  • Experience in crisis communications / crisis management.
  • Experience with project management processes and programs, such as Asana.

Starting salary $59,000, commensurate with experience.

Employees enjoy full medical coverage, optional dental and vision packages, a 401(k) retirement plan, working from home, flexible holiday and vacation time, room for advancement, and the supportive environment at The Humane League!

The Humane League is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Women, people of color, people with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. In compliance with laws and in furtherance of our commitment to fostering an environment that welcomes and embraces diversity, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

Apply for job

items.title: Security Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=38, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Security Analyst at Defiant

Remote | International

Defiant, makers of the WordPress security plugin Wordfence, is a fast-moving cybersecurity company that delivers the best threat protection for WordPress sites.

We’re a 100% remote team, nimble, self managing and work in a relaxed atmosphere with a sense of humor. Rather than working for a mega-corp, you will be working in a company where your work has real impact in the fun, high-growth stages of our evolution.

We are looking for security analysts to join our forensics team. You will assist our customers to investigate how their site was hacked and to repair their site and remove all traces of the intrusion. In addition to this you will also collect evidence from intrusions that will help improve our threat detection. You will need to determine how the intrusion occurred and then collect all IOC’s (indicators of compromise) and share this data with our product team in a structured way.

General requirements:

  • You must be highly technical and be comfortable with a wide range of open source tools.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You must work well in a team.
  • You must be nimble, be able to come up with creative solutions to challenging problems and must have a mature approach to problem solving.
  • Attention to detail.

Note: Applicants who can work weekends will be given priority consideration.

We have the highest star rating for any WordPress plugin in history and we pride ourselves on providing an excellent product with great customer service that helps secure small and large production websites. If you’re passionate about information security and would like to help secure the web, this is your dream job. We take our team’s family time seriously and don’t ask you to work long hours if we can avoid it (we almost always can). Our entire team works remotely using Slack for casual interaction so you can live practically anywhere in the world as long as you have an internet connection. Defiant is high growth, but we are not a startup. The company is still controlled by the founders, we are profitable and have been for many years. So you will enjoy the rush of high growth but you won’t have to risk working for a company that is controlled by venture capitalists or may not be here tomorrow.

REQUIREMENTS

At Defiant, trust’ is the attribute we value most highly among our team members. We need to know that you can grab a task from a support ticketing system, communicate clearly with our customers and see the task to completion with excellent attention to detail. We don’t micromanage and we trust that you will be able to see tasks through to completion and communicate with your fellow team members when needed or ask for help when needed. You will be working for a company that has code protecting over 2 million production websites. It is a fast paced real-time environment with new challenges daily.

The specific skills we require for this position are:

  • At least 5 years of experience administering LAMP systems.
  • Ability to program in PHP and Javascript. Other languages like Python a strong plus.
  • Understanding of SQL and ability to use the mysql client.
  • Experience investigating hacked websites, determining how the intrusion occurred and removing the intrusion and restoring the site to a fully functional state.
  • An understanding of all major vulnerability types and the ability to explain them to a customer.
  • Ability to analyze web log files and determine how an intrusion occurred.
  • Must be able to use Linux shell tools like grep, find and any other utility that can assist with investigation and remediation.
  • An understanding of regular expressions is a strong plus.
  • Experience with WordPress required.
  • You must be well versed in information security and any certifications you already have in penetration testing or forensics are a strong plus.

BENEFITS

Full-time positions include the following benefits:

  • Company pays 100% employee premium, 50% of dependents: platinum level medical, dental, vision.
  • 21 days PTO.
  • 401(k) with company match.
  • Stock options.
  • Latest in laptop and workstation technology to do an awesome job from anywhere in the world.
  • Company paid local gym membership.
  • Full time telecommuting with flexible hours where you can set your own schedule and work from anywhere.

HIRING PROCESS

We have a unique process that we use when it comes to hiring our forensic and remediation team. It works as follows:

  • The initial step is to fill in the form provided in this application. This is very important because we look at your answers to this form before we look at any other part of your application. The way you answer our form will largely determine if your application moves on to the next step.
  • If approved, we will ask you to clean a hacked site. This is on a virtual machine hosted at Linode that we have infected with malware on purpose. This will be a paid engagement and you will be paid $100 for your time, even though this is a simulation.
  • If you are able to successfully clean the hacked sample site, you will move on to a final phone interview via Skype. This may include some technical questions and you will need to have a computer and keyboard in front of you and be able to share your screen via Skype.
  • If you are successful, you will join our fast paced team and start contributing valuable research to Defiant and the larger online community. All Security Analyst positions start on a paid 3 week trial contract that is available part-time (at least 15 hours per week) with flexible hours.

Note: All contracts and offers of employment are contingent on successful completion of a background check. The results of the background check are considered as they relate to the position and do not automatically disqualify someone from a contract or employment with the company

Apply for job

items.content:
Marketing Analyst – Affiliate Marketing at PartnerCentric

Remote

TELECOMMUTE United States

PartnerCentric, a fully-remote performance marketing agency, is looking for a marketing analyst to join our growing team! items.content:
Product Owner

Company: Novate IT Ltd
Location: Cwmbran
Permanent

Product Owner - iOS , Android - Cwmbran

A brand new role with a highly successful and growing employer in South Wales for a Product Owner to work across a variety of video - centric projects for their platform. A generous starting salary is offered plus benefits such as up to 10% bonus, flexi time, a 25 day holiday allowance that will increase with service, life assurance, 3% employee 6% employer initial pension package and private health care.

The company have several applications that are used by consumers on a global scale across both mobile and web platforms, these applications handle huge amounts of data with no downtime or stress on their systems. They are now looking to hire a Product Owner to help drive product development with local and remote scrum teams.

You will have experience of working in an Agile environment helping local and remote teams of cross-functional developers understand user stories and promote the company's product vision. You will be working on iOS and Android projects so you must have knowledge of both. You will also be able to balance utilising good functionality, user experience and product design. On the technical side solid experience of understanding test automation, continuous integration and deployment as well as evaluating current engineering standards and suggesting improvements is essential. Any experience of working on a video streaming, digital television, media player or similar project will be a huge benefit. As you will be interacting with a huge variety of users, developers and managers excellent communication skills are extremely important.

If you're looking to step up into a Product Owner role or grow further from your current job, joining an established company who are looking to improve their user's experience through new innovative products across iOS and Android then send in your CV today!

Novate IT Ltd is a leading supplier of permanent and contract recruitment services for companies in the IT, Digital Media and Telecommunications industries.

items.title: Marketing Copywriter
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=5, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Marketing Copywriter at StartUp Health

Remote
  • New York, NY
  • Full Time
  • Mid Level

Do you love to write copy that sings, inspires, and tells a story? Are you a pro at writing headlines, tweets, or web content that catches a reader’s attention and packs a punch? Do you excel at thinking outside the box to create impactful marketing materials? Are you looking for a role at a mission-driven organization, focused on collaborating with entrepreneurs who are working to achieve Health Moonshots? If you answered YES to these questions, we want to meet you!

StartUp Health is hiring an imaginative and skilled marketing copywriter to join our team. This person will write compelling, clear, and strategic content across a variety of mediums, including coaching curriculum and company messaging, while maintaining (and shaping) StartUp’s Health voice. This is a unique opportunity for your work and your impact to be professionally and personally rewarding, contributing greatly to our mission to improve the health and wellbeing of everyone in the world. This new role reports to our Media Director and is a remote work opportunity (candidates do not need to be based in NYC to apply). Please include a link to writing samples in your application.

Responsibilities

  • Create copy for email campaigns, website, social media and other types of web and presentation-based content
  • Collaborate closely with colleagues to develop program-specific messaging, value props, and benefit-driven copy
  • Define and maintain a consistent, engaging voice across all media properties, as well as making sure content is accurate and appropriate
  • Write all content in alignment with brand guidelines, positioning, and editorial style guide
  • Keep all style guides, statistics and reference documents up to date, for use by broader team
  • Pitch in on additional media needs and projects

Our Ideal Candidate

  • 3+ years professional writing experience, preferably at a marketing agency or creative shop.
  • Exceptional writing skills and strong editorial judgment; can rapidly absorb ideas and distill them into accessible copy for diverse audiences.
  • A willingness to gain a deep understanding of the StartUp Health brand and adopt its voice; the ability to switch vocabulary, tone and style depending on the audience
  • Receptive to having work edited by peers; enthusiastically receives and acts on feedback
  • Experience using data and engagement analytics tools to report on and learn from content performance and audience growth. Familiarity with SEO strategies best practices.
  • Flexibility to jump between different projects while delivering high quality results, often on tight deadlines
  • Entrepreneurial-minded and comfortable in a fast-paced, startup environment with a make stuff happen mentality
  • Adept at working remotely and thrives in a results only working environment (ROWE)
  • Advanced knowledge of cloud-based platforms including Slack, Google for Business, Dropbox

About StartUp Health

In 2011, StartUp Health introduced a new model for transforming health by investing in a global army of coachable entrepreneurs who are committed to achieving health moonshots. With the world’s largest digital health portfolio (245+ companies spanning six continents, 20 countries, and 70+ cities), StartUp Health is mobilizing this rapidly growing army along with the world’s batteries included’ leaders, innovators, and investors to achieve 10 Health Moonshots, with a 25-year mission to improve the health and wellbeing of everyone in the world. Founded by Steven Krein and Unity Stoakes, StartUp Health is chaired by former Time Warner CEO Jerry Levin. Notable strategic partners and investors include Allianz, Aurora Health Care, Bayer, California Health Care Foundation, Steve Case, Mark Cuban, Esther Dyson, Brad Feld, Genentech, GE Ventures, GuideWell, Kaiser Permanente Ventures, Masimo, Ping An, SAP, and SeventySix Capital.

Mindset of a StartUp Health Team Member:

  • Long-Term Commitment – you are all in and committed long-term to our mission
  • Supportive Relationships – you are continually surrounded by like-minded team members
  • Quarterly & Weekly Rhythm – you recalibrate every 90 days and start each week with a sense of purpose
  • Confidently Ambitious – you always convey confidence regardless of the obstacles
  • Self-Aware – you are coachable, aware of your unique abilities, and leverage the unique abilities of colleagues
  • Healthy Habits – you take care of yourself, have a clear mind and body, and regularly practice gratitude
  • Value Creator – you are continually making your future bigger than your past
  • Batteries Included – you always provide energy to others and have no tolerance for those who drain energy
Apply for job

items.title: Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
One in five households in the UK live in social housing, a sector with the right values at its core but that has historically struggled to deploy innovations in the home. Many residents still can’t afford to heat their homes and live in cold, mouldy properties they can’t be proud of. At Switchee, we believe that everyone deserves to live in a decent home and that the environments we inhabit have a massive influence on our ability to enjoy life and prosper.

We may be only three years old, but it’s already been quite a ride! Our first product, the internet connected Switchee thermostat is already in 35 of the biggest housing providers in the UK. We’re growing 100% year on year and are backed by some of the best-known investors in technology and social impact.

To strengthen our small team of 15 passionate and ambitious people we are looking for an outstanding individual to join us as

*Marketing* *Manager*.

We are driven by a collective desire to make a positive impact in the housing sector, both for residents and landlords, so your commitment to our values and mission are paramount.

*Your* *responsibilities*

As Marketing Manager you will play an important role by supporting all of Switchee’s marketing efforts, owning a number channels and producing content strategies and collateral. On joining you will be exposed to all commercial and operational aspects of the business. Depending on requirements and the specific development plan we agree with you, you will gain experience in ops and customer account management / support teams so that you have a full understanding of Switchee before taking up your role in marketing.

Being more specific, you will:

* Work closely with our CEO, CCO, Head of Sales as well as Head of Marketing
* Contribute to the development of Switchee’s marketing strategy
* Generate insightful, thought provoking written content
* Brief partners to deliver engaging visual & press content
* Manage online and social media marketing & advertising campaigns
* Manage social media (Twitter & LinkedIn)
* Organise attendance at conferences – negotiating exhibitor plots and speaking slots
* Work with the sales team to produce relevant sales and marketing collateral
* Work with operations and resident support to design and produce resident communications
* Prepare quarterly and annual reports


We are a company built on a strong technical foundation. You’ll need to grasp and communicate a technical solution with clients. We also expect you to work closely with Product Development to ensure our product evolves with the customer’s needs at the very centre.



*Your* *experience*

We firmly believe extraordinary people can come from a wide range of places – but we wouldn’t be surprised if the person who gets this role has:

* At least 2 years’ experience in marketing
* Bachelor’s degree from a top university
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proven ability to develop and implement effective marketing strategies
* Strong analytical & numeracy skills with command of Excel
* B2B experience preferred

Nice to have:

* Experience in a small & quickly expanding business preferred
* Knowledge of the housing sector preferred
* Experience working with Internet of Things devices

*You*

We are a diverse bunch of people at Switchee. That said, there are some characteristics we always look for:

* You deeply care about Switchee’s mission; you have a desire to build something revolutionary, that will disrupt an industry, and positively impact ordinary people’s lives.
* You care about the environment, are interested in energy efficiency and have thought about the challenges and opportunities posed by an evolving domestic energy market
* You like technology and neat solutions to complex problems
* You thrive on challenge and change; you naturally gravitate to the hardest questions first and love thinking differently to solve them.
* You are biased towards action and you’re happiest when you’re ‘getting stuff done’.
* You’re open, positive & straightforward. You’re not afraid to stand up for your convictions, even when it’s hard to do so.
* You delight in your colleagues’ successes and thrive on your failures; you grasp any opportunity for learning and constantly seek to improve.


*Our* *mission*

We believe that radical innovation in internet connected technology can ensure that every resident, every day, is living in a home that allows them to succeed. That’s why our products are built not just on great technology, but on an understanding of what people want from the space they live in.

This approach led us to reimagine the most mundane household object, a thermostat, into a product that automagically reduces energy bills, looks great and offers control to those who want it.

We are also revolutionising the way social landlords manage their housing stock with an obsessively tailored SAAS property dashboard and handy alerts on things like when the boiler is going to break.

Our next project is to build the ultimate connected hub for the social home. It’s going to revolutionise the way residents interact with their properties and landlords manage their homes.



*Life* *at* *Switchee*

We like to keep things simple and flexible at Switchee and consider you to be joining our family. We don’t currently track holidays so you’re free to take as much as you need. We occasionally work remotely but are sensitive to the needs of our colleagues.

We socialise together with regular outings in London and an annual “working remotely” trip where you have the option (but not obligation) to join us in working from a fun location.

If we end up working together, we can offer a competitive salary and a generous stake in the company.

If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now! Please be in touch soon as we’ll proceed once the right person is found. If you’d like to apply please submit a CV and cover letter on our Careers page.

items.title: PRODUCT MANAGER at Mediavine
items.content:
PRODUCT MANAGER

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Advertising, Advertising Technology, Publishing
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Mediavine | No office location

Technologies

project-management

Job description

We are looking for someone to take over the current product development process and evolve it based upon their own experiences and past successes. Our ideal candidate will be able to juggle multiple products and define priorities for features and issues based on organizational goals and department needs. They will need to understand the big picture but also help us plan out engineering sprints and flush out the detail needed for individual stories.

As a Product Manager at Mediavine, you can expect to:

  • Serve as the bridge between upper management and the teams tasked with the execution of the product.
  • Take ownership for all product roadmaps, both internal and external, and oversee development for those products
  • Create a feasible plan that achieves the goals and objectives of the product and aligns with the organization’s overall business strategy.
  • Be in constant communication with stakeholders, reporting on progress
  • Be responsible for the direction, coordination, implementation, executive, control and completion of project, while remaining aligned with strategy, commitments and goals of the organization.

Requirements:

  • 4+ years experience in a product management role
  • Located within the United States
  • Ability to empathize with customers and anticipate their needs
  • Superb organizational skills
  • Excellent interpersonal abilities with the ability to stay focused on goals while making sure everyone's voice is heard


Bonus points for:

  • Experience working with Agile Frameworks like SCRUM
  • An “eye” for User Experience/Design
  • Background in software engineering and/or experience with software architecture
  • Previous remote workplace experience
  • Experience with navigating growing development teams
Apply now

About Mediavine

Mediavine, a fast-growing advertising management company representing over 3500 websites in the food, lifestyle, and entertainment space. Benefits for working for us include:

  • Work from home! In your pajamas!
  • Exciting, fast-paced environment
  • Comprehensive Benefits package Including 401k match, Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
  • Travel opportunities
  • Generous Vacation/Time off policies

Benefits

  • Travel
  • Flexible Hours
  • Work Remote
  • Comprehensive Benefits
  • Work with emerging Tech
  • 401k

items.title: Marketing Manager, Saas
items.content:
Marketing Manager, Saas at Filestage

Remote | International

About Us

At Filestage we believe that broken workflows poison teams with miscommunication, friction, and frustration. Our mission is to fuel creative teams with a rock-solid workflow. With our software, we empower people to produce great results together and build healthy and meaningful relationships at work. Over 500 companies (and growing!) all over the world like Lufthansa, Can Tire or Jung von Matt benefit from happier and more productive employees with Filestage. We work hard to build great things together and make time to celebrate our accomplishments.

Your mission:

  • You own marketing. You plan and execute the strategy to attract new people, win marketing qualified leads, and move users through each stage of the marketing funnel.
  • You lead all marketing activities. You create marketing ideas, prioritize actions, implement tactics and ensure that we’re moving in the right direction.
  • You create a marketing machine. You make sure that we grow steadily and win new clients by attracting quality leads. So you build, coach and grow the marketing team and you create the right environment to grow.

You’re good at:

  • You’re a strategic thinker with a creative mindset and analytical skills. You’re familiar with KPIs, can think outside of the box, enjoy networking with people, and like marketing strategy.
  • You’re passionate about marketing and growth. You have professional work experience in marketing. Ideally B2B SaaS/Software. You’re an expert in online marketing, partnerships and/or content.
  • You take ownership. You are filled with passion to take responsibility and to make things happen. You are an energetic self-starter who wants to make a tangible impact on a rapidly growing product and company.
  • You are a team player. You understand that we can only be successful as a team. Like everyone else in our great team, you are fair, honest and respectful and you are ready to have a lot of fun.
  • You are fluent in English. German is a nice-to-have.

This is what you get:

  • You have the freedom to work wherever you want. Come work with us at our office in Stuttgart (Germany) or work remotely.
  • Your opinion matters and your work is valued. You have the chance to make a difference. You have a steep learning curve by working hands-on together with highly talented minds.
  • Are you tired of useless meetings and slow decision making? We have flat hierarchies, no bullshit meetings and we move fast.
  • You work with top-notch technologies and lean processes. We use Slack, Asana, Hangouts and of course Filestage to communicate efficiently.
Apply for job

items.title: Epic Analytics Developer I - Cheyenne Regional Medical Center - Cheyenne, WY
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Epic Analytics Developer I

Company: Cheyenne Regional Medical Center
Location: Cheyenne, WY 82001
ROLE SUMMARY

The Epic Analytics Developer I is proficient in the organization’s clinical and/or revenue workflows and is organization’s expert report writing. This individual acts as the liaison between operations and data; is responsible for the quality and accuracy of reports produced by the Epic Reporting team.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Design business intelligence reporting platform utilizing Epic data.

2. Provides report specific advice for design and solutions for reporting needs.

3. Advises customers and recommends reporting options using reporting expertise.

4. Escalates potential system and work effort risks; contributes to status updates.

5. Sets priorities for reporting requests and works with the requesting customers to understand the prioritization.

6. Uses the full portfolio of Epic and non-Epic reporting tools available.

7. Responsible for maintaining existing reports and analyzes/evaluates requirements for changes, system upgrades, etc. while preserving data integrity and quality control of reports.

8. Reviews upgrade documentation related to Clarity features and released Crystal reporting content and determines how to implement the changes.

9. Assists end-users in the interpretation and integration of reports.

10. Construct testing scripts to validate system parameters and functionality performs as specified with application teams for accuracy of reports.

11. Assists with onboarding new employees as needed.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified and employees may be required to perform other duties as assigned.

SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, EXPECTATIONS, AND ABILITIES

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong Analytical and problem solving skills
  • Ability to work both independently and in teams
  • Ability to independently prioritize work assignments, meet deadlines and manage multiple projects and/or priorities
  • Proficient with SQL and relational database concepts, including primary keys, foreign keys, and joins
  • Ability to use report writing tools such as Business Objects
  • Proficient in developing a test plan and executing test scenarios for system readiness
  • Able to cross train to other areas if necessary
  • Skilled with data warehouses, data stores, and data marts
  • Comfortable facilitating communication amongst technical and non-technical project staff and stakeholders
  • Expert in translating user requirements into functional and design specifications
  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment, problem solve and develop solutions
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, email, intranet, internet, and other IT systems.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Two years of experience in Information Technologies
  • One year of healthcare experience
  • Epic certification in at least one application and/or able to achieve Epic certification within 90 days of last class
  • Able to maintain Continue Epic Education requirements for certification
  • Able to travel for training or work with remote clients
  • Available outside of normal business hours
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s Degree in relevant area
  • Two years of experience in design, architecting, implementation and support of relational databases including use of SQL query techniques to access relational databases
  • One year of project based experience

Creative Designer (APAC)

Company: In Marketing We Trust
Headquarters: Sydney, Australia
http://inmarketingwetrust.com.au/
Due to In Marketing We Trust’s tremendous growth, we are looking for a creative and pragmatic Designer, you will have the ability to interpret our clients’ briefs and needs, work independently and design solutions with high visual impact and consideration. 

Here Is What You Need To Succeed
  • Produce multiple engaging, relevant designs.
  • Ensure designs are tailored towards client budgets.
  • Work with a wide range of media and use graphic design and video software.
  • Think creatively and develop new design concepts, graphics and layouts.
  • Be capable of delivering clear rationale for your designs (remember pragmatic, yet creative!)
  • Have the ability to present and articulate ideas in client meetings (via video)
  • Amend final designs to clients’ comments and gain full approval

You are expected to work effectively with the wider team, including PPC, SEO, Content and Social Media team members.

Your Experience
  • A minimum of 7 years creative marketing experience is required.
  • Proven visualisation and graphic design experience.
  • Possession of creative flair, versatility, conceptual/visual ability and originality.
  • Demonstrable a strong portfolio of previous work across marketing channels.
  • The understanding of marketing messages, copyrighting, and direct client liaison would be advantageous in the role.
  • Ability to interact, communicate and present ideas.
  • Advanced knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Up to date with industry leading software and technologies.
  • Highly proficient in all design aspects.
  • Professionalism regarding time, costs and deadlines.

Duration
On demand as a freelance contractor.

What We Offer You

A highly collaborative remote working environment, where teamwork is championed, and ideas shared - you will be someone who is unafraid of contributing ideas and happy to work as part of a remote team and in exchange for your hard work, we can give you an unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing business to achieve your lifestyle goals.

Apply for this position

If you can see yourself in this remote role and feel you can add to the ongoing success of In Marketing We Trust, then apply now via - https://www.inmarketingwetrust.com.au/about/careers/

items.content:
About Voltaware


Voltaware is a dynamic London-based start-up at the forefront of energy monitoring and electricity usage itemisation.

We’re developing machine learning algorithms and building UX optimised interfaces to deliver real data insights to business and domestic users.


The Team

You’ll be joining an international team of entrepreneurs, engineers and designers with a history of successful application development and an enthusiasm for innovation and developing cutting edge applications.

Product Owner for Electricity Data Intelligence Startup



The Position
We are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic product owner to ensure the success of our product line-up. You will be in charge of understanding user and client needs and translate them into business cases.
We also expect you to liaise with our Data Science team and understand what is possible and how to embed knowledge into our products. Data Science is a rapidly evolving and exciting field with huge potential. We want you to be a part of it and help us realise its full potential with break-through products never seen before!
Join us for a journey instead of a job!

Responsibilities

Maximise the value of the product, contributing to efficient deliveries and satisfied customers
Liaise with clients to understand their use cases and translate them into product strategy
Ongoing management of functional specifications and change requests throughout the entire life-cycle of development projects
Produce high quality use cases and requirement documents
Work hand in hand with the development team, following the agile sprints as product owner
Manage development backlog according to the product strategy
Maintain and communicate the product road map to the management team
Interact regularly with the sales and distribution teams to gather feedback from the field
Regularly participate in client meetings and field implementations



Requirements:

Enthusiastic about technology and innovation
Strong oral and written communication skills are essential!
Ability to work in a distributed and highly multicultural team



Preferred Experience:

Have worked on a project involving machine learning and data science
Previous product owner roles preferable
Experience working with start-ups
Have worked with international and remote teams
French or Italian languages is a plus



In addition to your CV, please submit the answer to the following question:

What excites you about working in a start-up?

items.content:
UX Designer (APAC)

Company: In Marketing We Trust
Headquarters: Sydney, Australia
https://www.inmarketingwetrust.com.au
Is user behavior at the heart of everything you do?
Do you like to reveal these insights to improve content, design and strategic decisions?
Do you want to join a team that embraces remote working?

Due to In Marketing We Trust’s tremendous growth, we are looking for a skilled UX Designer to create amazing experiences for our clients' websites and mobile apps. You will manage the delivery of UX project deliverables for specific clients and projects. 

Your focus will be on translating high-level client needs into specific UX designs and ensuring that the work is done with efficiency, effectiveness and quality.
Here Is What You Need To Succeed
You are used to leading discovery, as well as design activities. You must be able to bring (client) stakeholders along the journey and provide compelling user insights at every stage of discovery and design.
 
You are passionate about working collaboratively with your team members to help define and implement end-to-end customer experiences that deliver tangible business results.

  • You ideate, explore and collaborate on user-centric concepts, prototypes, wireframes, user journeys, mock-ups and UI visuals to explore a range of solutions.
  • You have experience running or participating in UX insight activities, such as; user research, ideation sessions, usability testing, co-creation workshops, stakeholder interviews.
  • You facilitate user testing, obtaining and analysing quantitative and qualitative feedback.
  • You actively contribute to a remote work culture where your collaborative approach, communication skills and gravitas are at the heart of the client's requirements.

Your Experience
You have experience as a UX Designer, working in a web and app environment to create interactive prototypes, wireframes, work-flow storyboards, journey maps, mock-ups and UI outputs.

  • You have the ability to work autonomously, whilst quickly and efficiently gathering and distiling complex requirements.
  • You are familiar with agile methodology and iterative design processes.
  • You have demonstrated interest in good UX & UI design, and what this means for both the end user and service provider.
  • You are proficient in using popular UX tools such as Sketch, Axure, InVision, Adobe suite.
  • You have an understanding of core digital technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, Javascript iOS and Android.
  • You have experience of working on web comparison services and conversation rate optimisation (a plus).
  • You maintain awareness of latest technologies, software, hardware, best practices and developments within the UX and design community.
  • You have excellent written and spoken communication skills; the ability to communicate with impact, ensuring complex information is articulated in a meaningful way to wide and varied.

Duration
Project base (20-25 hours per week), with potential to go 'permanent' part-time.

What We Offer You
A highly collaborative remote working environment, where teamwork is championed, and ideas shared - you will be someone who is unafraid of contributing ideas and happy to work as part of a remote team and in exchange for your hard work, we can give you an unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing business to achieve your lifestyle goals.

Apply for this position

If you can see yourself in this remote role and feel you can add to the ongoing success of In Marketing We Trust, then apply via - https://www.inmarketingwetrust.com.au/about/careers/

items.title: Public Relations - Campaign Manager
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Part Time

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: PR Volt; 1-10 employees; 75-100% remote;

SKILLS:
• Media Relations
• Google Docs
• Public Relations
• Microsoft Excel
• Press Releases
• Cision
• Copywriting
• Content Writing

PR Volt has developed a custom approach that hacks the traditional PR system to yield incredible results for our clients. The media accolades speak for themselves. In just a short amount of time our clients have been featured in People, CNN, The Today Show, Huffington Post, AOL, Good Morning America, EXTRA and much more.

In this role, you will be responsible for developing media lists, generating pitch angles, writing compelling brand pitches, and sending them to editors on behalf of our clients. Writing compelling emails that editors can't help but open and read will be your North Star.

Your ability to understand client needs and develop unique ways of presenting their products and services is outstanding. You are very creative, but also organized to the T. Your Excel skills are superb and your experience with CISION and Slack are unrivaled.

You're also passionate about startups and technology and you're interested in disrupting the PR space. You know the difference between editorial and advertorial calendars and long lead and short lead pitching.

If this sounds like you, please apply!

Please note that this job is 100% remote!

REQUIREMENTS
You have significant experience with:

*Developing media lists (you know CISION inside out)
*Generating pitch angles for client campaigns
*Writing compelling brand pitches that editors can't help but open and read
*Account management and keeping clients happy

You have the following skill set:

*Incredible copywriting skills
*Data driven (your excel skills are superb)
*Tech-savvy (you love getting your hands dirty with new apps/tech and are always looking for a better way to do things)
*Great communicator and super organized
*You're comfortable working with a remote team and you're deeply familiar with efficiency/communication tools like Slack.
*You're also passionate about startups and technology and you're interested in disrupting the PR space.
Apply here: https://pr-volt.workable.com/jobs/622361
