Supplier Relations Team Member at Mozio

Philippines, Brazil, Lisbon, Remote · Full Time
The Product:Read More

The Product:

You land in London and Mozio sends you a push notification to book the Heathrow Express train. Later that day you use Mozio to book an on-demand sedan, tap onto the London Tube, and make a reservation for a minicab to pick you up the next morning. When you land in Munich, Mozio sends you a push notification for the Lufthansa Airport Bus to the city center, at which point you purchase a ticket on the U-bahn or S-bahn, also through Mozio, to get you to your hotel. 3 days later in Dallas you purchase a DART ticket to take public transit back to your home in Dallas.

All of those examples of transportation, from shuttles, taxis, limos and even public transit, currently have some form of digital ticketing.

Mozio is tying it all together.

Build the transportation app of the future.

The Perks & Culture:
- Yearly 10-day group retreats.
- Fun, small, flexible team. You need to work from New York for a week? Feel free. You want to work and travel? Go ahead.
- Unlimited Vacation Policy: As long as you get your work done, we don't micromanage your time.
- We think it's important to invest in the personal development of our employees, and will be flexible with what you want to learn.
- We are all friends: when you are going to spend 50+ hours a week with each other it's important that you don't just tolerate your coworkers but actually like them. Mozio was started by two friends, and we want to bring on other people we can be friends with.

Applied
Apply to Mozio
Add a message to Mozio
Apply

Job Description

Help us approach shuttle, taxi, limo, express train and public transit organizations to expand our coverage. The ideal candidates will have a demonstrated ability to get things done. A proactive nature, resourcefulness, and ability to figure new things out are key assets in this role. Successful candidates will have experience in sales, customer relations, or any client facing role where they have had to convince customers to work with them.

In exchange for their long hours and hard work, Mozio's supplier relations team members earn competitive salaries, equity, the ability to work remotely from anywhere, and a flexible vacation policy. Mozio offers great leadership opportunities and flexibility to individuals who demonstrate an ability to get things done. Combine that with a "flat" organizational culture and lack of bureaucracy, and what's not to love!

Salary and equity are flexible and based on experience, location and other factors.

Compensation
$12K–$24K
0.01%–0.02%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to Mozio
Apply

What We're Building

Mozio is building the ultimate city mobility app: one app to book public transit, shuttles, limos, taxis, express trains and express buses.

The world is bigger than Uber: of the $450 billion spent on local transportation every year, the majority are on other options like public transit. And each city has it's own transportation stack: you move around SF differently than you move around London, Munich or Oslo.

Each one of those different transportation options in each city are on completely different technology stacks with different ticket redemption choices. Very often their fare structures are arcane, making you choose between "Tariff AB, BC or ABC."

Mozio seeks to plug into all these sources and build your ultimate city mobility solution: we want you to be able to book a Supershuttle in Dallas, the Heathrow Express train in London, the U-Bahn in Germany, and Lyft when you get back home to SF.

Hiring in Philippines, Brazil, Lisbon, Remote OK
11-50 Employees
$2.5M Seed in 2016...

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=8, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
Marketing Developer

Company: Podia

At Podia, we’re building the best platform on the planet for creators to sell online courses, memberships and digital downloads.

We’ve been around for a few years and helped more than 11,000 creators earn millions, and we’re growing fast…

But you’re going to help us grow faster

We’re looking for an A+ developer with serious experience when it comes to working with marketing teams to ship projects that grow the business.

You’ll help us run growth experiments, build better experiences for our prospects and trial users, and continuously improve our marketing funnel from top to bottom.

What you’ll do:

Collaborate closely with marketing and design to ship new campaigns, products, features and updates, including…

  • Implementing changes to our app to improve the user onboarding experience.
  • Building custom apps, pages and websites that support Podia’s marketing goals.
  • Running tests to change behavior, nudging users to complete important in-app tasks.
  • Ensuring that our growth experiments are properly tracked, and owning the technical aspects of tracking and collecting our marketing data.
  • Brainstorming new growth ideas, and then building them.

Technically, you’ve…

  • Used one or more modern web frameworks (Ideally Rails)
  • Built minimum-dependancy Javascript / jQuery widgets
  • Built exceptional app interfaces under the creative direction of a designer
  • Worked with marketing to ship, analyze and optimize growth projects.

Additionally, you…

  • Are comfortable learning new technologies.
  • Are flexible on your technology choices.
  • Are capable of working independently with rapidly changing requirements.
  • Know when to ask for help, and aren’t afraid to do so.
  • Enjoy working on short projects, each potentially different from the next.
  • Know when to move fast, and when to tread carefully (e.g. when you’re working in the app!)
  • Center divs in your sleep
  • Have some experience working remotely. Our team is spread across North America and Europe, and our HQ is Slack. 

Why work at Podia?

  • Ultimate flexibility. We try to have some overlap time every day, but outside of that work whenever & wherever you work best.
  • Extreme autonomy. No micro-managing here. You’ll be given high-level direction and then left to solve it the way you feel is best. You’re the expert!
  • That said, the rest of the team is always ready to lend a hand — or even an ear if you just need to rubber duck some ideas.
  • You get to work with a small, highly-talented team that has built — and continues to build — our business with care. 
  • Whether it’s fixes, small tweaks, or substantial features, we deploy often. There’s zero red tape to slow you down.
  • We have a rapidly growing base of passionate customers, and a much larger market that your projects will be getting in front of. Your work will be seen and appreciated by many people.
  • Competitive compensation. We want to hire the best people, and we’re ready to pay for them.
  • (Paid for) annual retreats to spend time with the team and have fun together. This year’s retreat was in Portland, Maine!

Interested in joining our team?

We’d love to chat

To apply, just fill out this form: https://podia.typeform.com/to/mHCWRq
How to apply:
Fill out the form linked above, thanks!

items.title: Marketing Manager
items.content:
Marketing Manager


CCS Group

This is a fantastic opportunity to join our company at an exciting time as we enter a new phase of growth and launch new products. We are looking for an ambitious, motivated and energetic marketing professional to help take the company to the next level.

## About the company
CCS Group was established in 2007. We provide low-cost card payment processing services to small business customers in the UK.

We are a small, experienced and customer-driven team. Our mission is to help small businesses flourish.

The company has recently completed a major overhaul of its product offering. We are now focused on achieving growth by expanding our customer base.

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for all marketing activities, across our two payment provider subsidiaries (CabCard Services and Optimus Pay).You will work directly with the Managing Director and the CTO to develop and implement a complete marketing strategy. This will include working on inbound (including SEO), paid, social, influencer, email and traditional media marketing activities. Your overall goal will be to grow the company's customer base and establish a functioning engine of growth. As a key part of a small team, your input will be valued and you will have a significant impact on the company's development. You will benefit from considerable autonomy, a flat management structure and a quick, collaborative decision-making process.Over time you will be able to grow your team in order to scale up marketing activities.The position offers a competitive salary with excellent rewards for the right candidate.

Requirements

You are a motivated, ambitious and energetic marketing expert. You are open, curious and innovative, with a bias to action, and you are an excellent written and verbal communicator.You have spent a number of years gaining marketing experience and are now looking to step up to a more challenging key marketing role with greater responsibility.You are able to easily shift from big-picture strategy to hands-on execution. You are able to independently prioritise, plan and execute your work.You stay up-to-date with new marketing trends and tools, and can select and apply them effectively.You can maximise the effectiveness of a modest budget and understand how to run low-cost channel experiments to test the effectiveness of a medium or message, before committing to a full campaign.You are confident wearing many hats, and have experience with (and a proven track record in) all or most of:- Marketing planning- Content strategy development- Storytelling- SEO- Media buying and PR- Branding and design- Asset creation including basic image and video editing- Social media management- Email marketing- PPC advertising- Conversion optimization- Analytics and metricsExperience marketing products to SME niches, ideally in the UK, is highly beneficial. Experience with payment-related products or financial services is beneficial but not essential.Please note this is a full-time (35-40 hours per week) remote role. You must be capable of, and comfortable with, working remotely and be familiar with a remote toolkit including Slack and Trello.Ideally you will normally be based within a European time zone (UTC ± 3), and you will have prior experience working remotely.

See more jobs at CCS Group

Visit CCS Group's website

items.content:
Marketing Engineering


Trivago N.V


As a Frontend Engineer in our Marketing Solutions team, you will actively shape the technical future of our high-quality marketing tools. In this role, you will work with top-notch technologies in a dynamic environment, enjoying the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new designs and effects.


If you are constantly seeking new challenges, and want to work within a creative, cutting edge setting, then read on, and join the Talent Community today!



What you'll do:




* Create user interfaces for our high-quality marketing applications.

* As a mediator between our designers and other developers, your knowledge and expertise in these two domains will be required.

* With the implementation of modern designs, you make sure that our front end is always a step ahead.

* Using pre-processors, you will code efficient, maintainable, scalable and cross-browser compatible CSS.

* Support the design and development process through creation and improvement of style guides and pattern libraries.

* Ensure trivago maintains its trendsetter status by familiarizing yourself with new technologies and keeping an eye out for upcoming trends and their applicability to our site.






What you'll definitely need:




* To have studied a core module in IT, or alternatively have successfully completed a comparable apprenticeship.

* Excellent CSS3/HTML5 knowledge, refined by extensive experience dealing with template engines.

* To take pride in your ability to build responsive sites and bullet proof CSS.

* Deep knowledge of JavaScript.

* To be no stranger to progressive enhancement.

* Extensive experience in the implementation of complex designs, ideally in a high-traffic environment.

* To love technical challenges and to strive for continuous development.

* To speak English (our company language) fluently.

* Knowledge of Angular and React will be appreciated.





Life at trivago is:




* The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

* Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

* Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

* The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

* The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free workshops, seminars, sports and activities.

* The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.

* Working from our picturesque Palma office overlooking the port

* To find out more about life at trivago follow us on Facebook - @lifeattrivago.





Additional information:




* trivago N.V. is an equal opportunity employer. Applications from individuals with disabilities are welcome.






See more jobs at Trivago N.V

items.content:
Senior Research Engineer at Cisco

Remote
  • LOCATION:

    Denver, Colorado, US

  • ADDITIONAL LOCATION(S)

    North America remote

  • AREA OF INTEREST

    Engineer – Software

  • JOB TYPE

    Professional

  • TECHNOLOGY INTEREST

    Big Data, Analytics, Security, Software Development, Testing

  • JOB ID

    1235575

What You’ll Do

The successful candidate will be responsible for helping design and develop ThreatGrid’s Malware Analysis Engines and its infrastructure. Malware is a quickly moving target, so you will be continuously improving our analysis toolchain. You will be designing, coding and debugging applications in various languages.

Who You’ll Work With

Our team supports and improves on the analysis capabilities in ThreatGrid’s Cloud and Appliance products. We work closely with other engineering teams to integrate ThreatGrid into other security products.

We draw on the best of agile themes and techniques of the past 30 yearscontinuous integration and deployment, testing, flexible collaboration with globally distributed team members via chat and video, and gradual, deliberate optimization of process in the name of keeping projects and releases flowing smoothly, in order to provide an excellent product to our customers. We are surrounded by talented QA, UX, support, documentation writers, and management – we hold ourselves to high standards.

We offer:

  • An endless supply of interesting problems, and people to solve them with
  • Work in one of the fastest growing product lines in Cisco
  • Competitive salary and benefits to support a stable, high-quality life outside of work
  • Decades of collective experience with Clojure and Common Lisp
  • Support with developing your skills and talents, we love to help each other grow
  • Work from home, or a Cisco office, as you please

Who You Are

You are self-motivated and passionate about learning new techniques and technologies. You can work independently and collaborate with team members. You are comfortable with meeting deadlines and milestones. You are able to learn new languages and technologies with minimal guidance.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Strong experience in design, development, debugging complex distributed/clustered software
  • Expertise in at least two high-level languages such as C, C++ or Python
  • Linux development experience
  • A solid understanding of software engineering best practices

Desired Skills:

  • Experience in Go
  • A background in data science
  • Windows development experience a plus

Why Cisco

We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.

We are leaders with vision, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.

Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

items.content:
Marketing Engineering - Frontend Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Marketing, Software Development, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public
Company: trivago N.V. | Palma, Spain

Remote details

Employer's note: We believe that working onsite is important for collective productivity. However working remote conditions can be discussed individually.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

css3
html5
css
javascript

Job description

As a Frontend Engineer in our Marketing Solutions team, you will actively shape the technical future of our high-quality marketing tools. In this role, you will work with top-notch technologies in a dynamic environment, enjoying the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new designs and effects.


If you are constantly seeking new challenges, and want to work within a creative, cutting edge setting, then read on, and join the Talent Community today!



What you'll do:

  • Create user interfaces for our high-quality marketing applications.
  • As a mediator between our designers and other developers, your knowledge and expertise in these two domains will be required.
  • With the implementation of modern designs, you make sure that our front end is always a step ahead.
  • Using pre-processors, you will code efficient, maintainable, scalable and cross-browser compatible CSS.
  • Support the design and development process through creation and improvement of style guides and pattern libraries.
  • Ensure trivago maintains its trendsetter status by familiarizing yourself with new technologies and keeping an eye out for upcoming trends and their applicability to our site.



What you'll definitely need:

  • To have studied a core module in IT, or alternatively have successfully completed a comparable apprenticeship.
  • Excellent CSS3/HTML5 knowledge, refined by extensive experience dealing with template engines.
  • To take pride in your ability to build responsive sites and bullet proof CSS.
  • Deep knowledge of JavaScript.
  • To be no stranger to progressive enhancement.
  • Extensive experience in the implementation of complex designs, ideally in a high-traffic environment.
  • To love technical challenges and to strive for continuous development.
  • To speak English (our company language) fluently.
  • Knowledge of Angular and React will be appreciated.


Life at trivago is:

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.
  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.
  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.
  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.
  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free workshops, seminars, sports and activities.
  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.
  • Working from our picturesque Palma office overlooking the port
  • To find out more about life at trivago follow us on Facebook - @lifeattrivago.


Additional information:

  • trivago N.V. is an equal opportunity employer. Applications from individuals with disabilities are welcome.



Apply now

About trivago N.V.

Do you want to join a team of entrepreneurs from over 50 different nationalities? To work in an environment powered by passion where no two days are the same?

At trivago we use the latest innovative technologies to empower our users to find their ideal hotel 100 times a second, across 55 different locales world-wide and in 33 different languages.

Benefits

  • Large and impressive technology stack
  • Self determined working hours and holidays
  • Personal development opportunities ie. Tech conferences
  • Dynamic and diverse work atmosphere
  • Opportunity to work for 4 weeks per year in our Palma office
  • Regular events ie. hackathons
  • Regular team events
  • Permanent contract with competitive salary

items.title: Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
*Role Summary*

We’re looking for an ambitious and self-disciplined Marketing Manager to join our fast growing team. This is a true full-stack marketing role. You will be working alongside our Content & Design Lead as part of a two-person marketing team. Reporting directly to the CEO, this role presents an amazing opportunity to grow and manage our marketing function.

Our primary route to market is through accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will be responsible for maximising lead generation for our sales team. You will also be responsible for working with partner accounting and bookkeeping firms to market their Chaser offering to their clients; ensuring they make the most out of the block licences we sell to them.

We are growing at a fantastic rate. This is an incredible opportunity for someone talented and ambitious to make a huge impact. Our head office is located in Moorgate London. Half our team work remotely and we do offer remote working anywhere in the UK for the right candidate. Your responsibilities will include:

* *Understanding* | Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will need to * develop a deep empathy that can enable us to market effectively to them
* *Partner marketing* | Working with accounting and bookkeeping partners to help them effectively communicate the benefits of Chaser to their clients. For example, helping them design email campaigns and advising them on how best to run events. Identifying collateral and resources we need to provide them and working with our Content & Design Lead to produce it
* *Events* | Leading our events strategy and organisation of our exhibiting at them
* *Webinars* | Creating and running webinars as part of accounting and bookkeeping firms’ buying processes
* *Channel development* | Identifying opportunities for us to generate new leads for our sales team and running experiments to prove them out as marketing channels
* *External listings* | Managing and enacting our third party sites strategy (e.g. accounting software marketplaces and other software recommendation platforms) and managing our listings on those platforms
* *Website* | Overseeing the company’s website and its efficacy in converting visitors to sign ups and working with our Content & Design Lead to improve it
* *Analytics* | Preparing, managing and reporting on our marketing funnel analytics. We currently use Google Analytics, Mixpanel and GoSquared. You will take the lead on identifying the optimal mix of tools we should be using
* *PPC* | Managing and enacting our PPC strategy and working with our Content & Design Lead to deliver effective ad campaigns
* *SEO* | Managing and enacting our SEO strategy and working with our Content & Design Lead to optimise our website content for SEO purposes
* *Awards & PR* | Managing and enacting our Awards and PR strategy. Co-ordinating the relevant applications and external consultants

*About You*

There are a number of attributes that will be critical to success in this specific role. You will:

* have very strong empathy. The ability to build a deep and effective understanding of accountants and bookkeepers will be critical to success in this role
* be positive with an ability to engender the necessary energy and excitement in partners and customers to market Chaser effectively to their clients
* have a strong analytical capacity to be able to step back and interpret what the data (both qualitative as well as quantitative) is telling us
* have very strong time management and prioritisation skills. There will be a huge number of balls to juggle in this role
* have strong commercial and business acumen with an instinct for opportunity

There are also a number of attributes that will be critical to your success more generally at Chaser as a fast growing startup. You will:

* be a proactive self-starter who is comfortable taking the initiative and solving problems autonomously
be extremely ambitious
* love learning (fast!). You will be comfortable (well, as comfortable as it’s possible to be!) learning through trial and error. And when those errors happen, as they inevitably will, be able to lean in to learn from them fully
* not need to be an amateur netless tightrope walker, but you will be comfortable with the need to take risks in the role
* have excellent written communication skills
* have excellent spoken communication skills, both in person and over the phone
* be someone who thrives working in a high speed environment
* be excited about working as part of a small, tight-knit team

*Benefits*

Competitive salary
Share options
Company pension scheme
25 days holiday
Flexible working hours

*How to apply*

In applying for the role, please answer the following questions:

* Why have you applied for this role? (Max 100 words)
* What is your proudest achievement and why? ( Max 200 words)
* Please tell us about a company whose marketing you really admire. Why do you admire it?
* When would you be available to start work at Chaser?
* Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.title: Marketing Whiz

Marketing Whiz at Conseev, LLC

Remote

Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

Marketing

Description

Conseev is a small, fun, fast-growing technology company that is looking for an ambitious individual to help build out their marketing team and take responsibility for driving traffic, generating leads, and converting those leads into customers.

Basic responsibilities:

  • Write and re-write copy for our websites

Please see site for details: http://conseev.com/marketing-whizz/

Benefits

This position, as nearly all positions at Conseev, offers extensive flexibility in both location, schedule, and every other aspect of work environment. We are a fully virtual company; see our site for more details: http://conseev.com/marketing-whizz/

items.title: Senior Technical Analyst (Remote) -- Digital Media
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Job Description

Our client is looking for an energetic and experienced Senior Analyst to join its fun and expanding San Diego office (remote is possible for other qualified candidates in other locations nationally willing to travel.) As part of the Analytics group, you will have the opportunity to work cross-functionally to support various business units, contribute to the solutions' technical design, and add value with actionable business insights. THIS IS A TECHNICAL POSITION.

Demonstrated Ability in the Following:

· The ideal candidate will have a mix of technical background coupled with strong business acumen, that will enable them to draw meaningful business conclusions and insights from a wide variety of data sources and structures.

· Own the technical implementation of tag management solutions to ensure all functions of tagging, troubleshooting and maintenance are performed accurately.

· Work closely with team members to identify any gaps in data capture, and proactively recommend and implement data enhancements.

· Partner with team leads to implement and maintain best practices around data strategy and analytics.

Education, Technical Skills & Related Experience:

Requirements:

· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other technical discipline.

· Five (5) + years of experience implementing data solutions, preferably within an agency environment.

· Experience in programming languages including but not limited to JavaScript (a must), HTML, CSS, PHP, Python, and SQL.

· Extensive tag management experience, with Google GTM and Adobe DTM both being a must. Other platforms such as Tealium iQ and ObservePoint preferred but not required.

· Digital analytics experience including taxonomy, visitor intent, segmentation, website structure, voice of customer, CRM, user behavior, and ROI optimization.

· Data integration skills in ETL, enterprise data management solutions, report writing, SQL authoring, API protocols, and requirements gathering and documentation

· Digital platforms including AdStage, DoubleClick, BigQuery, Invoca, Salesforce, Marketo, and Optimizely.

· Must be able to function well in both a technical and business (customer environment.)

Desired Skills/Experience

· Ability to identify and create success metrics on behalf of our client businesses.

· Omnichannel analytics in identifying the user journey to optimize marketing campaigns across social/influence, search, and content media platforms.

· Data visualization tools including Tableau, Datorama, and Data Studio.

· Excellent communication skills, and comfortable presenting insights to clients, in person and remotely. This is a client-facing role.

· Excellent project management skills in communicating, leading, and negotiating simultaneous projects on a consistent basis.

· Consultative approach in guiding clients towards achieving their growth goals.

· Storytelling ability to draw conclusions in communicating "what does this mean / how will this impact my client business."

· Ability to "speak the language" of both technical and business audiences alike.

· Adaptable, willing to learn, and eager to share knowledge with other team members.

· Superior ability to multitask to meet tight deadlines and operate in a fast-paced working (but fun) environment.

· Ability to allocate time to research and recommend emerging trends.

· Team player who is able to flourish in both an office environment and able to communicate with other team members across different offices throughout the country

  • * There is a potential bonus of up to 25% of base salary

items.title: Paid marketing analyst / SEM manager - B2B SaaS
items.content:
Paid marketing analyst / SEM manager - B2B SaaS

Company: Schedugram

Schedugram helps our customers schedule and manage their content on Instagram. We work with customers from small businesses through to global brands, and everything in between.
We are looking for an experienced paid marketing analyst to lead our paid customer acquisition efforts. You will collaborate with our marketing team to make sure we're generating cost-effective and qualified signups that convert to being a customer.
We have a fully remote team distributed around the world. We work hard to keep our customers around the globe happy, and we're proud of our success over the last 4.5 years.

Your mission

The core mission of the paid marketing analyst is to improve our new MRR rate through increasing the number of new signups we get through paid acquisition channels (search, social and display). You'll do this through analysing our campaigns day-to-day, and continuously making changes to turbocharge success.

Your role

We'll know you are successful when you:
  • Cost-effectively acquire customers through paid channels
  • Launch new campaigns every month to identify what works best
  • Improve our MRR growth rate through paid marketing
  • Collaborate with the marketing team on integrated campaigns
  • Can run reports and quantitatively show your success to the team

Your Experience & Skills

You're a fit for this role if you:
  • Have 3+ years working in a paid marketing role in a B2B SaaS company (required)
  • Know SaaS metrics in and out (required)
  • Have previously worked remotely (preferred)
  • Have used Hubspot in the past (preferred)
  • Deeply understand the ins and outs of Google AdWords (required - our primary paid channel)
  • Can write your own copy and test different iterations
  • Are data driven to the point that you think PivotTables would be a great person to hang out with
  • Understand the different paid acquisition channels available and their likely utility for our product
  • Love to report back to the team on your success
Some understanding or experience in social media management and/or social networks (from a business users' perspective) is a plus.

Salary and remuneration

As a guide, we're looking at a salary of US$45-55k for this role, with some flexibility for the right candidate if appropriate.

How to apply:
Apply through our portal: jobs.enlist.io/schedugram/jobs/7d6ec257-72e5-496d-b8fe-fb05a05e7d27

items.content:
Digital Marketing Instructor

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: General Assembly
Part Time

Overview

Since 2011, General Assembly has transformed tens of thousands of careers through pioneering, experiential education in today’s most in-demand skills. As featured in The Economist, Wired, and The New York Times, GA offers training in web development, data, design, business, and more, both online and at campuses around the world. Our global professional community boasts 40,000 full- and part-time alumni — and counting.

In addition to fostering career growth for individuals, GA helps employers cultivate top tech talent and spur innovation by transforming their teams through strategic learning. More than 21,000 employees at elite companies worldwide have honed their digital fluency with our corporate training programs. GA has also been recognized as one of Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500, and Fast Company has dubbed us leaders in World-Changing Ideas as well as the #1 Most Innovative Company in Education.

We are looking for an instructor to lead this transformative experience through General Assembly’s part-time Digital Marketing course.

This is a remote teaching position, so applicants can be located anywhere in the US!

Skills and Qualifications
  • You are eager to shape the skills, minds, and trajectories of the newest generation of digital marketers.
  • You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are trying to figure something out.
  • You have of industry experience with digital marketing.
    • at least 3 years 
  • You have fluency in the following topics: Google Analytics, Google AdWords, current social media outlets, paid social media advertising, customer segmentation targeting and tracking, community management, and email marketing.
  • Preferred, but not required:
    • Experience working in a remote environment, and use of requisite tools (i.e. video conferencing, messaging, etc.)
    • Backgrounds in adult learning, pedagogy and curriculum development
    • Background in workshop facilitation and professional development

      • Essential Responsibilities and Duties
      • Teach 2 hours per evening, 2 days a week, for 10 weeks.
      • Commit a few hours per week to office hours and ddapt pre-built GA curriculum and lesson-plans to reflect industry trends and offer personal insights
      • Work alongside GA staff and teaching team to best meet the needs and learning styles of your students.
      • Guide students through development of a stellar final project that will showcase their abilities to hiring managers.
      • Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community.
      • Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of learning a new suite of skills
      • Assist students outside of class as necessary.

        • General Assembly is a licensed school in all states that we operate in, and some states require instructors to be licensed to teach. If hired, you will be required to submit and be approved as an instructor in relevant states. Directions for becoming licensed will be shared with you during onboarding. Licensure requirements vary by state, but you may be required to provide academic transcripts and to answer questions pertaining to moral character, professional conduct, education, and work history. General Assembly will pay for all licensing fees.

        Competencies:
        • Technical Expertise – Technical Skills
        • People Management  – Directing, Motivating, and Directing Others & Managing Diversity
        • Instructional Expertise – Planning, Presentation Skills, Patience, Time Management, Listening Skills
        • Self-development – Self-Knowledge, Learning on the Fly, Personal Learning

          • To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/generalassembly/jobs/1150215 →

items.title: We're hiring a REMOTE Marketing Developer at Podia: https://www.podia.com/marketing-developer Podia is a platform that makes it easy for creators to host ...
items.content:
We're hiring a REMOTE Marketing Developer at Podia: https://www.podia.com/marketing-developer

Podia is a platform that makes it easy for creators to host and sell online courses, memberships and digital downloads.

Work remotely on interesting growth challenges with an amazing team, and make an impact on thousands of users (and with your help, many thousands more).

++ Why work at Podia? ++

- Ultimate flexibility. We try to have some overlap time every day, but outside of that work whenever & wherever you work best.

- Extreme autonomy. No micro-managing here. You’ll be given high-level direction and then left to solve it the way you feel is best. You’re the expert!

- That said, the rest of the team is always ready to lend a hand — or even an ear if you just need to rubber duck some ideas.

- You get to work with a small, highly-talented team that has built — and continues to build — our business with care.

- Whether it’s fixes, small tweaks, or substantial features, we deploy often. There’s zero red tape to slow you down.

- We have a rapidly growing base of passionate customers, and a much larger market that your projects will be getting in front of. Your work will be seen and appreciated by many people.

- Competitive compensation. We want to hire the best people, and we’re ready to pay for them.

- (Paid for) annual retreats to spend time with the team and have fun together. This year’s retreat was in Portland, Maine!

Application details at https://www.podia.com/marketing-developer

items.title: PR and Media Manager – Select US States
items.content:
PR and Media Manager – Select US States at FlexJobs

Remote

FlexJobs is hiring! Since 2007, our awesome team has been working hard to present professional, legitimate, flexible jobs to our subscribers. In the bigger picture, we aim to make the job search experience a little easier and safer through hand-screened jobs, skills testing, a blog that explores all areas of flexible working, and career coaching for FlexJobs members.

Our mission is to improve the future of work by helping people find flexible jobs that make their lives better. We are committed to doing this internally and externally with integrity, intelligence, balance, communication, and care.

We also walk the talk! Our entire team works remotely from locations all across the United States. The ability to flex our schedules as needed to best fit our lives allows us to work in a very focused and productive way. The teams at FlexJobs collaborate and communicate as needed—whether that’s several times a day or a couple of times a week—to stay connected and engaged with one another.

Here are 5 important things to know about this role:

  • The PR & Media Manager will report to, collaborate with, and support the Director of PR & Media in the strategy and execution of FlexJobs’ overall PR & Media program.
  • A big part of this role will be media relations outreach, particularly building and nurturing relationships with journalists.
  • You need to be to able to thrive and operate in a fast-paced work environment.
  • You need to have a genuine desire to spread the word and an excitement for helping people find better jobs that fit their lives.
  • We are a virtual company, so you need to be completely happy working independently, but also proactive when it comes to reaching out, brainstorming, and working with colleagues.

Skills & Experience Required

Our ideal candidate will have:

  • A bachelor’s degree in English, communications, journalism, public relations, or other related fields
  • 2-4 years’ experience in media relations, specifically creating and distributing content to press
  • Experience building and maintaining relationships with reporters at the local, regional, and national levels
  • Passion for brainstorming, writing, and sending media pitches on a frequent basis
  • Ability to take initiative and proactively suggest PR tactics and ideas
  • Understanding of and appreciation for PR metrics and demonstrating ROI
  • Proven track record of working well within a team environment
  • Knowledge of Vocus/CISION database and Meltwater (a plus)
  • Contacts at national broadcast media outlets (a significant plus)
  • Strong strategic planning, written communication, and verbal communication skills
  • A high level of professional integrity and a strong, honest work ethic
  • A friendly, positive, professional demeanor and personality
  • A detail-oriented and organized approach to work

Other Requirements

  • You must have reliable high-speed Internet access, a fast computer, and phone access.
  • Your work environment must be one in which you can really focus without distractions.

HOW TO APPLY

If this is sounding a lot like you, then please consider applying! What we’ll need from you:

  • An intro email/cover letter telling us:
    • What makes you excited about working for FlexJobs (vs. any other company)
    • One of your favorite PR campaigns that you’ve worked on
    • The most successful PR land that you’ve gotten personally
    • The most important thing you believe you can offer in this role
    • What rate you’d be comfortable with, based on a 40-hour work week
  • A current resume in .doc, .docx, .pdf, or .txt.
  • Applications can be sent by email to jobs@flexjobs.com.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Any applications that don’t include ALL of this information or are a clear half-hearted effort will be put into a “not qualified” group immediately. Sorry to be tough, but we don’t want to waste our time or yours. Hope you understand.

Open to candidates in select US states: CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, IL, MA, ME, MN, NC, NH, NY, OK, OR, PA, TN, TX, VA

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=8, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
Marketing Developer

Company: Podia
Remote

At Podia, we’re building the best platform on the planet for creators to sell online courses, memberships and digital downloads.

We’ve been around for a few years and helped more than 11,000 creators earn millions, and we’re growing fast…

But you’re going to help us grow faster

We’re looking for an A+ developer with serious experience when it comes to working with marketing teams to ship projects that grow the business.

You’ll help us run growth experiments, build better experiences for our prospects and trial users, and continuously improve our marketing funnel from top to bottom.

What you’ll do:

Collaborate closely with marketing and design to ship new campaigns, products, features and updates, including…

  • Implementing changes to our app to improve the user onboarding experience.
  • Building custom apps, pages and websites that support Podia’s marketing goals.
  • Running tests to change behavior, nudging users to complete important in-app tasks.
  • Ensuring that our growth experiments are properly tracked, and owning the technical aspects of tracking and collecting our marketing data.
  • Brainstorming new growth ideas, and then building them.

Technically, you’ve…

  • Used one or more modern web frameworks (Ideally Rails)
  • Built minimum-dependancy Javascript / jQuery widgets
  • Built exceptional app interfaces under the creative direction of a designer
  • Worked with marketing to ship, analyze and optimize growth projects.

Additionally, you…

  • Are comfortable learning new technologies.
  • Are flexible on your technology choices.
  • Are capable of working independently with rapidly changing requirements.
  • Know when to ask for help, and aren’t afraid to do so.
  • Enjoy working on short projects, each potentially different from the next.
  • Know when to move fast, and when to tread carefully (e.g. when you’re working in the app!)
  • Center divs in your sleep
  • Have some experience working remotely. Our team is spread across North America and Europe, and our HQ is Slack. 

Why work at Podia?

  • Ultimate flexibility. We try to have some overlap time every day, but outside of that work whenever & wherever you work best.
  • Extreme autonomy. No micro-managing here. You’ll be given high-level direction and then left to solve it the way you feel is best. You’re the expert!
  • That said, the rest of the team is always ready to lend a hand — or even an ear if you just need to rubber duck some ideas.
  • You get to work with a small, highly-talented team that has built — and continues to build — our business with care. 
  • Whether it’s fixes, small tweaks, or substantial features, we deploy often. There’s zero red tape to slow you down.
  • We have a rapidly growing base of passionate customers, and a much larger market that your projects will be getting in front of. Your work will be seen and appreciated by many people.
  • Competitive compensation. We want to hire the best people, and we’re ready to pay for them.
  • (Paid for) annual retreats to spend time with the team and have fun together. This year’s retreat was in Portland, Maine!

Interested in joining our team?

We’d love to chat

To apply, just fill out this form: https://podia.typeform.com/to/mHCWRq

Fill out the form linked above, thanks!

To apply: Fill out the form linked above, thanks!

  • Know when to move fast, and when to tread carefully (e.g. when you’re working in the app!)
  • Center divs in your sleep
  • Have some experience working remotely. Our team is spread across North America and Europe, and our HQ is Slack. 

Why work at Podia?

  • Ultimate flexibility. We try to have some overlap time every day, but outside of that work whenever & wherever you work best.
  • Extreme autonomy. No micro-managing here. You’ll be given high-level direction and then left to solve it the way you feel is best. You’re the expert!
  • That said, the rest of the team is always ready to lend a hand — or even an ear if you just need to rubber duck some ideas.
  • You get to work with a small, highly-talented team that has built — and continues to build — our business with care. 
  • Whether it’s fixes, small tweaks, or substantial features, we deploy often. There’s zero red tape to slow you down.
  • We have a rapidly growing base of passionate customers, and a much larger market that your projects will be getting in front of. Your work will be seen and appreciated by many people.
  • Competitive compensation. We want to hire the best people, and we’re ready to pay for them.
  • (Paid for) annual retreats to spend time with the team and have fun together. This year’s retreat was in Portland, Maine!

Interested in joining our team?

We’d love to chat

To apply, just fill out this form: https://podia.typeform.com/to/mHCWRq

Apply for this position

Fill out the form linked above, thanks!

items.title: Marketing Manager (Remote) | Take The Fitness Startup Global
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: The Movement Athlete; 1-10 employees; 75-100% remote;

If you are up for a challenge of driving growth for a fitness platform while working in a fun, driven remote team and travelling the world- keep on reading.

We are looking for an experienced, entrepreneurial and highly data & results driven marketer to help us take The Movement Athlete global in next 12 months while having the adventure of your life.

About
The Movement Athlete is the world's first platform for skill-based training.

We work with a multidisciplinary team of trainers and coaches, distil their knowledge and turn learning fitness skills into a game. We are starting with calisthenics, gymnastics, acrobatics that include skills like handstands, cartwheels, backflips, human flags easy, fun and safe for everyone.

We have been working on this project for over a year, built an MVP, pre-sold it and validated the market. Last year we spent 3 months in the LeAD Sports Accelerator (run by Adi Dassler family - the founder of Adidas and ex-Red Bull folks). With their backing, we are just finishing the new mobile app with over 160 new moves and we are getting ready to take it globally in the next 12 months.

And that’s where you come in.
YOUR ROLE
We are looking for someone to take ownership of developing and driving marketing strategies specifically on the CONTENT & SOCIAL SIDE.
That which will involve everything from high-level strategy development to hands-on things like managing the content team, building funnels, hiring team, marketing automation, blog and CRM platforms, and use your strong understanding of human needs and behaviours, content marketing to create sustainable growth.


YOU ARE:
-Extremely Data & Analytics Driven but creative with a great eye for a visual and brand.
- You run a comprehensive content and social strategy with positive ROI
-Have experience in leading and growing marketing the team
-Creative and resourceful and you are able to solve problems and come up with ideas on the fly.
-Extremely INDEPENDENT and you take responsibility for creating results. (Once the strategy is determined you will not be micromanaged or have to log your time – it’s all about execution, learning and creating results in the most optimal way)
-DRIVEN BY Personal growth and LEARNING new things
-Fluent or Native English Speaker
- You are passionate about sports and movement training
-Love adventure and want to join a remote team
-Entrepreneurial and looking for an opportunity to join a company early

YOU HAVE DONE:
-Built a lean team to create funnels
-Have hired and managed contractors
-Built a sales funnel

-You have an established exercise routine
-You already work with fully-distributed teams

WHAT’s IN IT FOR YOU?
This is a unique opportunity to come early and together with us build an organisation that not only delivers massive value to our customers but it’s a place we love working in on our own terms.
-Join a fully remote team and have an opportunity to travel the world- (we work from different places in the world, go adventures and meet regularly on team retreats. )
- Take the company globally in next 12-18 months and make an impact in lives of millions of people
-Take your skills to the next level, be challenged and grow as a part of an amazing team of A players
-Join an amazing network of advisors including our early investors including Adidas and Redbull folks.
-Grow together with the company in terms of compensation and rewards

ABOUT THE COMPANY & CULTURE
TMA is a young growing company in a digital fitness space with the team who are extremely growth driven, love adventure, movement as well as the thrill of building projects that can have a global impact. We love our customers and our sole reason for existence is to provide a life-changing experience for them. Not once but for life.
We believe in working hard while having fun, growing, and making a positive impact.

items.title: Marketing Coordinator
items.content:
Marketing Coordinator at SmartBug Media

Remote | Entry-level
  • Sales and Marketing
  • United States

PLEASE READ

You must have hands-on experience with HubSpot to be considered for this position.

Do you love digital marketing and online media? Are you looking to work with really bright people who respect you for your contributions and your character? Do you want to dominate your career without killing your personal life?

If so, you should consider becoming SmartBug Media’s Internal Marketing Coordinator. We’re looking for a responsible, accountable and driven marketer who can help enhance the capabilities of our agency marketing team. You’ll combine your existing skills and a world-class training program into success in an exploding market for inbound marketing, analytics, and marketing automation. You will be challenged every day and you will develop the skills and track record that will make even your mama proud!

We’re building a different kind of work environment at SmartBug Media one where you can deliver great results, have a great time with people you respect and still embrace the things that matter in life. We focus on development and growth.

The Day to Day

You will work hand-in-hand with the Marketing Director, executing our inbound strategy. This means you’ll gain valuable experience in the strategy behind inbound marketing. You’ll work with our marketing consultants, strategists, writers and designers to create and distribute compelling content to our buyer personas. You will quickly become a SmartBug ninja and will spend part of your time ensuring you stay up to speed and learn how to use the newest tools. Technology-wise, you can expect to spend your time using HubSpot, Gaggle, Teamwork (for project management), and other awesome tools like Canva, Sigstr, and Lucky Orange.

Our Commitment

We’re a flat organization and we’re hiring you because you’re smart, driven and want to win just like us. That’s why you’ll have a seat at the table and your ideas heard in making SmartBug Media the most rewarding inbound marketing agency on the planet.

Will your success as an Internal Marketing Coordinator make you our next rock star? We hope so.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Become an expert in inbound marketing tactics including blogging, social media marketing, conversion rate optimization, search engine optimization, e-book/video content creation, website updates, email marketing, webinar and event marketing, and others
  • Become a HubSpot and SmartBug process expert and keep up with software updated and best practices
  • Work with a team of content creators, developers and designers to execute campaign deliverables
  • Take the lead in creating monthly performance reports to highlight wins of campaigns you manage, areas of improvement and recommendations for future programs
  • Stay informed about inbound marketing industry developments
  • Practice your craft by contributing to SmartBug Media’s blog and social media presence
  • Have fun and make some great friends!

Experience and Education Required:

  • 1-3 years experience with online marketing and social media
  • B.A. or B.S. degree
  • Journalism and/or strong writing skills are required
  • Inbound certification or HubSpot certification a plus

Requirements

  • Strong hands-on HubSpot experience
  • Very strong attention to detail and ability to manage projects
  • Strong work ethic with a positive and enthusiastic attitude
  • Demonstrated ability to think creatively
  • Passion for the Internet and marketing with a strong understanding of inbound marketing
  • Demonstrate analytical thinking and independent management skills
  • Strong communicator with excellent customer service and relationship building skills
  • Understanding of major social media platforms
  • Strong writer
  • Basic design skills
  • Basic knowledge of search engine optimization
  • Basic knowledge of email marketing best practices and CAN-SPAM compliance
  • The desire to learn on your own and keep up with inbound marketing and Internet marketing developments and best practices
  • Great writing skills and storytelling skills
  • Proficiency in Google Docs

Our extensive employee benefits program includes:

  • Generous compensation package with performance incentives
  • Health insurance with company contribution
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Paid vacation
  • Paid time off
  • 401(k) with employer matching
  • Flexible spend plan
  • Company-funded short-term disability and life insurance
  • Long-term disability
  • Annual leadership conference, SmartBugapalooza’
  • Training budget
  • Flexibility of working remote
Apply for job

items.content:
CargoMate Technologies is focused on bringing innovative efficiency to the container shipping industry. We are well funded and backed by one of the UK’s most successful tech accelerators, Entrepreneur First.

We’re developing a range of applications and technologies to record, monitor and analyse container ship cargo operations (i.e. the process of moving containers on and off a ship in port), to ensure ships depart early and consume less fuel on a voyage. Our long-term goal is to bring the widespread adoption of autonomous technologies to merchant ships.

We’re looking for an incredibly talented Marketing Manager to join our team and help us take our groundbreaking technology to market.

What you’ll do:

- Build CargoMate’s brand from the ground up, positioning us as a technology leader within container shipping
- Become an expert in container ship operations and the maritime industry
- Take responsibility for creating and delivering CargoMate’s marketing strategy
- Develop a programme of thought leadership including written and video content that adds value for container ship operators worldwide
- Liaise with conference and exhibition companies to manage sponsorship and exhibition opportunities
- Continuously optimise the CargoMate website to grow traffic and marketing qualified leads
- Create, run, and continually optimise CargoMate’s email marketing campaigns to convert and nurture leads
- Manage and grow CargoMate’s social media presence
- Proactively engage with industry and national press to earn coverage for CargoMate and our offering
- Work closely with the Sales team to create campaigns which open up conversations with strategic target accounts
- Create, run, and continually optimise CargoMate’s advertising campaigns

What we want:

- A bachelor's degree or equivalent professional experience
- 3 - 5 years experience in marketing, preferably within maritime or technology (or both)
- A practical understanding of inbound marketing and experience creating inbound campaigns focused on high quality written and video content
- An obsession with creating a great prospect experience and opening the door for conversations with members of our sales team
- Outstanding communication, interpersonal skills, and organisational skills, you should be a great writer, speaker, and listener
- Experience running and managing websites (we use Wordpress), setting up landing pages, and optimising them for conversions
- Experience of email marketing, PPC campaigns, and remarketing
- Experience working with Hubspot (our CRM and marketing system), or the willingness to quickly learn how to get the most out of it
- Flexibility - we’re constantly changing and evolving as a team and we want people who are willing to evolve with us
- The ability to challenge the status quo and continuously improve the way we work
- The ability to travel internationally and the desire to market to an international client base
- The intelligence to quickly become an expert in maritime operations, our technology, and marketing best practices; and the curiosity to continuously learn about the space as it develops.

What you’ll get:

- A competitive salary plus performance related bonus
- Support, mentoring, and the tools you need to become world class at what you do
- The chance to join an early stage business and shape its future
- A structured path to promotion, with the opportunity to lead a team as we scale
- The flexibility to work when you want to, and opportunity to undertake remote work once you’ve completed your first few months on the team

items.title: Product Manager
items.content:
Product Manager

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: Packlane
Full Time

Overview

We are looking for an exceptional Product Manager who is passionate about building products that our customers and staff love. You will join a dynamic, fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy. Best of all, you’ll do this remotely.

Meet Packlane

Packlane empowers brands big and small to create beautiful, affordable unboxing experiences that customers will enjoy and remember. From subscription boxes to event swag, eye-catching packaging can help brands connect with their customers – so we do everything we can to make it a smooth and easy process. Our services are trusted by over 10,000 companies including Google, L’Oreal, Shopify, Red Bull and more.

We’re a team of eager self-starters from all over the world, and we’re looking for others to help grow Packlane into the best company it can be. Our core values are creativity (including beautiful design!), high quality work, and a passion for what we do. If that sounds like a good fit, we can’t wait to hear from you!

Responsibilities
  • Gain a deep understanding of customer and staff experience, identify and fill product and tooling gaps and generate new ideas that and drive growth and improve our internal efficiency
  • Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners
  • Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes
  • Coordinate with executive team to execute the roadmap
  • Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact
  • Work closely with engineers and other stakeholders to deliver products with quick time-to-market and just the right amount of effort
  • Drive product launches including working with public relations team, executives, and other product management team members

    • Requirements
    • Work experience leading and coordinating interdisciplinary groups
    • Successful track record of managing complex projects with dependencies on internal and external resources and timelines
    • Proven ability to develop product strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management
    • Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
    • Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job
    • Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
    • Previous remote team experience preferred

      • Tools and Methodology
      • Agile/Scrum with a focus on expediency rather than perfection (Atlassian Suite)
      • Daily standups and 3-week sprints
      • Continuous implementation
      • Slack
      • Google Apps

        • To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://packlane.breezy.hr/p/9ec199e24909-product-manager →

items.title: Sr Route Optimization Engineer
items.content:
Sr Route Optimization Engineer

Company: Clevertech

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces. 

REQUIREMENTS

* You love doing puzzles 
* You have serious math skills
* You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
* You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
* You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings

BENEFITS 

Own Your Time
We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travelers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.  

Recharge Time
We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself
You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

Focused Work
You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. 

Learn at your edges
We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.
And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag
And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over Slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team?  Check out: http://clevertech.careers

Clevertech Culture Video: https://youtu.be/z5daft3oGjM
How to apply:
hire.clevertech.biz/job/5b2be18e62c05c001b2000b0

items.title: Google Search Evaluator (Remote, Work-from-home)
items.content:
Search evaluators (aka search engine evaluators, web search evaluators, internet assessors, search quality raters) provide educated feedback for search engines. The core of the job is to rate the relevance of search results based on a user's search query. Their feedback is used to test improvements on search engines' algorithms.

The job is 100% telecommute (work from home). People from all backgrounds are welcome. Hiring process is outsourced by Google to external vendors who are responsible for the application and qualification process.

Pay rate: $13.50/hour

items.content:
Product Owner

Company: Novate IT Ltd
Location: Cwmbran
Permanent

Product Owner - iOS , Android - Cwmbran

A brand new role with a highly successful and growing employer in South Wales for a Product Owner to work across a variety of video - centric projects for their platform. A generous starting salary is offered plus benefits such as up to 10% bonus, flexi time, a 25 day holiday allowance that will increase with service, life assurance, 3% employee 6% employer initial pension package and private health care.

The company have several applications that are used by consumers on a global scale across both mobile and web platforms, these applications handle huge amounts of data with no downtime or stress on their systems. They are now looking to hire a Product Owner to help drive product development with local and remote scrum teams.

You will have experience of working in an Agile environment helping local and remote teams of cross-functional developers understand user stories and promote the company's product vision. You will be working on iOS and Android projects so you must have knowledge of both. You will also be able to balance utilising good functionality, user experience and product design. On the technical side solid experience of understanding test automation, continuous integration and deployment as well as evaluating current engineering standards and suggesting improvements is essential. Any experience of working on a video streaming, digital television, media player or similar project will be a huge benefit. As you will be interacting with a huge variety of users, developers and managers excellent communication skills are extremely important.

If you're looking to step up into a Product Owner role or grow further from your current job, joining an established company who are looking to improve their user's experience through new innovative products across iOS and Android then send in your CV today!

Novate IT Ltd is a leading supplier of permanent and contract recruitment services for companies in the IT, Digital Media and Telecommunications industries.

items.title: Schedugram: Paid marketing analyst / SEM manager - B2B SaaS
items.content:
Paid marketing analyst / SEM manager - B2B SaaS

Company: Schedugram
Headquarters: Melbourne, Australia
https://schedugr.am
Schedugram helps our customers schedule and manage their content on Instagram. We work with customers from small businesses through to global brands, and everything in between.
We are looking for an experienced paid marketing analyst to lead our paid customer acquisition efforts. You will collaborate with our marketing team to make sure we're generating cost-effective and qualified signups that convert to being a customer.
We have a fully remote team distributed around the world. We work hard to keep our customers around the globe happy, and we're proud of our success over the last 4.5 years.

Your mission

The core mission of the paid marketing analyst is to improve our new MRR rate through increasing the number of new signups we get through paid acquisition channels (search, social and display). You'll do this through analysing our campaigns day-to-day, and continuously making changes to turbocharge success.

Your role

We'll know you are successful when you:
  • Cost-effectively acquire customers through paid channels
  • Launch new campaigns every month to identify what works best
  • Improve our MRR growth rate through paid marketing
  • Collaborate with the marketing team on integrated campaigns
  • Can run reports and quantitatively show your success to the team

Your Experience & Skills

You're a fit for this role if you:
  • Have 3+ years working in a paid marketing role in a B2B SaaS company (required)
  • Know SaaS metrics in and out (required)
  • Have previously worked remotely (preferred)
  • Have used Hubspot in the past (preferred)
  • Deeply understand the ins and outs of Google AdWords (required - our primary paid channel)
  • Can write your own copy and test different iterations
  • Are data driven to the point that you think PivotTables would be a great person to hang out with
  • Understand the different paid acquisition channels available and their likely utility for our product
  • Love to report back to the team on your success
Some understanding or experience in social media management and/or social networks (from a business users' perspective) is a plus.

Salary and remuneration

As a guide, we're looking at a salary of US$45-55k for this role, with some flexibility for the right candidate if appropriate.

Apply for this position

Apply through our portal: http://jobs.enlist.io/schedugram/jobs/7d6ec257-72e5-496d-b8fe-fb05a05e7d27

items.title: Robot AI Engineer (Planning/Scheduling/Optimization)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=6, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Robot AI Engineer (Planning/Scheduling/Optimization)

Company: Aeolus Robotics

Job Responsibilities:

You will be implementing and integrating algorithms that are applicable for high-level robot task planning and scheduling, creating C++ API interfaces, developing and fine-tuning optimization and scheduling tools.

  • Develop new, or integrate readily available solutions for high-level robot task planning and scheduling.
  • Search for and integrate, implement applicable methods for map segmentation.
  • Develop integrated robotic planning and execution environments.
  • Apply optimization methods for robot task plan optimization.

You will work in a scrum-based agile development cycle. You will be working alongside founders, researchers, and engineers to design and build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption.

You will be measured by deliverables, engineering oriented approach (instead of research focus), code quality and ability to communicate with peers and work in a team.

Experience:

  • Master degree (or PhD but application oriented, rather than research focused).
  • At least 5 years in software development, and two 2 years working in a Robot AI field.

Mandatory Requirements:

  • Experience with optimization techniques for robot task planning.
  • Experience with scheduling algorithms.
  • Experience with stochastic optimization methods and heuristic solvers.

Preferred Requirements:

  • Experience in working hands-on with robots.
  • Experience in creating solutions for industrial or service robotics usage.

Flexible Hours & 100% Remote Work:

These roles permit flexible working hours and are 100% remote.
Contract work or a permanent position: we can accommodate you.

How to apply:
careers.aeolusbot.com/recruit/Apply.na

Technical Product Manager at Footprint

San Francisco, Remote · Contract

We're transforming large organizations with chat, machine learning, and A.I.

Applied
Apply to Footprint
Add a message to Footprint
Apply

Job Description

As the first Product Manager at Footprint Labs, you'll be the conductor of our product and engineering teams.

Working directly with our CEO (head of product) and CTO, your mission is to maximize the amount of time that the product and technology teams spend on their core work (building and shipping product across multiple platforms) by minimizing their time spent on writing requirements, software blockers, meetings, designing edge case and filler features, planning sprints, and thinking about--and executing on--anything not related to shipping product.

About You: You're a missionary at heart and a product master in your head.

You can tackle large and complex software projects by breaking them down into micro-tasks, and then managing them with cloud-based services and an endearing human touch. Engineers and Product designers like working with you and for you. You know your way around startups and technology companies. Around Github, Slack, IFTTT, Pivotal Tracker, Jira, Asana, Google Documents, and more. You're proficient in product management, in writing software requirements, in building backlogs, in feature prioritization, in sprint planning, and in management of ideation-to-shipping. You've worked with distributed engineering teams. You understand and believe in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery. You don't believe in process for process' sake, however, and can distinguish between tasks that need to be fully automated and those that need a lighter touch.

Responsibilities
- Manage product delivery
- Manage product design
- Manage product development across multiple platforms--in parallel
- Manage design, product, and engineering communication
- Work closely with the CEO to define product
- Work closely with the CTO to ship product
- Write software specs
- Help build the product and engineering teams
- Prepare product presentations to the CEO and board
- Recruit, train, and expand the Product Management team at Footprint

Skills
Software Engineering, User Experience Design, Agile Project Management, Leadership, Project Management, Product Strategy, Cross-Functional Team Leadership, Cross Platform Mobile Development, Mobile Application Development, Product Requirements, Pivotal Tracker, Product Design

items.content:
Product Owner

Company: Novate IT Ltd
Location: Cwmbran
Permanent

Product Owner - iOS , Android - Cwmbran

A brand new role with a highly successful and growing employer in South Wales for a Product Owner to work across a variety of video - centric projects for their platform. A generous starting salary is offered plus benefits such as up to 10% bonus, flexi time, a 25 day holiday allowance that will increase with service, life assurance, 3% employee 6% employer initial pension package and private health care.

The company have several applications that are used by consumers on a global scale across both mobile and web platforms, these applications handle huge amounts of data with no downtime or stress on their systems. They are now looking to hire a Product Owner to help drive product development with local and remote scrum teams.

You will have experience of working in an Agile environment helping local and remote teams of cross-functional developers understand user stories and promote the company's product vision. You will be working on iOS and Android projects so you must have knowledge of both. You will also be able to balance utilising good functionality, user experience and product design. On the technical side solid experience of understanding test automation, continuous integration and deployment as well as evaluating current engineering standards and suggesting improvements is essential. Any experience of working on a video streaming, digital television, media player or similar project will be a huge benefit. As you will be interacting with a huge variety of users, developers and managers excellent communication skills are extremely important.

If you're looking to step up into a Product Owner role or grow further from your current job, joining an established company who are looking to improve their user's experience through new innovative products across iOS and Android then send in your CV today!

Novate IT Ltd is a leading supplier of permanent and contract recruitment services for companies in the IT, Digital Media and Telecommunications industries.
