items.title: Security Analyst :­ Forensics and Remediation at Defiant Inc
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About this job Job type: Full-time Role: Full Stack Developer Industry: Cybersecurity Company size: 11-50 people Company type: Private Technologies wordpressmalwarelampsecuritygrep Job description

Defiant is a fast-moving cybersecurity company that delivers the best threat protection for WordPress sites.

We’re a 100% remote team, nimble, self managing and work in a relaxed atmosphere with a sense of humor. Rather than working for a mega-corp, you will be working in a company where your work has real impact in the fun, high-growth stages of our evolution.

We are looking for security analysts to join our forensics team. You will assist our customers to investigate how their site was hacked and to repair their site and remove all traces of the intrusion. In addition to this you will also collect evidence from intrusions that will help improve our threat detection. You will need to determine how the intrusion occurred and then collect all IOC’s (indicators of compromise) and share this data with our product team in a structured way.

General requirements:

● You must be highly technical and be comfortable with a wide range of open source tools.

● Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

● You must work well in a team.

● You must be nimble, be able to come up with creative solutions to challenging problems and must have a mature approach to problem solving.

● Attention to detail.

Note: Applicants who can work weekends will be given priority consideration.

We have the highest star rating for any WordPress plugin in history and we pride ourselves on providing an excellent product with great customer service that helps secure small and large production websites. If you're passionate about information security and would like to help secure the web, this is your dream job. We take our team's family time seriously and don't ask you to work long hours if we can avoid it (we almost always can). Our entire team works remotely using Slack for casual interaction ­so you can live practically anywhere in the world as long as you have an internet connection. Wordfence is high growth, but we are not a startup. The company is still controlled by the founders, we are profitable and have been for many years. So you will enjoy the rush of high growth but you won't have to risk working for a company that is controlled by venture capitalists or may not be here tomorrow.

Apply now About Defiant Inc

At Defiant, ‘trust’ is the attribute we value most highly among our team members. We need to know that you can grab a task from a support ticketing system, communicate clearly with our customers and see the task to completion with excellent attention to detail. We don’t micro­manage and we trust that you will be able to see tasks through to completion and communicate with your fellow team members when needed or ask for help when needed. You will be working for a company that has code protecting over 2 million production websites. It is a fast­ paced real­-time environment with new challenges daily.

Benefits
  • Remote working.
  • Friendly relaxed culture.
  • Fast paced.
  • Platinum level PPO medical plan.
  • 21 days PTO per year.
  • 401k with matching contributions.
  • Opportunities to attend security conferences and Wordcamps.
  • Company paid local gym membership.
  • Company paid fees & study time for work-related courses/certifications
  • Hardware/software/gear provided for a successful home work environment

items.title: Remote - Javascript Developer Node.js (IoT - Alexa, Google Home) at Purepoint
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=44, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
About this job Job type: Contract Experience level: Senior, Lead Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer Industry: Enterprise Web Solutions, Mobile Application, Software Development Company size: 11-50 people Company type: Private Technologies node.jsjavascriptalexaalexa-voice-servicegoogle-home Job description

We are looking for a Javascript Engineer to assist with our Node.js projects. We specialise in building bespoke software for global businesses. We are remote-first by design and have a team of highly-skilled and multi-disciplined engineers. We are proponents of Agile methodologies and our primary focus is to deliver exceptional value to our customers.

Currently, we are building applications across retail, energy, and IoT sectors. Our applications make life simpler; whether its processing millions of transactions or automating the smart home.

We are looking for a talented Engineer with a very strong Javascript background to join our Node.js team. You should be used to working with Node, AWS (Lambda, API Gateway, CloudFormation), Serverless. Voice platform experience (Google Home, Alexa, Cortana etc) would give you a real competitive edge in this role too. This is a backend driven role, and you will be tackling difficult integration and architecture challenges.

This role is a full time, contract position and you can work from wherever you want. Our remote-first team are spread across 14 different countries. Our HQ is based in London, UK and you are welcome to drop by to say hello!

Skills & Qualifications

  • MUST: Very strong Javascript background (Node, ES6)
  • MUST: Experience performing in a team and working harmoniously with others
  • MUST: Native level written and spoken English
  • MUST: Experience with complex backend systems design
  • SHOULD HAVE: Experience integrating with voice systems (Google Home, Alexa etc)
  • SHOULD HAVE: Experience working with different languages and technologies
  • SHOULD HAVE: Ability to navigate, understand, and reuse large existing codebases
  • SHOULD HAVE: A basic understanding of UI/UX design principles
  • SHOULD HAVE: Functional programming experience
  • SHOULD HAVE: Experience working with complex server-side design

Responsibilities

This role is perfect for a candidate that not only enjoys development, but also wants to have input on the best approach and implementation method. On a typical day you will:

  • Take part in morning stand-up with the team via video
  • Work from a pull-based backlog of tickets writing server-side application logic to connect smart home devices and allow users to make voice command requests
  • Implement integrations between hardware and other third party voice input units such as Amazon Echo and Google Home
  • Write efficient and testable code
  • Review PRs created by your fellow team members
Apply now About Purepoint

What we look for

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and has experience working in a variety of different languages. We admire developers who take initiative, make their own decisions and implement them clearly.

Delivering exceptional value to our clients is imperative. The ideal candidate is the perfect brand ambassador; a brilliant technical mind with the accompanying interpersonal skills necessary to function in a team environment.

As a Purepoint developer you will work in a small and close-knit group. Our mindset is focused on constant iteration and improvement.

Tools

We will give you all of the tools necessary to excel at your role. We use Jira, Trello, Slack, Github and Zoom (video conferencing) in our day-to-day business.

Our managerial structure is very flat. We put customer experience and satisfaction first and really believe in delivering a service that is cutting edge.

Benefits
  • Remote
  • Unlimited Holiday Days
  • Competitive Pay
  • Personal Development
  • Open Source Funding
  • Free Lunch Fridays
  • Central London HQ
  • Open Workspace Available

items.title: Marketing Manager - Acquisition
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: beginner

COMPANY: Blissfully; 1-10 employees; 50-75% remote;

SKILLS:
• Conversion Optimization
• Marketing Copy
• Marketing
• Google Analytics
• Facebook Marketing
• Website Conversion
• Google AdWords

Blissfully is looking for scrappy, competitive marketer with at least 2 years hands-on experience managing all digital customer acquisition efforts including Google SEM, PPC, display, retargeting, paid and organic social.

The right candidate will be able to demonstrate and break down campaigns including experimentation methods that ultimately led to successful increases in acquisition. Experience with keyword management and expansion, landing page testing, bid optimization, ad copy optimization, segmentation and targeting - especially utilizing Facebook Custom Audiences and Google Customer Match (be able to speak about these in depth.)

You should have an almost unhealthy relationship with Adwords, Facebook Ad Manager and Google Analytics.

Ideally candidate will also have experience with other distribution channels like download sites, partner networks, app marketplaces, and affiliate programs.

Must be able to articulate critical KPIs for each stage of the funnel - and the ability to optimize across all acquisition channels to maintain or decrease CPA/CAC.

items.title: Chief Marketing Officer (CMO)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=19, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=15, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About the job

Make the web faster and impact the world with your talent.
We’re currently seeking an experienced Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) to define strategic plan and lead implementation of marketing strategy for our main product WP Rocket.

WP Rocket is a premium caching plugin that provides both lightning speed for WordPress websites and easy set up. To minimize the configuration needed by the site owner, WP Rocket enables the key best web performance practices upon activation.
It’s the most user-friendly caching plugin: the ability to empathize with our customers, in order to improve their experience with the plugin is very important. We also pride ourselves on providing fast and friendly support to make sure our customers are happy!  
 

As CMO of WP Rocket, you will lead outreach to new potential customers and drive customers acquisition and retention, development and execution of marketing programs, performance metrics, promotional strategies, or loyalty programs. You will work closely with our Chief Growth Officer (CGO) and a content writer on our website content, and emailing campaigns.

You will also work with CEO, CGO and COO in a board of directors each month to define and share your strategic plan and results.


Your job will include:

  • Define, write and drive all marketing communication activities to ensure customers acquisition, conversion and retention

  • Define, write and oversee marketing communication campaigns

  • Orchestrate our team of experts (SEO, Design, Developers, Social media ...)

  • Develop and maintain key metrics measuring of marketing and communication efforts, to be reported monthly and as requested

  • Implement marketing communications tools and technologies

  • Collaborate with our Product Owner on product communication strategy

 

About you

Strong communication skills and the right balance in independence are important: to work with several teammates in remote, clear communication and self-motivation are essential.

Open, curious, you're innovative, creative and constantly looking for ways to improve upon things. You have a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience as CMO for a product company and demonstrated ability to effectively communicate, write, and management.

Data-driven decision mentality, your mindset is firmly focused on the growth of a remote start-up, focused on the WordPress market, and international customers.

What we need is the following:

  • Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience as CMO for a product company

  • Time zone Europe

  • Outstanding written, visual, and oral communication skills

  • Registration, subscription, and/or e-commerce experience is required (manage marketing funnel through conversion)

  • Ability to easily shift from big picture strategy to hands-on execution.

  • Experience with segmentation & targeting (CRM), acquisition & retention (LTV), pricing & revenue (P&L and RPU) and conversion reporting & analytics (KPI).

  • Strong web analytics experience (Google Analytics)

  • Email Marketing expertise

  • Ability to flexibly adapt to a constantly growing landscape

  • Demonstrated ability to work with inside and outside resources

  • Experience with WordPress is a plus

  • In love with cats, corgies or both

 

About WP Media

WP Media is the company behind WP Rocket and our other performance plugin Imagify.
Founded in 2014, we’re a fully remote distributed team that is growing.

Here’s what we offer:

  • Friendly team      

  • Work remotely

  • Flexible hours

  • Loose vacation policy

  • Profit sharing plan

  • Annual Bonus

  • Annual budget to go to WordCamps and conferences

  • Monthly budget for your remote work needs
     

We encourage employees to enjoy their personal life by having flexible hours and unlimited vacation. We care about the work you do not the hours you do, and we want you to feel happy and fulfilled.

We’ve a very strong transparency culture, within our team and to the public.

Learn more about our Vision & Culture: Our Culture
We also publish our insights and have a public Salary Grid

items.title: Senior Technical Solutions Manager, Poultry - Raleigh, NC - DSM Nutritional Products - Home Based
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Senior Technical Solutions Manager, Poultry - Raleigh, NC
DSM Nutritional Products -Home Based
DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™
Royal DSM is a global science-based company active in health, nutrition and materials. By connecting its unique competences in life sciences and materials sciences DSM is driving economic prosperity, environmental progress and social advances to create sustainable value for all stakeholders simultaneously. DSM delivers innovative solutions that nourish, protect and improve performance in global markets such as food and dietary supplements, personal care, feed, medical devices, automotive, paints, electrical and electronics, life protection, alternative energy and bio-based materials. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 25,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.

More information can be found at www.dsm.com
Would you enjoy a technical position developing customer partnerships and providing value-linked product innovations? Are you interested in working for an industry leader that values safety, sustainability, and employee development? If you’re an experienced technical professional with a penchant for developing new markets and defining product value, along with a proven track record of success working with poultry applications – this could be the perfect match for you!
DSM Nutritional Products (DNP) is a world leading supplier of vitamins, carotenoids and other nutritional solutions with three market-facing entities: Animal Nutrition & Health, Human Nutrition & Health and Personal Care & Aroma Ingredients.
DSM addresses the global feed ingredients markets for poultry, swine, aquaculture, ruminants and pets. For all these segments, DSM is a full value chain player, providing active ingredients, delivery systems, and nutritional and premix solutions both globally and at a local level. We focus on the nutritional ingredients and additives segments of these markets.
DSM's expertise in specialty animal nutritional solutions means we are perfectly placed to benefit from the global animal nutrition and health market's drive to improve production efficiency in response to the growing demand for animal protein, while at the same time reducing the environmental impact of farming.
The Challenge:
The food animal industry is very diverse and influenced by global consumer preferences, disease challenges and direct production costs that can dramatically impact product market value. Additionally, this industry is being challenged by consumer groups and regulatory agencies to produce their meat/dairy/egg products without the aid of feed additive antibiotics and do so with less impact on environmental resources such as ground water and air pollution. Couple this with a global over-production of meat products and its little wonder why the producers are struggling to differentiate and add value to their products in a commodity-driven industry. This creates unique opportunities and challenges for New Business Development Animal Nutrition and Health (ANH) and ANH divisions to grow and remain profitable.
In order to bring value to DSM Nutritional Products product line, Senior Technical Solutions Manager Poultry provides the technical research support for DSM/NA, fulfilling roles in new product development, industry-leading research and customer-focused research partnerships that lead to expanded market share.
In the role of Senior Technical Solutions Manager Poultry, you will:
  • Be responsible for new product development for the poultry industry, drawing upon the deep scientific resources within DSM globally, as well as university and industry resources
  • Develop customer “partnerships” within the poultry industry through Platinum Poultry research facilities, including being involved in customer research initiatives and nutrition solutions that impact their business, resulting in expanded market share for DSM/NA.
  • Capture the customers’ research vision in order to keep ANH in the forefront on value-linked product innovations and ANH focused on fulfilling its strategic mission to develop new products.
  • Design, monitor, analyze and report on research studies, all focused on strengthening customer relationships and the ongoing search for new products. This position has the responsibility to ensure that trials are statistically sound and analyzed correctly.
  • Play a key role in designing and establishing the DSM/NA Application Center. This position has the responsibility to investigate and pursue the design of a premier research center designed for poultry study capabilities.
  • Execute the role as the Company’s research ambassador through involvement in industry and university working committees to forward the pursuit of cutting edge research ensuring DSM/NA is playing a leadership role in these endeavors.

The Ideal formula for success:
  • PhD in Animal Nutrition with a concentration in poultry nutrition required; PhD in Poultry Nutrition preferred
  • Strong background in statistics required
  • Minimum of 3 years of industry experience in a technical/scientific role in an animal production environment required
  • Ability to translate scientific knowledge to commercial applications
  • Sales or marketing experience considered a plus
  • Organizational management, team-building and social skills
  • Ability to influence key decision-makers who drive internal objectives which impact the key areas of accountability
  • Articulate, direct and the ability to read the audience
  • Ability to discuss and explain complex technical information to a broad range of individuals from business management to production and farm managers; from scientists and academicians to students and the general public.

This position is initially a home-based office located in the US. Relocation to the Raleigh, NC will be required in the near future (12-18 months).
The Reward:
Working for DSM means the opportunity to really contribute to improve people’s lives and solving the challenges of today’s world. Challenging jobs, career opportunities and an inspiring environment allow you to enhance your personal development. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team competencies and performance.
Procedure & Contact:
Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your Resume and Cover letter in English via the career portal (www.dsm.com/careers).
Reference check procedures are part of the DSM Recruitment & Selection Process. You will be contacted when these references checks are required.

Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

items.content:
Product Manager

Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
URL: https://dataquest.breezy.hr/p/8ca569c6fb38-product-manager?source=linkedin

At Dataquest, we teach data science to a community of hundreds of thousands of students worldwide. We help students deeply learn concepts, build projects, work together, and gain the confidence they need to start new careers. Read more about our philosophy here, and read what students think here.

We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager who’s passionate about online education. You’ll join a cross-functional team of developers and designers to design, build, and optimize a learning platform that delivers a premium learning experience to data science students around the world.

You’ll have a high degree of autonomy and input into product direction, and will play a major part in helping students worldwide learn cutting-edge skills and improve their lives.

Responsibilities

  • Work to constantly refine your understanding of the data science education and online education landscapes
  • Work directly with students to solicit feedback on the Dataquest platform
  • Work to iteratively improve the student experience on the Dataquest platform
  • Scope and prioritize development based on business and student impact
  • Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes
  • Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners
  • Evaluate promotional plans to ensure that they are consistent with product line strategy and that the message is effectively conveyed
  • Drive product launches
  • Act as an internal and external product evangelist to build awareness and understanding
  • Help the rest of Dataquest adopt documentation and project planning tools
  • Work closely with the rest of the team to help Dataquest become more data-driven in product decision making

Requirements

  • Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
  • Strong ability to bring evidence-based decision-making to your communication
  • Strong background in data science
  • Experience using Atlassian Product Suite
  • Experience with product management
  • Experience with project management
  • Strong technically - you understand how software is built, packaged and deployed
  • Passion for design and usability
  • Strong documentation and organization skills
  • Excellent proficiency in English

There's a lot of autonomy in our roles, and our goal is to help give all of our team members the correct context and resources to make the right decisions for our students.

Working at Dataquest gives you the chance to work with a mission-focused, motivated team on an important problem.

At Dataquest, you'll get:

  • The opportunity to see your impact on the lives of our students every day
  • The chance to work with an engaged and mission-driven team
  • The chance to define internal processes and help a company scale
  • The chance to contribute to product direction and decisions
  • The ability to work remotely
  • A supportive and collaborative environment

The salary range for this role is $70k USD - $95k USD per year, and it's a full-time remote role.

To apply: https://dataquest.breezy.hr/p/8ca569c6fb38-product-manager?source=linkedin

  • Strong ability to bring evidence-based decision-making to your communication
  • Strong background in data science
  • Experience using Atlassian Product Suite
  • Experience with product management
  • Experience with project management
  • Strong technically - you understand how software is built, packaged and deployed
  • Passion for design and usability
  • Strong documentation and organization skills
  • Excellent proficiency in English

There's a lot of autonomy in our roles, and our goal is to help give all of our team members the correct context and resources to make the right decisions for our students.

Working at Dataquest gives you the chance to work with a mission-focused, motivated team on an important problem.

At Dataquest, you'll get:

  • The opportunity to see your impact on the lives of our students every day
  • The chance to work with an engaged and mission-driven team
  • The chance to define internal processes and help a company scale
  • The chance to contribute to product direction and decisions
  • The ability to work remotely
  • A supportive and collaborative environment

The salary range for this role is $70k USD - $95k USD per year, and it's a full-time remote role.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Security Analyst ­ Forensics Remediation


Defiant


Defiant is a fast-moving cybersecurity company that delivers the best threat protection for WordPress sites.

We’re a 100% remote team, nimble, self managing and work in a relaxed atmosphere with a sense of humor. Rather than working for a mega-corp, you will be working in a company where your work has real impact in the fun, high-growth stages of our evolution.

We are looking for security analysts to join our forensics team. You will assist our customers to investigate how their site was hacked and to repair their site and remove all traces of the intrusion. In addition to this you will also collect evidence from intrusions that will help improve our threat detection. You will need to determine how the intrusion occurred and then collect all IOC’s (indicators of compromise) and share this data with our product team in a structured way.

General requirements:

You must be highly technical and be comfortable with a wide range of open source tools.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

You must work well in a team.

You must be nimble, be able to come up with creative solutions to challenging problems and must have a mature approach to problem solving.

Attention to detail.

Note: Applicants who can work weekends will be given priority consideration.

We have the highest star rating for any WordPress plugin in history and we pride ourselves on providing an excellent product with great customer service that helps secure small and large production websites. If you're passionate about information security and would like to help secure the web, this is your dream job. We take our team's family time seriously and don't ask you to work long hours if we can avoid it (we almost always can). Our entire team works remotely using Slack for casual interaction ­so you can live practically anywhere in the world as long as you have an internet connection. Wordfence is high growth, but we are not a startup. The company is still controlled by the founders, we are profitable and have been for many years. So you will enjoy the rush of high growth but you won't have to risk working for a company that is controlled by venture capitalists or may not be here tomorrow.

See more jobs at Defiant

items.title: Chief Marketing Officer (CMO)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=19, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=15, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Chief Marketing Officer (cmo)


WP Media

 verified
**About the job**

Make the web faster and impact the world with your talent.

We’re currently seeking an experienced Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) to define strategic plan and lead implementation of marketing strategy for our main product WP Rocket.

WP Rocket is a premium caching plugin that provides both lightning speed for WordPress websites and easy set up. To minimize the configuration needed by the site owner, WP Rocket enables the key best web performance practices upon activation.

It’s the most user-friendly caching plugin: the ability to empathize with our customers, in order to improve their experience with the plugin is very important. We also pride ourselves on providing fast and friendly support to make sure our customers are happy!

As CMO of WP Rocket, you will lead outreach to new potential customers and drive customers acquisition and retention, development and execution of marketing programs, performance metrics, promotional strategies, or loyalty programs. You will work closely with our Chief Growth Officer (CGO) and a content writer on our website content, and emailing campaigns.

You will also work with CEO, CGO and COO in a board of directors each month to define and share your strategic plan and results.

**Your job will include**:
* Define, write and drive all marketing communication activities to ensure customers acquisition, conversion and retention
* Define, write and oversee marketing communication campaigns
* Orchestrate our team of experts (SEO, Design, Developers, Social media ...)
* Develop and maintain key metrics measuring of marketing and communication efforts, to be reported monthly and as requested
* Implement marketing communications tools and technologies
* Collaborate with our Product Owner on product communication strategy

**About you**

Strong communication skills and the right balance in independence are important: to work with several teammates in remote, clear communication and self-motivation are essential.

Open, curious, you’re innovative, creative and constantly looking for ways to improve upon things. You have a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience as CMO for a product company and demonstrated ability to effectively communicate, write, and management.

Data-driven decision mentality, your mindset is firmly focused on the growth of a remote start-up, focused on the WordPress market, and international customers.

**What we need is the following:**

* Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience as CMO for a product company
* Time zone Europe
* Outstanding written, visual, and oral communication skills
* Registration, subscription, and/or e-commerce experience is required (manage marketing funnel through conversion)
* Ability to easily shift from big picture strategy to hands-on execution.
* Experience with segmentation & targeting (CRM), acquisition & retention (LTV), pricing & revenue (P&L and RPU) and conversion reporting & analytics (KPI).
* Strong web analytics experience (Google Analytics)
* Email Marketing expertise
* Ability to flexibly adapt to a constantly growing landscape
* Demonstrated ability to work with inside and outside resources
* Experience with WordPress is a plus
* In love with cats, corgies or both

**About WP Media**

WP Media is the company behind WP Rocket and our other performance plugin Imagify.
Founded in 2014, we’re a fully remote distributed team that is growing.

**Here’s what we offer:**
* Friendly team
* Work remotely
* Flexible hours
* Loose vacation policy
* Profit sharing plan
* Annual Bonus
* Annual budget to go to WordCamps and conferences
* Monthly budget for your remote work needs

We encourage employees to enjoy their personal life by having flexible hours and unlimited vacation. We care about the work you do not the hours you do, and we want you to feel happy and fulfilled.

See more jobs at WP Media

Visit WP Media's website

We are looking for Filipino, Thai, Vietnamese and Latin American Growth Marketers based in their home countries (remote work) who will be working on engaging our millennial market and suggesting product improvements to suit them.

Requirements:
-A native of the countries/regions stated above (please do not apply if you are NOT a native Filipino, Thai, Vietnamese or Latin American)
-Fluent in English
-Preferably millennial, or must be aware of the current trends with their country's youth. Fresh graduated highly preferred.
-Can create funny/witty content to engage millennials in their country
-Proficient with social media management (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram etc) -Regular user of FB Messenger (minimum) and other messaging apps popular in your country (LINE etc)
-Familiar with graphic design software (Photoshop will be ideal but apps like Canva is required)
-Must have your own device if you will work remotely
-Fun and creative!

Plus if:
-You have experience with marketing for young people (students and young professionals), student/non-profit organization experience counts
-You are tech-savvy. Can easily learn new software/apps to work more efficiently
-You have a modern design taste
-Copy/Microcopywriting skills

We are a startup and you will be the only Growth Marketer for your country/region in the team, so do not expect anyone telling you what to do. We need someone who can take ownership of their work, passionate about their craft, proactive, and always curious. We also do not work strictly according to traditionally-set office hours. We only stop working when the job is done.

If you are a creative millennial tired of the hierarchy in the corporate setting where you cannot tend to your itch to experiment, then this role is for you. Years of experience is not our priority. We appreciate your work even if it's unpaid (student/intern) or you did something as a personal project.

Please apply here and mention your social media links where we can get to know more about you! :)

You can read more about us here: http://techcrunch.com/2017/10/05/neargroup-chatbot-startup-lands-1-6m-seed-round-led-by-openocean

About this job

nodetensorflowoptimization

Job description

### DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces.

### REQUIREMENTS

* You love doing puzzles
* You have serious math skills
* You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
* You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
* You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings


## BENEFITS
#### Own Your Time
We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travelers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

#### Recharge Time
We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

#### Care For Yourself
You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

#### Focused Work
You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

#### Learn at your edges
We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.
And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

#### Clevertech Swag
And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over Slack.

items.title: Digital Marketing Executive and Strategic Communications
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Manta Ray is looking for someone to work part-time on digital marketing, communications and to support lead generation.

*Digital Marketing Executive and Strategic Communications*
* 2-3 days per week / flexible 21 hours a week*
* £25k to £35k FTE*
* Freelance or part-time contract*

*About us*
_We create elegant websites and build useful tech applications for people trying to make the world a better place._

And we enjoy what we do; providing global health organisations such as the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, The World Health Organisation and global research institutions with the technology they need to achieve their goals.

Working as their digital partner we offer a wide variety of services, but it’s time we let more people know about what we do and how we can help others.

We need your help to tell our story and support our Directors with lead generation.

We’re looking for a digital marketing and communications professional who is ready for an exciting new challenge who understands the type of services offered by digital and creative agencies. You will have experience working in this sector, and ideally a keen interest in global health issues.

This is a new role at Manta Ray with you being responsible for all our marketing efforts, managing all our communications and supporting the Directors with lead generation. We have lots of ideas in all these areas, but we need your help to formulate our strategy and drive this forward with the team’s support.

Get in touch
If this role interests you, we would love to hear from you. We’re a close-knit friendly team looking for someone who believes in what we do and wants to play an important role at Manta Ray.

Please email us mentioning your suitability, what you think you’ll bring to this role and your availability for this position and we’ll take it from there.

The role could be a freelance or part-time contract. Salary will be competitive and based on your experience.

Location(s)
Manta HQ in Shoreditch, London
Working from home (on occasion)

*Key responsibilities*

Include:

* Strategy; develop an effective communications strategy for Manta Ray in the specialised field of planetary / global health and development
* Content creation; blog articles, web copy, social media updates, html email copy
* Marketing campaigns; work closely with the team to craft small campaigns, to showcase our expertise and highlight our relevance at global meetings and events (such as World Malaria Day)
* Sales support; support the Directors with lead generation and proposal writing

*Skills & experience*

Must have:
* A professional background and relevant experience in marketing and communications is essential
* You will have experience of engaging target audiences across multiple digital channels
* 2 years’ experience in web/tech industry
* Hands-on nature, results-driven
* Adept at developing relationships and providing sound advice to colleagues
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills
* Ability to work on a variety of projects simultaneously
* Active interest in global health, science and the wonders of tech

Desired, but not essential:
* Background in global health and development

We are looking for a *Digital Marketing Executive* who is excited about managing various aspect of the Digital Marketing.

We are a Digital Marketing award-winning agency based in London but working with an international outlook.

We are proud of being a fast-growing company looking for more members to form part of a friendly digital team with big goals settled to achieve altogether.

Rich Clicks team is enthusiastic to provide the best service for the Digital Market and we are in need of a *Digital Marketing Executive WITH 3 YEARS OF PROVEN EXPERIENCE.*


*What does the role involve?*

Thanks to this role you will be able to develop and drive a successful career in the Digital Advertising industry domain with the following specific features:

* Planning and Managing PPC Campaign on Adwords and Social Media.

* Relationship directly with the clients to present and explain documents, strategies, and reports.

*Further requirements that our team will need from your role:*

* You will belong to a friendly team which will be more than happy to always help you to develop the best level of your performance, people you can rely on to support you with a full enthusiasm ready to raise the motivation and positive energy! A great atmosphere is a really important aspect that we commonly care about.

items.title: GorillaDesk: Inbound Marketing Specialist

items.content:
Inbound Marketing Specialist

Posted Jun 20

GorillaDesk
Headquarters: Boca Raton, FL
www.gorilladesk.com
View all GorillaDesk jobs →

Hi! We're GorillaDesk.

We’ve built an amazing cloud-based software solution (SaaS) for field-service professionals—most notably, the pest control industry—that enables them to organize their business, impress their clients, and connect their team without breaking a sweat.

In fact, at the time of this posting, over 5,585 professionals trust GorillaDesk to help them quote, schedule, invoice, and get paid—faster!

Which means we've been able to achieve the rare combination of growth and profitability since our inception, five years ago.

We do it by aggressively recruiting the absolute best and brightest people and structuring our company in a way that makes them want to work here forever.

It's easy to say, but very hard to execute.

OUR CULTURE

Here are the tenants we’ve embraced and how they’ve allowed us to develop a strong, motivated team, working hard towards true north:

Core Values: How we act T.I.G.E.R.

  • Tinker - Try new things. Failures are learnings.
  • Integrity - Keep your word. Be whole and complete.
  • Growth - Push yourself. Beat Prior Bests.
  • Empathy - Exist in the customer's shoes. Care for others.
  • Remarkable - Lead by example.

What you'll gain:
  • Autonomy -having control over your work: managing your own time and making decisions on what you do and when.
  • Mastery -being able to use and improve the skills you enjoy.
  • Purpose -making a difference. Understanding what you do has value.

We are also one of the early adopters of the Entrepreneurial Operating System (EOS), a new style of running an organization in a self-organizing manner that draws inspiration from agile software development and lean manufacturing processes.

Rather than hiring people for exactly one job description, we instead look to find well-rounded team members and flexible thinkers; those who can survey a wide range of sources, synthesize key insights and recommend actionable strategies to propel GorillaDesk into the future.

As a self-organizing team, our people have multiple roles and our role descriptions are regularly updated via small iterations. As their interests change and our needs change, the roles people fill change dynamically over time.
'Most startups believe in iteration of their products. Now they need to apply the same thinking to their organizations.'
– Adam Pisoni, Yammer co-founder & CTO

That said, EOS is not unstructured: you'll have a clear understanding of your current roles and responsibilities.
Even though EOS is a lot to learn, we have a great onboarding process and the rest of our team will guide you through your first few months.

Every team member gets 11 company-wide holidays per year as well as 13 paid time off days which can be used as you please.Go have fun. Don't work all the time.

Our team members also work hard, are constantly learning, and accomplish a ton for the company in the time that they are working.

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

As our Inbound Marketing Specialist, you’ll be responsible for attracting traffic through search engines, social media, and blogs. Once you have attracted our ideal customers’ attention, you'll convert them into leads using leading magnets, landing pages, and conversion rate optimization. Finally, you'll help us increase our close rate by leveraging marketing automation, email marketing, and return path technology (remarketing).

Specifically, some of your responsibilities will include:

  • WEB DESIGN & BRANDING
Sales Pitch Discovery & Differentiation:Discover what makes our business unique, and why customers should choose us.

Brand Messaging & Buzzwords:Create a bank of buzz words with killer messaging that our potential customers will love.

Modern Site Design:Ensure our website looks clean, professional, unique, and perfectly showcases our brand for years to come.

Site Architecture:Figure out exactly which pages we actually need, and create a butter-smooth user experience.

Money Pages:Identify and build pages meant specifically to pull lucrative search traffic that’ll actually make us money.

Mobile Optimization: Perfectly optimize our website for all screens and devices so we can reach the largest market possible.

Sitewide SEO Optimization:Ensure our website works in tandem with a killer SEO strategy to win tons of traffic.

WordPress Backend Development:Ensure our website is stable, agile and easy to upgrade. There’s a reason WP is so popular.

  • CONTENT MARKETING
Competitor Content Analysis:Analyze heaps of our competitors’ best work, finding out what makes them so powerful... then beat them.

Content Strategy Development:Formulate a plan to write better, longer, and more valuable content so our business wins more leads.

Sales Content Creation:Create content that makes life easy for your sales team by smashing buying resistance.

SEO Content Creation:Craft content that seduces Google without sacrificing quality for our readers and customers.

Branding Content Creation:Develop our brand with a voice our customers love, and convert them as brand advocates.

Consistent, Charismatic Content:Deliver content that people actually enjoy reading. Over and over again. The result? More leads.

  • SEARCH ENGINE OPTIMIZATION
Competition Analysis:Look closely at what’s working for our competitors and beat them at their own game.

Deep Keyword Research:Find the quickest path to success by developing a keyword strategy that brings profitable traffic to our site.

Internal & External Linking Strategy:Google rewards sites that have powerful links. So you'll build all the links we need to win the Google game.

Link Acquisition:Google judges your domain power by links. Get us the powerful links we need to make our domain a juggernaut.

Technical Audits:Don’t let a single drop of SEO juice go to waste. Get and keep our site in top shape.

  • PAID CAMPAIGNS
Paid Channel Strategy:Figure out the channels that actually matter to our customers (and your bottom line).

Media Asset Strategy & Creation:All the creative work to attract clicks to our website... done.

Google Retargeting Campaign & Management:Setup and optimize successful remarketing campaigns with Google Adwords that will target prospects who have already visited our site.

Facebook Retargeting Campaign & Management:Setup and optimize successful retargeting campaigns with Facebook that will target prospects who have already visited our site.

Google Adwords Keyword Strategy:Discover the keywords with the biggest benefit to our business—that competitors are missing.

Google Adwords Campaign & Management:Create and manage smart Adwords campaigns designed to leapfrog competing ads and win more business.

Facebook Ads Campaign & Management:Create and manage Facebook campaigns that integrate naturally with our customers’ online ecosystem.

  • MARKETING AUTOMATION
Lead Magnet Strategy & Creation: Create powerhouse lead magnets that actually provide value to our customers. The result will be a huge list of potential customers to market to.

CTA Strategy & Implementation: Get our lead magnets downloaded, our list subscribed to, and our inbox stuffed to the brim.
Product Cyclers: For those with an e-commerce store, we'll create a system that constantly offer enticing deals and hot offers to people who are waiting for an excuse to buy.

Sales Funnels: We typically use ClickFunnels and Drip because they're powerful automation tools that makes sales and follow-up funnels well….effortless.

Promotional Vault: Create a system that constantly offers enticing deals and hot offers to people who are waiting for an excuse to buy.

Sales Email Sequences: Create emails that keep reeling in the fish long after they’ve left our site with sales emails that actually get read.

Company Newsletters: Consistently adding value to our customers’ lives is important. Create everything it takes to build trust and rapport for the long haul.

*We don’t expect you to be able to do all these things. That’s silly and unrealistic. But we do expect you to take extreme ownership over any of the above (or your own) projects you decide to work on.
Our goal is to offer the greatest remote work environment possible.

Apply for this position

chris@gorilladesk.com

items.title: Product Manager
items.content:
Benivo is looking for a Product Manager to join the team.

This is an exciting opportunity to be at the centre of a tech company looking to improve the welcome experience of relocating employees as we scale our solution to multiple international markets alongside some of the top employers in the world.

In this role, you will look after the development of our client platforms and delivering features that delight our users and enable them to work more efficiently. You’ll define the product backlog based on our strategy, customer and internal needs, and work closely with the management team to shape the long-term product vision.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manage the definition, delivery, and measurement of new features and improvements
  • Clearly communicate the purpose, definition, and delivery status of new features to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Collaborate with designers to create clear, visually appealing UI and UX
  • Manage the product backlog and coordinate its delivery with the development team
  • Efficiently manage requirements gathering meetings with internal teams
  • Proactively suggest new features and enhancements to improve our products and KPIs

PROFILE

  • At least 2 years product owner/manager experience, preferably with a remote development team
  • Knowledge and experience working in Agile environments, especially Scrum
  • Familiar with different product prioritisation frameworks
  • Excellent organisational skills
  • Good stakeholder management skills
  • Good written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Startup experience
  • Comfortable querying and analysing user data
  • Able to independently write SQL queries
  • Experience with common web data analytics packages, such as Google Analytics and Mixpanel
  • Keen eye for spotting UI defects, as well as functionality bugs
  • Comfortable and confident presenting to audiences of varying technical knowledge

Nice to have

  • Technical background in software development
  • Proficient in Russian or Armenian

ABOUT BENIVO

Benivo is an award-winning tech B2B start-up that builds a product for the most innovative companies in the world. With technology, we enable employers to effectively support the relocation of their junior employees on a budget, whether they’re moving to a new city or country. The mission? Make every employee welcome.

The Benivo team is made up of driven and hard-working people but we also like to have fun. We strive to offer a flexible working environment and modern approach when it comes to office culture. The ideal candidate will fit right in - they’ll work hard, quickly slot in as part of the Benivo team and be passionate about the Benivo mission.

items.title: Growth Hacker, Marketing
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: expert

COMPANY: Selfkey Foundation; 10-50 employees; 75-100% remote;

SelfKey is a blockchain-based self-sovereign identity system that allows individuals and companies to truly own, control and manage their digital identity. In today’s world, your digital identity details are stored across thousands of servers in various places where you’ve registered an account. Ongoing large-scale hacks of stolen data in recent years have shown that big centralized stores of information pose serious security concerns.

During recent ICO, Selfkey reached the 'Public Sale Max Cap' in 11 minutes, raising $22M in the public sale. Built on open-source technology, our products power various market and business use cases, such that; enable users to instantly and securely obtain citizenship and residency by investment, access hundreds of FinTech products and services, incorporate companies, open bank accounts, authorize to trade on exchange platforms, manage cryptocurrency portfolios & receive/send/store ETH (or any ERC-20 token), and more.

We believe the future of identity management lies in utilizing blockchain technology because it’s decentralized, immutable, and protected by cryptography. You’ll be able to take full ownership of your personal data and identity, while sharing only the necessary information with other individuals or organizations. When it comes to crypto exchanges, financial products, and token sales - this can remove the often complex, repetitive, and redundant process of KYC/AML (Know Your Customer / Anti-Money Laundering). SelfKey makes this process simple, painless, and easy.

Responsibilities: We are looking for a data-driven marketing professional to join our team. You will help build and execute our marketing and branding strategy to grow our community as well as increase brand awareness and audience presence across our user base. This is a cross-functional role. You should have excellent multitasking skills to execute our social media strategy and bolster the marketing team in general. You will be required to report on progress using data and numbers. You should be familiarized with blockchain and cryptocurrencies. This is a remote position requiring optimal communication skills (written and verbal) as well as some technology savvy; working with software tools, remote systems, etc.
You will be working within our marketing team and in very close collaboration with sales, business development and product teams to execute on company strategy for product launch and marketing.

Requirements:
- 5+ years of Digital Marketing experience, ideally in Paid and Organic Media Management
- 2+ years of professional experience helping enterprise technology/software start-up ventures scale — blockchain is a huge plus.
- 2+ years of experience working in an agency marketing setting.
- Experience setting/ contributing to strategy as well as taking on the role of hands on implementor
- Excellent Social Media management skills across all channels
- Very good understanding of all digital marketing channels. Previous hands on experience in any digital marketing specialty is an advantage.
- Good understanding of blockchain industry and cryptocurrency. Please do not apply if you do not possess a strong personal interest in this space which has impelled extensive independent research, at minimum.
- Experience presenting monthly marketing reports to executive management teams, driven by quantitate marketing data-metrics, i.e., KPI’s. Google Analytics skills required, certification is a plus.
- Ability to deliver media to niche target-audiences.
- Good theoretical understanding and hands-on application with A/B testing insofar as it may concerns marketing content and delivery result/s.
- Proven (by data) track of delivering outstanding results and growth contribution
- Comfortable being accountable for goals as well as taking ownership of marketing strategy and implementation
- Experience working in a start-up environment or culture is preferred; how well do you deal with ambiguity and how effective are you when things are not always so well-defined?
- Highly adaptable to new tools, systems, and workflows
- Respectfully share your opinion even when this is different of others
- Buy in on management decisions and execute accordingly

items.title: Like writing about growth marketing?
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Like writing about growth marketing?

Company: GrowthMentor
Location: Anywhere and Everywhere
Job Type: Contract

Description

GrowthMentor (https://www.growthmentor.io) is looking for experienced bloggers to write unique and intriguing blog content on topics surrounding startup life, growth marketing, and ultimately, tieing it into mentorship.

This is a 2-sided marketplace that's currently in pre-BETA and we're now looking for an experienced remote writer to join our team.

Potential topics may include:

  • How finding a growth mentor can help you to grow your startup
  • How to achieve a healthy work/life balance
  • Mistakes founders make
  • Top # mistakes people make in <insert here growth marketing discipline ie. PPC, content marketing, Social, etc.>
  • Top # <insert here genre of marketing tool> and how  <insert here persona> use them to do <insert here business benefit>

We're a self-financed startup that's passionate about creating a disruptive platform that will help startups maximize their chances of success.

Content topics we’re looking for

  • Lead generation
  • Churn reduction / retention / customer success
  • Growth strategies and frameworks
  • Raising financing
  • Content marketing and SEO
  • Marketing automation
  • Conversion rate optimisation
  • Growth mindset and psychology
  • Tutorials on marketing tech
  • Mentoring

The style and tone we’re looking for

  • Conversational tone
  • The posts must help readers accomplish something, and/or learn from examples
  • Does not follow conventional 5 paragraph essay format - short concise paragraphs that are easy to read
  • Fully formatted sections to make posts easy to skim through

Who we're looking for

  • Someone with a passion for growth, marketing, and business
  • Someone who can tell a great story
  • Someone who loves writing in-depth and thought-provoking articles
  • Someone who can come up with story ideas with minimal guidance
  • Experience in the startup scene and well-versed in full-stack growth marketing concepts from top of the funnel to bottom of the funnel.
  • Someone with experience using tools like Zapier, Slack, Drip, Trello, and other popular marketing and project management tools.
  • Someone who doesn't mind getting their hands dirty and interviewing experts in order to spice up blog posts with unique data that you can't find anywhere else.
  • Someone who is excited to be a part of something that's potentially disruptive.

Fill in Typeform to apply.

Learn why we're building this platform here.

Application Instructions

To apply, please fill in the Typeform link.

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javac#

Job description

The Vice President of Technical Product Management works with our product teams to design, maintain, and improve products and features within our organization's portfolio.

As Vice President of Technical Product Management, you will be expected to make informed Important Technical Decisions (ITDs) for a  product and deliver highly technical product specs to support their implementation.

You will have access to teams of top performers all over the world to aid you in this task.

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Define data structures and object models.

Solve high-value problems using algorithms.

Map solutions to large “building blocks” of existing open source components and cloud services.

Make decisions that reduce scope in favor of simplicity.

Communicate clearly and effectively.

Lead and manage a team.

Create technical design specs that define the core of software products.

Apply modern software design patterns (think cloud, containerization, etc)  to product requirements.

Review and provide feedback to more junior product managers, turning your decisions into detailed engineering plans.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

Bachelors of Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering. Minimum 5 years of hands-on production code development in Java or C#.

Minimum 3 years experience making core technical design decisions.

Ability to identify and articulate patterns in unstructured and unorganized content.

Excellent written communication skills including architecture diagrams, data flows, and system component diagrams.

A passion for creating and continuously improving workflows in a process-driven way.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere
  • Choose your own hours
  • Flat organization
  • Work with talented people all over the world
  • Committed to diversity
  • Competitive compensation

Job description

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

The Senior Vice President of Technical Product Management directly impacts the success of our organization via our product teams.

We need someone who can be responsible for building and managing an elite Technical Product Management team. Each member of this elite team holds the title of “Vice President of Technical Product Management” within a specific division of our portfolio.

The ultimate goal of this effort is to strengthen our teams by facilitating collaboration and communication between them.

The Senior Vice President of Technical Product Management, as well as each of their team members, will be expected learn and use a wide array of existing third-party technologies.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

Know when and how to design new data structures and algorithms.

Apply modern software design patterns (think cloud, containerization, etc) to product requirements.

Understand the fatal impact that poor product design decisions can have and strategies on how to avoid them.

Communicate their technical decisions in a clear, written manner so that other people on the team may follow their direction.

Define data structures and object models.

Create algorithms to solve high-value problems.

Map solutions to large “building blocks” of existing open source components and cloud services.

Make decisions that reduce scope in favor of simplicity.

Communicate clearly (especially in writing).

Provide active daily feedback to individual contributors writing Important Technical Decisions. Help make them simpler and clearer.

Lead and manage a team. Interview new VPs of Technical Product Management and guide them through a structured training period.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

BS in CompSci, CompE, or EE. 5+ years of hands-on production code development in Java or C#.

3+ years experience making the core technical design decisions that were then implemented by other developers.

Excellence in reducing overly complicated and unstructured answers into a set of simple and structured decisions.

Ability to identify and articulate patterns in unstructured and unorganized content.

Excellent written communication skills including architecture diagrams, data flows, and system component diagrams.

A passion for creating work in a process-driven way and working with team members to continuously improve that process.

Experience working for a Top 100 software development company such as:

  • Microsoft, Google, Oracle, Facebook, etc.
  • A leading financial institution such as Goldman Sachs, Citi, HFT Trading firm, etc.

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Education Technology, eLearning, Non-Profit
Company size: 201-500 people

Technologies

securityjavascript

Job description

Summary

We are looking for a smart security practitioner with an interest in large scale systems. You understand the importance of testing and documentation, and common pitfalls in developing secure web applications. You must have a passion for the WMF mission. We do (almost) everything publicly, and volunteers can add arbitrary JavaScript to our site. That should both frighten and thrill you.

Privacy is one of the core values of the Wikimedia Foundation and you will be joining the team responsible for providing technical and governance security solutions to ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of Wikimedia applications.  This is your opportunity to participate in and provide security and privacy solutions so together we can create a world in which everyone can freely share in the sum of all knowledge.  

This is what you will be doing:

  • Review security controls, policies and procedures and provide recommendations for the adaption of new technologies or policies.  
  • Conduct internal and external security audits
  • Provide support for security incidents or events
  • Evaluate current organizational risk and threat profile
  • Identify improvement areas and provide organization wide security awareness training.  
  • Work with teams to ensure they make safe, compliant, design and architectural decisions
  • Participate in privacy initiatives
  • Participate in operational security initiatives

You’ll need these skills and experience:

  • 5+ years experience as part of an Information Security team
  • CISSP/GIAC
  • Experience in policy creation and enforcement
  • Experience with Threat Modeling and Risk Assessments
  • Experience in Incident Response
  • Bachelor’s degree in CS or related field or the equivalent in work related experience

Pluses

  • Wikimedia community experience
  • Interest in/passion for all things open source

The Wikimedia Foundation is... 

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

Benefits & Perks *

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

* for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by location

More information

WMF

Blog

Annual Report - 2017

Wikimedia 2030



Apply now

About Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.

The Wikimedia Foundation is...

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

Benefits

  • Fully paid premiums for medical, dental & vision insurance premiums
  • 401(k) with 4% matching contribution
  • 7-12 weeks parental leave with 100% pay + lactation room
  • Wellness Program ($1800 annual) to promote wellness & personal growth
  • Pre-tax savings plans for Transportation & Parking
  • Flexible work schedules and remote working options
  • Pet Friendly office
  • Commitment to diversity & inclusion throughout the employee lifecycle
  • 12 days vacation, 19 days holiday, 2 days volunteer work and more!
  • Lean more at https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Work_with_us
