SEO Account Strategist (Entry Level)

Posted Jun 19

51Blocks
Headquarters: Remote (Denver, CO)
https://www.51blocks.com/contact/careers/
View all 51Blocks jobs →

51Blocks is Denver's premier boutique Internet Marketing Agency. We provide SEO, PPC, Social Media, and other internet marketing tools and services for small businesses. We are looking for an excellent communicator that can help manage accounts. Our goal is to hire passionate individuals who want to work with a great team and wonderful clients in the comfort of their own home.

Is this you or what you like?

  • Autonomy - We welcome people who are looking to drive their own success.  Someone who enjoys working without a boss looking over your shoulder. Someone who likes to have their own time and space to do their best work.  Together we will set goals and define what success looks like together.

  • Purpose - At 51Blocks we are looking for someone who enjoys growing and developing business online - helping them understand their ROI and showing them how we grow their business.  We have people who love helping small business but at the same time are growing their passion in different areas. For example, we have Reggie who loves music and creates his own. Any time we run into anything in that field he loves working and helping those people.  What is your passion and how can we align that?

  • Always Learning - We welcome new ideas and always want you to be learning.  We hope that you would have a curiosity that pushes you to learn and grow consistently.

  • Who You Will Report To - You will work directly with the Founder and Owner of the company along with the Marketing Manager.

Requirements:

  • 2-3+ years' experience with SEO & local SEO: (Google + Local)

  • Be able to maintain normal office hours in a quiet working environment with a fast internet connection

  • Love being part of a virtual team atmosphere

  • Google Analytics certified (or plan to become within 30 days of hiring)

  • Experience with social media a plus

  • Basic Understanding of Wordpress

  • Basic knowledge of Google Analytics & Google Search Console

  • Comfortable conducting client calls one-on-one

  • Experience or ability to organize task work

  • Must be detail oriented and very thorough with your work

  • Need to be able to thrive in a fast pace environment

  • Must be a quick learner

  • Passion for Internet Marketing is a must!

  • Must have a positive outlook on life

Working Remotely

  • Hours - You must work US hours

  • US Based - You must be based in the United States (non-negotiable)
  • Number of Hours - This will be an hourly position.  You will start with a few clients and then move up from there.  Every client has a certain number of hours you will work on them.  You will set the strategy and then execute against it.

  • Pay - $18 to start, $20 after 90 days.

  • Moving Fast - We will be moving fast with this position so please have availability to start right away.

  • 1099 to W2 employment offered after 1 year with good company status, so commitment to this position is essential

  • Senior Strategist career paths are available for the right person

If this position sounds like something you want to be a part of please apply.  We will reach back out in a few days if there is a good fix. We hope that whoever applies enjoys having fun and working hard every day.  


Apply for this position

brittany@51blocks.com

items.title: Social Media Marketing Manager
items.content:
Social Media Marketing Manager

  • Marketing
  • Anywhere in US
  • Posted June 19
  • GitHub
    • Full Time

    Overview

    Since 2008, GitHub has brought developers together to collaborate, share ideas, and solve problems. To date, over 27 million developers and thousands of businesses use GitHub every day to build and share their projects with people all around the world. Connecting with our passionate, powerful, and forward-thinking community is what continues to drive us every day.

    We’re looking for a experienced social media marketing manager to join the team to help strengthen these connections—bringing people together across our social channels and further reinforcing GitHub and the community. This person thinks of social media as more than a channel to simply share a message—they see it as an important way to make connections. As a steward of our brand and voice, this role requires a deep understanding of the social landscape as well as the developer community.

    This role will be responsible for driving the social strategy across GitHub, managing our main company channels, actively engaging with the community, working cross-functionally to provide strategic planning for campaigns and launches, and managing all reporting. The role is a part of brand marketing but will rely on close collaboration across the company. Some teams this person will work with include: product marketing, field marketing, communications/PR, developer marketing, digital, content, and creative. This role can be based anywhere in the US.

    Responsibilities:
    • Develop strategies and programs that bring together the GitHub brand and our community around a shared conversation
    • Successfully and consistently capture the GitHub brand voice across all channels
    • Build on and optimize the company social media strategy
    • Create and manage workflow and processes to better align and scale corporate accounts
    • Provide strategic social input and support on campaign launches, go-to-market plans, corporate announcements, and thought leadership
    • Drive day-to-day community management across the main GitHub Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram channels
    • Be an advocate for our developer community—evangelise, support, and celebrate their work and always approach projects considering what they care about, what they’re needs are, and what excites them
    • Develop and lead social media marketing campaigns to help grow and strengthen our communities of followers
    • Regularly track, monitor, and optimize performance of campaigns and accounts

      • Minimum Qualifications:
      • 5-7 years experience directly managing social media accounts and building a social presence for a brand
      • Proven track record of driving social strategies and programs that create impact on key business goals
      • Demonstrated ability to deliver results in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
      • Direct experience working with and marketing to developers (or is one themself)
      • Must be comfortable contributing strategically as well as managing day-to-day tactical execution
      • Ability to collaborate with wide audiences at all levels and work effectively across functions and geographies (we are a global and remote-friendly company)
      • Strong interpersonal skills and a high level of empathy
      • Strong communication skills
      • Strong copywriting (for social and/or short form content) experience

        • Who We Are:

        GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over 24 million people use GitHub to build amazing things together across 67 million repositories. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com and GitHub Business, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write faster, better code.

        What We Value:

         We believe the best work is done together.  We believe in putting people first.  We believe in setting the standard for excellence.  We believe in making the world a better place through our work.  We believe in creating things for the people using them.

        Collaboration:
        Empathy:
        Quality:
        Positive Impact:
        Shipping:

        Why You Should Join:

        At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We’ve designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where over half of our Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The other half of our Hubbers work remotely in 18 countries across the globe. 

        Here is a complete list of where we can hire!

        We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We’ve designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we’ve built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.

        GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don’t discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there’s any way we can make the interview process better for you; we’re happy to accommodate!

        Where We Can Hire

        Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to ask your Talent Partner.

items.content:
CTO/CPO, Product Development and Hands-on Developer (remote)
Join our Foundation Team—Tech

This is a unique opportunity for you to work at a fast-growing online startup, alongside a purposeful, passionate, international and welcoming team. It’s a chance to put your passion and knowledge of product management, product design, prototyping and development into practice whilst supporting our journey that truly seeks to create change. We are looking for a resourceful and enthusiastic expert to lead our product development.

We are looking for a high-performance team player—Is this You?

- Possesses both broad and deep technology knowledge, business acumen and experience with development of innovative tech solutions.
- Extensive experience in product development to achieve an organisational vision and business goals.
- The capacity to both ask and answer key questions regarding technology, to lead the choice of technology in relation to the business strategy, available resources and trends, including the ability to help the team visualize the possibilities.
- The ability to balance a strategic outlook with an extremely hands-on approach in coding and development.
- A proven hands-on experience and record of developing Products.
- The ability to maintain an innovation-driven mindset and provide critical inputs for product creation.
- The ability to perform analysis and hands-on design with respect to innovative and patentable algorithms.
- Passionate about prototyping, product design, developing, QA and beyond.
- Prototyping Tools experience and knowledge consisting of some of the following: InVision, typeform, IFTTT, Zapier, google forms, chatbots, python, etc.
- Front-End Development experience and knowledge consisting of some of the following:
- Web fundamentals like HTML, JavaScript, CSS, AJAX
- JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS, React, or Ember etc., or JS-based build tools like Grunt, Gulp, and Bower
- Libraries like jQuery or Backbone.js
- Front-end (CSS) frameworks like Foundation or Bootstrap
Back-End Development Experience and knowledge consisting of some of the following:
- API design and development
- RESTful Services
- Object-oriented programming: Java, C++, C#, Python, PHP, Ruby, Perl
- Database technologies like MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL
- Web server technologies like Node.js, J2EE, Apache, Nginx, ISS, etc.
- Frameworks related: Express.js, Ruby on Rails, CakePHP, etc.
- Has a minimum of 10 years of relevant experience with technology and internet businesses.
- Has worked in remote online teams for at least 5 years.
- Hands-on practical experience with collaborative digital tools, such as Asana, Basecamp, Facebook Workplace, Google Calendar, Google Docs, Google Forms, Google Drive, Google Sheets, Google Slides, Microsoft Office 365, RealTimeBoard, Skype, Slack, Trello, and Typeform.
- Excellent English both verbal and written.
- Willing to work for future equity while we are in startup mode.

We would love if you have the following too
- The capacity to identify market requirements, define the product vision in collaboration with the team, create preliminary architecture, design concepts and shape the Product Roadmap for the organisation’s Platform.
- The capacity to empathize with the end users and bring insights that translate into robustness of our Platform, through exceptional UX and cost-efficiency.
- Great product management skills, the capacity to successfully deal with complexity, unpredictability and changes alongside the ability to prioritise and delegate work.
- Great people skills and the ability to successfully work in teams.
- The ability to keep a lean approach and gracefully adapt the Product Roadmap to the changing needs of the organisation and the environment.
- An idea generator and strategist when it comes to technology optimisation.
- A drive to keep an eye on technology and the competitive landscape to stay ahead of the trends and competition alongside.

Why Join us?
- A unique opportunity to earn equity and be part of an early stage startup.
- Enjoy a very flexible working environment: online, remote, working up to 80% of the time that you prefer, no travel required.
- Exclusive opportunity for mentorship to guide your ambitions.

Our Offer
- Full-time or part-time online position, with a full-time or 20+ hours commitment repectively, for the duration of at least 1 year.
- Your Reward will be based on future equity as we are in startup mode.

How to Apply
Please complete the form on our website under 'opportunities'

Who are we?
- We are a purposeful, passionate, international, multi-generational team based in Berlin, London, and Zurich.
- We are pioneering new ways of working and disrupting the leadership space.

Part-Time Digital Marketing Manager

Posted Jun 19

Happy Herbivore
Headquarters: Walnut, CA
https://happyherbivore.com
View all Happy Herbivore jobs →


Qualifications

The ideal candidate should have a broad set of marketing skills from SEO, blogging, advertising, analytics, PR, and social media experience. You will lead the marketing efforts and set the direction.

Three-four years of previous marketing experience.

Knowledge of diet and fitness is helpful but not required.

Experience working remotely.

Highly creative.

Ability to manage and direct 2-4 additional creative freelancers.

Strong, convincing writing skills.

Duties

  • Develop company’s overall marketing strategy

  • Work with the founders and freelance writers to publish newsletters, research SEO focused blog posts, and develop secondary content that supports the promotion with video, audio, and outreach

  • You will be responsible for managing all marketing activities: schedule, setting deadlines and coordinating all the people involved

  • You’ll need to help us research and pick SEO keyword topics in Ahrefs

  • Our goal to work with writers to create a least two high-quality SEO focused blog posts each month focused on the topics of vegan weight-loss, health, and food.

  • Coordinate a team consisting of a designer, copywriters, and a publishing assistant.

  • Improve our marketing and creation processes and make our systems more efficient.

  • Utilize creative energy to tie in blog posts with videos, social media and overall online marketing.

Your marketing skills and ability to execute are the most important. It might help if you have some interest in diet and health, but it’s certainly not required.

Questions

1, What aspect of Marketing do you enjoy the most?

2. Tell me about a business system that you've implemented and what worked and what didn't work?

3. Tell me about 3 SEO successes and 3 SEO failures. What worked? What didn’t work? What would you do differently?

4. Please send links to 2-3 strong online writing samples.

Details

  • 20-30 hours per week, varies weekly.

  • This is a contract job.

  • Salary range: $40-$50 per hour commensurate with experience.

Apply for this position

Send a resume, with all materials listed above to elizabeth@wellcoachedconsulting.com, subject line "Happy Herbivore"

items.content:
Digital Analytics Consultant / Google Analytics at InfoTrust

Cincinnati, United States, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Javascript, Web Analytics, Consulting, Client Management, Google Analytics, • Google Analytics and Google Webmaster Tools, Google Tag Manager, Client Education, Google data studio
Compensation
$72K–$86K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Available

Job Description

Rocketship -- that is the word that was used to explain what it is like to join InfoTrust at this time. We have done all the prep, we have build this amazing architecture for success (the ship) not we are getting ready to launch? Are you ready to board?

We are currently looking for a DIGITAL ANALYTICS CONSULTANT who is an expert in analytics and digital marketing.

The Digital Analytics Consultant role will be responsible for client management, advanced implementations of Google Analytics, auditing and troubleshooting existing configurations, and reporting analysis to improve clients’ digital marketing initiatives.

You will work closely with web analytics engineer/architect to develop custom tagging and measurement systems.

Responsibilities:

- Identifying client objectives and mapping suitable analytics solutions, ensuring that all required performance data can be reliably tracked and reported
- Advanced Google Tag Manager architecture and setup of complex tracking scripts
- Producing analytics audit reports for corrective or advanced Google Analytics tracking and data collection architecture
- Performing ad-hoc analytics consultancies for clients and documenting the work
– Delivering analytics audit reports to clients and presenting findings in person or via conference calls
- Representing the InfoTrust team in client meetings and presentations, providing technical analytics input
- Assisting in educating clients on the importance of online measurement & providing best practice guidance for technical aspects of analytics
- Providing training to clients ranging from product training for marketing teams to implementation training for technical teams
- Providing consultancy on campaign tagging and providing consultancy on campaign tagging and additional on-site tracking
- Providing guidance to data analysts to produce marketing dashboards via Google Drive, Excel and various APIs

Requirements

We are looking for someone the possess our core values and is looking for a place to drive impact, provide superior client support with GA and is looking for learn and grow as an individual and share that knowledge to drive the company towards continued success. The Senior Consultant would be expected to have the following background to be successful:

- Experience working with clients in a consulting role
- Well versed in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager -- from developing client specific implementation plans, to overseeing the implementation and assisting them to identify key ways to improve their marketing initiatives based on the good clean data that InfoTrust will provide.
- Proven experience as a team player -- You enjoy working in a fun and collaborative culture and are willing to take initiative!

We are looking for someone in Cincinnati, Ohio. Ask why Cincinnati might be a great option to relocate to -- we are happy to brag about our city!

We would be willing to consider remote (experienced) workers, just let us know why you are great at working remotely.

Must be authorized to work for any US employer.

items.title: IWD Agency: CONTENT MARKETING GURU
items.content:
CONTENT MARKETING GURU

Posted Jun 18

IWD Agency
Headquarters: Baton Rouge, US
https://iwd-agency.breezy.hr/p/f59061931f6d-content-marketing-guru?source=weworkremotely
View all IWD Agency jobs →

About IWD:

IWD Agency is a leading eCommerce agency with a fun, energetic, innovative and exciting culture. We believe in the GSD method: get shit done and this has led to us being awarded LSU’s Top 100 Fastest Growing Businesses for the past 4 years. Our focus is in online retail and we are darn good at it. We are looking for energetic, passionate people to join our team.

We are headquartered in downtown Baton Rouge, just steps away from many local restaurants, pubs, museums, the Mississippi River and many other activities. As a leader in the online retail industry, we work with many high profile clients and international brands. We believe in being passionate about our work, having fun, and delivering the best results.

Our team members enjoy great pay and benefits, a casual, relaxed work style and a friendly, collaborative environment.

While IWD's main office is located in Baton Rouge, we would be open to new hires possibly performing this job remotely.

Full-time employees enjoy benefits such as:

  • Paid Vacation
  • Paid Holidays
  • 401k Retire Plans
  • Health Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • Monthly Social Events (such as 13th Gate Haunted House, Painting With a Twist, LSU Tailgates, Plantation Tours, Skyzone Trampoline Park)
Core Values

Everything we do at IWD centers around our core values. To be considered for any position, you must have the following in your DNA:

  • Innovative
  • Accountable
  • Passionate
  • Team Player
  • Perfectionist

SEO / Content Marketing Guru Mission:

Create amazing, captivating content and distribute it to online mediums in order to drive high quality traffic and value.

Content could be written, video or audio and distribution can be any online medium in order to capture the largest audience possible.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Accountable for all content marketing initiatives to drive traffic, engagement, leads, that deliver sales and customer retention.
  • Create monthly reports to show improvements in terms of traffic, revenue, and number of leads generated with the ability to show return on investment.
  • Research article content at a responsible speed without sacrificing depth or accuracy
  • Interview subject matter experts within client companies to capture their unique insights and content objectives, and to identify what external material it will be necessary to reference or engage.
  • Produce content using key SEO strategies to further organic listings within search engines.
  • Collaborate with relevant parties to develop and maintain proper/distinct messaging, branding, and consistency for each client company.
  • Diligently complete projects by deadlines.
  • Review SEO considerations and offer site structure recommendations to clients.
  • Ability to continuously test and evolve different content strategies (audio, video, PR, blog, etc) in order to increase visibility.

OUTCOMES:

Expected outcome expected to be fulfilled by this role.

OUTCOMES


1

Increase client leads and extension revenue on IWD Agency by 30% through driving organic traffic. (within first five months of hire)

2

Retain & maintain three active content marketing clients (within first four months of hire)

3

Work with management to create service level marketing plans for clients. (within two months of hire)

4

Create and implement content creation plan for IWD Agency. (within first month of hire)


You will be a good fit for this position if you never say "that's not my job", relentlessly optimistic, work hard, bleed your company colors, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Oh, and you want to have a lot of fun while you're doing it!

Apply for this position

https://iwd-agency.breezy.hr/p/f59061931f6d-content-marketing-guru?source=weworkremotely

items.title: Dexter Agency: Digital marketer with CRO experience
items.content:
Digital marketer with CRO experience

Posted Jun 18

Dexter Agency
Headquarters: Malta
https://dexteragency.recruitee.com/o/digital-marketer-with-cro-experience
View all Dexter Agency jobs →

Are you an experienced digital marketer? Do you have a hunger to generate more revenue for clients? Are you passionate about and do you have (a first) experience with conversion optimization? Then this job is definitely something for you! Our company will train and coach you to become a top-notch conversion optimization consultant.

Under the guidance of a senior conversion optimization consultant, you will help your (English speaking) clients to increase their revenue and profit through research and A/B testing.

You will work with owners of e-commerce sites on a day-to-day basis, and will be the single point of contact for your clients when it comes to conversion optimization.

A typical day in the job will consist of doing some form of research on your clients’ sites (Google Analytics analysis, user testing, heatmap analysis, form analysis, heuristic analysis, etc), coming up with hypotheses to test, and setting up tests (with the help of a developer).

Requirements

  • You are an experienced digital marketer and are passionate about conversion optimization. Ideally you already have some experience with conversion optimization.
  • You have a thorough knowledge of Google Analytics. Preferably you are Google Analytics certified, or you are willing to get your certification before you start working for us.
  • If you are ConversionXL Certified, then that's a big plus (although it's not required).
  • You have experience working at an agency or as a freelancer in a client-facing role or at an e-commerce company.
  • You love data and research, but you also have a lot of empathy and can easily put yourself in the position of the consumers visiting your clients’ e-commerce sites.
  • You are a native English speaker. You are a good communicator, patient, friendly and honest.
  • You focus on output and results rather than on ‘hours spent’. Efficiency and productivity are central in our company culture. Of course you're not on your own: we will help you to become more efficient and productive.
  • You are a perfectionist.
  • You have a can-do mentality. You don’t see problems, but rather challenges you will overcome. You are self-driven and always want to be the best. In short, you’re a high performer.
  • You are flexible with your schedule. If you work remotely, you may be in a timezone different from that of your co-workers or clients. Therefore, occasional calls early in the morning or late at night may be unavoidable.
 
We offer
  • A challenging full-time job in an ambitious agency. We have great plans for the next few years and want our team to be diligent in growing together.
  • A flexible working arrangement. You can work remotely from anywhere in the world. 
  • A competitive salary (as a contractor).
  • Performance bonuses.
  • You won’t have to travel to meet your clients - all meetings are held online through video conferencing.
  • Full conversion optimization training when you start working for us.
  • We offer continuous on-the-job training. Learning opportunities don’t just cease after your initial training.  
  • We offer a friendly work environment and a chance to meet and interact with people from all over the world.
  • We have great English speaking clients to work with.
  • We offer you 24 paid vacation days per year.

Interested?
Apply before June, 30.

The entire application procedure will be online.


Are you currently a consultant? We understand that you may already have clients or projects of your own, and that is completely fine. However, we do request that you please mention this in your application. And please note that this is a full-time position, so you won't have time left to keep working for your own clients or projects.

Apply for this position

Apply on https://dexteragency.recruitee.com/o/digital-marketer-with-cro-experience

items.title: Emily Hirsh, Inc. : Senior Digital Strategist
items.content:
Senior Digital Strategist

Posted Jun 13

Emily Hirsh, Inc.
Headquarters: Remote
https://emilyhirsh.com
View all Emily Hirsh, Inc. jobs →

Position: Senior Digital Strategist

Department: Advertising

Reports to: CEO

Role:

The Senior Digital Strategist will be leading the digital ad operations for a high growth team at Emily Hirsh, Inc. Key aspects of the role include defining and implementing client success strategies, managing and mentoring a teamof Ads Managers, leading internal meetings within the advertising division and managing the accounts of our bigger, more challenging clients. The Senior Digital Strategist will support the CEO in driving initiatives and contribute tooverall business operations success and the ongoing growth of Emily Hirsh, Inc. A well-rounded leader and expert, the Senior Digital Strategist will possess extensive digital advertising know-how as well as process-driven operational leadership skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure flawless execution of advertising operations through oversight of internal team with a focus on providing the best experience and results that serve our clients and maximize revenue.

  • Design and implement processes, systems and best practices for ad operations – providing recommendations and solutions to Ads Managers – including reporting and planning, routine monitoring of performance for direct clients, operations strategy, budget management, and KPIs.

  • Communicate strategy, analysis, forecasting and implementation plan to CEO and Strategic Team on Cadence meetings.

  • Stay abreast of changing programmatic marketplace and landscape for Facebook.

  • Support key platforms such as YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Google AdWords and Google Display.

Results:

  • Increased capacity for clients with an increase in ad management support.

  • Increased client results because of a second person with eyes on their account, who has an extremely high-level strategy.

  • Increased knowledge of scaling the agency to close higher level and quantity of clients.

  • Increased client retention rate.

  • Increased team momentum and productivity.

  • Decreased time the CEO has to spend on client accounts or communicating with clients.

  • Maintain a 75% margin in the ads department.

Requirements:

  • North American time zone

  • Previous agency management experience

  • Expert level Facebook ad and advertising strategy knowledge

  • 40 hours+ / week available to EH Inc Team

  • Ability to lead and manage internal team members

  • Ability to be on all of the team strategic meetings

Apply for this position

items.title: Tokeet Inc: Growth Marketer
items.content:
Growth Marketer

Posted Jun 13

Tokeet Inc
Headquarters: Barbados
https://www.tokeet.com
View all Tokeet Inc jobs →

## About Tokeet

Tokeet is a software company dedicated to the short-term rental industry. Our mission is to develop software solutions that makes vacation rental management easier and fun without compromising on enterprise level features. We're passionate about this goal and, as vacation rental owners ourselves, believe in what we do. We're 3 years old, growing fast, and privately owned.

## Growth Marketer

We’re looking for a highly motivated and experienced growth marketer to join our digital marketing team. You might be a great fit if you are excited about creating digital advertising campaigns, tracking and analyzing performance data, adjusting strategy in real-time to optimize results and spending most of your day creating content, partnerships, and other campaigns that continuously drive customer growth.

The ideal candidate will be an experienced SEO specialist who knows how to create content that drives traffic and conversions. They will also be well versed in analytics tools like Google Analytics and in identifying and reaching out to potential partners who can help drive growth.

### In this role you will

  • Create and grow an content footprint which drives growth continuously. This includes subject identification, content development and SEO optimization, and content placement.
  • Help build an affiliate partner program which grows traffic and registrations. 
  • Sort through well known and unconventional user acquisition channels and set up tests to measure how well they perform and scale. Come up or discuss new test ideas for existing or new channels and campaigns.
  • Track and report on campaign performance using advanced LTV and cohorts analysis. Uncover growth and optimization opportunities with your own data queries.
  • Create, optimize, or redeploy micro sites and product sites as needed with an eye towards SEO and increasing conversions.

### The ideal candidate has

  • 3-5 years experience in growth marketing at an early-stage company.
  • A great mix of creative and analytical thinking.
  • The ability to work with minimal guidance, be proactive and to handle uncertainty, ambiguity and the challenge of quickly evolving goals.
  • You should be comfortable working in a small team and a fast-paced environment.

### Benefits of Tokeet

  • Work remotely at home or abroad.
  • Unlimited vacation time and sick leave.
  • Make your own hours while meeting targets.

Apply for this position

kwesi@tokeet.com

items.content:
Who is The Honestly Good Smoothie Co.
A recently launched start-up, we’re passionate about transparency, honesty and integrity in the food industry. We deliver hand chopped, honestly prepared blend-it-yourself smoothie kits to homes across the UK, with exciting plans in the pipeline for product development to disrupt the box scheme model. We’re currently in the process of a website, recipe and packaging redesign, so it’s an exciting time to join a growing team!

Who are we looking for?
We’re on the look out for someone who can help develop and implement our acquisition and retention strategy, with a focus on conversion optimisation and generating a sustainable CPA for our all-organic smoothie subscription service (www.honestly-good.co). Any experience with the subscription model (Saas or e-commerce) would be hugely beneficial. If you look at everything in life as an (Honestly Good!) conversion rate funnel, this is one for you!


What’s it all about?
A brief outline of what you may like to get involved with is outlined below, though all is flexible, negotiable and it’s most important we find someone who enjoys working with an early stage, pre-seed start-up, to grow our business together:

A/B Testing (pricing, packages, marketing channels, promoted posts and more)
Email list segmenting and strategy
SEO
Link building
Exploration and testing of distribution channels
Focus on generating stable CPA
Exploration of a freemium tier for select platforms
Affiliate strategy
Customer profiling
Developing a feedback loop
Data capture
Technical SEO
Any technical / development skills would be helpful, though not essential

We’re a flexible bunch, and this opportunity would fit perfectly around other work commitments you may have. Working predominantly remotely, with the ability to travel into London once in a while would be ideal.
We’re super keen to hear from data-driven, analytical minded growth marketers who have an interest in the wellness / organic ethical start-up scene. We’re open to talking to people from a variety of backgrounds, so do get in touch if this sounds like you!

items.title: Quantitative Market Research Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Deliveroo is on a mission to transform the way the world thinks about food delivery. It’s not a chicken chow mein and a night on the sofa anymore, it’s your favourite local restaurant, it’s a dinner party, a date.

We’re four years in, and along the way our team have taken hundreds of ideas from brainstorms to global roll-outs, like Deliveroo Editions – bespoke kitchens designed to host a locally-curated selection of restaurants. Editions are our solution to ensuring that our customers have access to the best of the food-scene, no matter where they live.

And that’s just what we’re like at Deliveroo, no compromise allowed and lots of food-inspired challenges to sink your teeth into. Out-of-the-box thinking is actively encouraged and we move quickly to make great ideas happen. We’re energetic, fast-paced and blow off steam with free-for-all Friday lunches.

It’s a formula that’s working too – we’re bringing great food to customers in 12 countries and over 160 cities.

*What we do*

The best businesses in the world use data in everything they do, and it's our job to make that happen for Deliveroo. We work without silos - talking directly to the people doing the job, whether it's operations, engineering, marketing or development. As well as building clear reports and models, we aim to fully understand our data to derive insights that drive change in the business. And we do all of this at startup speed.

As a Market Research Analyst (Marketing and Engagement) in the Business Analytics Team, your primary mission is to lead the provision of sophisticated data analysis, modelling and research services that increase the understanding of current and potential customers.

*You will:*

*Oversee Deliveroo’s customer research data collection and analysis
*Conceive and develop research analysis to extend and improve Deliveroo's understanding of our customers
*Champion the voice of the customer through clear storytelling which delivers insight derived from sound analysis
*We are looking for data scientists and research professionals who bring fresh ideas from all areas with strong technical skills. This role is ideally suited for a creative, highly motivated and career driven individual who is excited about the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment and solve challenging problems. You'll be a key partner to our Brand Marketing teams, market research agency partners and our local marketing teams across the world as well as to our data science and research teams

*Requirements:*

*A hunger for solving difficult problems with data, and for learning new techniques and skills whilst doing so
*Knowledge and experience of statistical sampling and re-weighting techniques
*Experience working with survey data (data manipulation, statistical analysis, mixed methods)
*Knowledge of SQL and R/Python/SPSS or other relevant programming languages
*Comfortable using regression techniques for causal inference
*Able to communicate in a clear and concise manner and convey technical concepts to non-experts

*Nice-to-haves:*

*Experience working with research datasets, Brand Trackers and other brand/customer surveys
*Experience working with Market Research Agencies
*Understanding of conjoint and maximum differential analysis
*Knowledge of Drivers Analysis (LMG, MNL, Ridge Regression; Chaid Trees), Pricing models (VW Models, Gabor Granger), Brand positioning (Correspondence analysis), maxdiff, conjoint analysis
*Knowledge of data collection, storage, management and cleaning techniques
*Strong verbal and written communication, influencing and partnership skills
*Working knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Periscope)

*Benefits:*

*Fantastic exposure to scaling a product at an incredible pace
*Conferences and courses; we're all about professional development
*An in-office gym and subsidised membership at a number of local gyms
*Regular off-sites with the team, as well as games nights and fitness classes
*Food. So much food

_We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing startups around._

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Director of Marketing

Posted Jun 11

Floracopeia
Headquarters: Grass Valley, CA, USA
http://www.floracopeia.com
View all Floracopeia jobs →

Job Summary
The Director of Marketing manages the marketing department in service of the company’s sales goals and brand. This position determines marketing and communications strategy, guidelines, and budget allocation. This position directly oversees 3 mostly remote marketing staff, and works in collaboration with other departments on various projects.

This is a fast-paced marketing department that operates on responsibility, flexibility, respect, and attention to detail. You will wear many hats and must thrive in a communicative, collaborative, evolving, inquisitive work environment.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To:
  • Marketing Strategy – oversee multi-channel ecommerce marketing strategy including email, social media, advertising, content marketing, promotions, and website optimization.
  • Email Marketing – Manage the company’s email marketing strategy including newsletters, automated email sequences based on user behavior, and evergreen sequences connected to marketing funnels.
  • Advertising – Create, manage, and optimize advertising strategy including Facebook, Instagram, retargeting, AdWords, print, and other opportunities.
  • Management – Supervise three full-time marketing staff. Direct and review the work of contractors and vendors.
  • Promotions – Plan and execute annual promotions calendar for retail, B2B, and new product/course launches.
  • Website – Monitor site traffic, SEO, and conversion rates. Oversee the work of web developers and agencies on website optimization projects.
  • Metrics and Optimization – Prepare reports on sales, promotions, website statistics, leads and conversions, and adspend ROI using data from Google Analytics and Netsuite ERP.
  • Content Creation – This position may or may not write content for blog, social media, ads, and website.


Required Qualifications
  • 6-8 years experience in digital marketing
  • Proven experience designing and implementing multi-channel marketing strategies
  • 2 or more years supervisory experience, preferably managing a remote team
  • Extensive email management system experience (we use Bronto, but experience in another platform is fine)
  • A highly flexible and responsive mindset to adapt to changes and feedback
  • Thorough understanding of Google Analytics
  • Strong copywriting and editing skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Self-directed and motivated
  • Ability to see the big picture while also keeping track of small details
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in an organized manner
  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, or a related field

Desired Experience/Expertise
  • Facebook Ads Manager
  • Netsuite
  • Bronto
  • Google AdWords
  • WordPress (blog and landing pages)
  • Project management
  • Basecamp
  • Adobe Photoshop
  • Webinar marketing
  • Professional experience in wellness products, skincare, B2B, and/or online education

Benefits
This position can be remote, or based in our office in Grass Valley, CA. Compensation is commensurate with experience. Floracopeia offers a monthly health stipend, generous product credit, two weeks paid vacation (increases over time), and plenty of opportunities for natural health and marketing education.


Apply for this position

Please email resume, cover letter, and 2 work examples that showcase your skills to marketing@floracopeia.com. Make sure to include "Marketing Director Application" in the subject line. Although not required, you may also include a short video introduction if you wish.No phone calls, drop-ins, or personal emails to staff.

Job Description

Pangea is seeking an investment professional who is excited about the intersection of real estate and blockchain. The individual will be a thoughtful, intelligent and well-rounded investment professional who has a deployed capital in real estate in individual assets and/or REITs. The individual will be involved in the early days of Pangea and have end-to-end responsibility for various real estate asset investments from sourcing, due diligence, acquisition, to asset management. The individual will pursue numerous investment leads, build financial models, review legal documents, and pitch investment ideas to Pangea’s acquisitions team. On a daily basis, the Pangea team will support the individual through the investment process and help develop both qualitative and quantitative analytical skills.

Responsibilities and Duties
· Financial Analysis - value properties and their underlying debt structures using discounted cash flow analysis, comparative sales, and expected value of various outcome scenarios.
· Qualitative Analysis - write investment memoranda that thoughtfully assesses key investment risks
· Legal Review - read, analyze and summarize legal documents pertaining to acquisitions.
· Deal Generation - contact banks, private lenders, and other creditors regarding specific leads to gauge interest in transacting. Lead offers, negotiate deals, and follow through to closing.
· Investment Tracking and Reporting - track business plan progress, periodically value existing investments, and prepare investor reporting.
· Property Operations - ensure collateral is protected, oversee court appointed receivers, and manage property level renovations and operations.
· Manage existing pipeline of assets


Qualifications and Skills
· 3+ years of Residential and Commercial real estate experience
· Excellent written and oral communication skills
· Self-starter with tenacity and an entrepreneurial mindset
· Expert in Excel, PowerPoint, Yardi and Argus
· Detail oriented and highly organized
· Compensation and Benefits

items.title: Group Product Manager
items.content:
Group Product Manager at ConsenSys

Brooklyn, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Product Development, Project Management, Agile
Compensation
$150K–$200K
0.01%–0.01%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

ConsenSys is a venture production studio focused on building and scaling tools, protocols, and decentralized applications powered by Ethereum. Our mission is to use these solutions to power the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, security, infrastructure, and more. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where you must be self-directed, determined, and resilient, we would love for you to join us.

The Labs Team, of which this position would be a part, is responsible for sourcing startups externally, incubating them within ConsenSys, and creating a world-class accelerator for startups developing innovative blockchain products.

Profile of Position

The Labs team works directly with all 40+ ConsenSys startups and provides them with the specific resources and support they need to grow and succeed.
An exciting and critical position within ConsenSys, the Group Product Manager works directly with multiple startups and helps them maintain momentum, drive product adoption and engagement, and ultimately achieve product-market fit.

The Group Product Manager, Labs will be responsible for the success of multiple startup teams including their business impact and metrics. This individual is responsible for helping lead the creation for the next set of businesses built on the blockchain. As the Group Product Manager, you’ll be assigned to 3-4 startups within our portfolio and be responsible for ensuring standards, best practices, and quality of delivery is met.

The ideal candidate has a keen ability to see the big picture and a willingness to dive into the details. This individual is an entrepreneur at heart and uses creativity and strong technical knowledge to determine the core product priorities and roadmap.

As Group Product Manager, You Will:
-Be a dedicated resource to the startups and ensure that product management best practices are met
-Work with startups to advise on the team’s short and long-term product roadmaps, key milestones, and the end-to-end customer experience
-Advise on how to build agile teams that are focused on delivering effectively against product strategy and goals
-Advise on how to drive a cross-functional team to efficiently ideate, plan, design, and develop new products and features, while taking into account the target market and the overall user experience.
-Advise on how to analyze and give structure to customer pain points in order to drive the smartest solutions
-Lead through strong influence and collaboration across internal/external resources
-Constantly grow your ownership and passion for customer-centricity and product management by understanding the latest technologies, trends, and industry standards

Required Skills and Experience
-Minimum of 8+ years of relevant product management experience with increasing responsibility. This experience must include work in both growth-stage company environments. Must have a successful track record of building new innovative products (not just feature enhancements) that create competitive advantages in the market.
-5+ years in a leadership/management role. Must have deep experience leading teams of product managers and a passion for coaching, mentoring, and helping product managers improve their effectiveness.
-Deeply experienced in agile and scrum methodologies
-Deeply familiar with lean methodology and business model canvas exercises. -Experience running facilitated workshops using various tools / frameworks from these methodologies.
-Entrepreneurial by nature with a strong bias towards action. Proven ability to make timely and sound decisions
-A great collaborator, fantastic at simplifying/clarifying complex concepts, and have great leadership abilities that motivate teams to deliver
-Experience growing product adoption and defining product differentiation in the market place
-Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills. Proven ability to manage multiple priorities, workflow, and people to drive tasks to completion.
-Strong business acumen and a commitment to excellence/high standards
-True passion for ConsenSys’s mission and vision
-Experience in industries relevant to ConsenSys Ventures, such as identity, finance, supply chain,

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting

Company type: Private

Technologies

javac#cloud

Job description

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

The Senior Vice President of Technical Product Management directly impacts the success of our organization via our product teams.

We need someone who can be responsible for building and managing an elite Technical Product Management team. Each member of this elite team holds the title of “Vice President of Technical Product Management” within a specific division of our portfolio.

The ultimate goal of this effort is to strengthen our teams by facilitating collaboration and communication between them.

The Senior Vice President of Technical Product Management, as well as each of their team members, will be expected learn and use a wide array of existing third-party technologies.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

Know when and how to design new data structures and algorithms.

Apply modern software design patterns (think cloud, containerization, etc) to product requirements.

Understand the fatal impact that poor product design decisions can have and strategies on how to avoid them.

Communicate their technical decisions in a clear, written manner so that other people on the team may follow their direction.

Define data structures and object models.

Create algorithms to solve high-value problems.

Map solutions to large “building blocks” of existing open source components and cloud services.

Make decisions that reduce scope in favor of simplicity.

Communicate clearly (especially in writing).

Provide active daily feedback to individual contributors writing Important Technical Decisions. Help make them simpler and clearer.

Lead and manage a team. Interview new VPs of Technical Product Management and guide them through a structured training period.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

BS in CompSci, CompE, or EE. 5+ years of hands-on production code development in Java or C#.

3+ years experience making the core technical design decisions that were then implemented by other developers.

Excellence in reducing overly complicated and unstructured answers into a set of simple and structured decisions.

Ability to identify and articulate patterns in unstructured and unorganized content.

Excellent written communication skills including architecture diagrams, data flows, and system component diagrams.

A passion for creating work in a process-driven way and working with team members to continuously improve that process.

Experience working for a Top 100 software development company such as:

  • Microsoft, Google, Oracle, Facebook, etc.
  • A leading financial institution such as Goldman Sachs, Citi, HFT Trading firm, etc.
  • A software outsourcing organization (as one of the top 5 technical architects).
Apply now

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere
  • Choose your own hours
  • Flat organization
  • Work with talented people all over the world
  • Committed to diversity
  • Competitive compensation

The Search Guru

About You

You like to provide a lot of value, take complete ownership of projects, and work with smart people who are the best at what they do.

You believe passionately in doing things right, the first time.

You take pride in the work that you do and want to work for a company where you’re allowed to do what you do best.

You understand digital marketing and the role that content plays in this digital world.

You are a detail-oriented person who can work with a team of talented strategists to efficiently manage and execute client timelines and drive results.

Job Responsibilities

  • Work with client and internal team to set project KPIs

  • Collaborate with the Lead Strategist in defining the strategy for the agency’s clients

  • Oversee entire Production Process and take ownership of client deliveries

  • Accountable for successful project delivery as well as meeting project KPIs

  • Collaborate with Operations Manager to ensure workflow and processes are kept current and consistent across departments

  • Manage the client and internal team to ensure all project deliverable deadlines are met

  • Receive and share all client requests and communications to the appropriate team member to ensure client’s voice and concerns are considered

  • Provide and promote high standards of professionalism and integrity throughout the life of projects, both within and outside the organization, appropriately representing company’s business philosophies, protocols and standards

  • Review deliverable documents to ensure content matches the agreed strategy; proofread deliverable documents

  • Ad hoc assignments related to the successful growth of the company

Must Haves

  • A proven record of project managing multiple time sensitive projects on schedule.

  • Agency experience

  • A proven record of delivering outstanding results for your clients

  • Data driven mindset and decision making

  • Strong interpersonal and relationship development skills

  • Solid writing and grammar skills

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications

  • Knowledge and hands-on experience in at least one of  of the following: email marketing, Content Strategy, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Paid Media Marketing

  • At ease managing multiple projects, setting stakeholder expectations, working individually and collaborating across teams

  • Strong Project Management skills

  • Experience in client facing roles in an agency environment

  • Native-level proficiency in English

  • Working overlap from 9am-5PM EST

  • Reliable internet connection and (remote) office with a door

  • Laptop / computer and headphones

Preferred (Optional)

  • Digital Marketing Strategy experience

  • Previous remote and distributed working experience

  • Previous experience working with agency specific tools for project management, communication, time tracking, time forecasting

Compensation
Hourly rate, based on experience. 

Your Benefits

  1. Create your desired lifestyle

  2. Travel and work from wherever you want

  3. Option to make your residence in a country of your choice

  4. Flexible schedule to allow for an optimum work-life balance

  5. Create space for personal plans

  • Opportunity for a long term success as a member of The Search Guru team. We are focused on long term collaboration more than one time freelance projects.

  • Grow with the company

    1. At The Search Guru we find extraordinary talent and build positions around their skills

    2. Access to very experienced team members in various Digital Marketing areas. Our Lunch & Learn program allows for the entire team to share knowledge and develop their skills together.

  • Every 30, 60 or 90 days propose 1 or more projects you would like to develop for the company. We appreciate and support initiative.

    Apply for this position

    If you’re interested, email us your resume and your Linkedin profile at hiring@thesearchguru.com with the email subject line of “Account and Production Manager” In the body of the email, include your salary requirements and answer the following questions: 1) Why do you think you’re a good fit for this job? 2) What relevant experience do you have with sales assistant? 3) In a work environment, what keeps you motivated?

items.title: Analytics and Growth Associate
items.content:
SOLVING THE PROBLEM OF FOOD WASTE

OLIO is the world’s only neighbour-to-neighbour food sharing app, and our mission is to solve the problem of food waste in the home & local community. We do this by connecting anyone with spare food – which can be households or local businesses – with neighbours living nearby who would like it. Globally, over one third of all the food we produce gets thrown away, which is worth over $1 trillion. What few people realise however is that in the developed world, over half of all food waste takes place in the home, with the average UK family throwing away £800 of food each year - collectively adding up to £15bn. OLIO solves this with our award-winning mobile & web apps.

Over the past 2 years OLIO has grown from a local initiative in North London to a global movement. We now have over 465,000 users who have together shared well over half a million portions of food – with food being successfully shared in 32 countries and counting. Underpinning this incredible growth has been our volunteer programme, with over 19,000 people reaching out to spread the word about OLIO in their local community and rescue unsold food. OLIO is now looking to grow our core team as we embark upon the next exciting phase in our journey.

JOIN OUR TEAM!

In order to accelerate OLIO to its next level in growth and impact, we are recruiting for an Analytics & Growth Associate, who will report into Viv Taylor, Product Manager.

In this role you will be responsible for:

- Analysing data for the business via MySQLPhp and ensure the right questions are being asked and prioritise the sequence in which they are asked
- Developing an expert understanding of our how our data is structured and what insights can be derived from it
- Creating ad-hoc reports to evaluate the efficacy of specific initiatives/experiments
- Running regular reports that provide insight into ongoing company/departmental performance
- Creating a company dashboard(s)
- Assisting in online ad creative, implementation and analysis

Once you have proven yourself you will have great freedom and autonomy, coupled with an enormous opportunity for personal development. All of our roles are remote working roles, however for London based team members there is the ability to co-work as well. We live for our mission, but like to have fun along the way!

IS THIS YOU?

Our ideal candidate will first and foremost be as passionate about our mission as we are! In addition to this, you will have the following experience and skills:

- Previous experience in a similar role , ideally in a fast-paced environment
- Know what it means for results to be “statistically significant” and how to derive such results
- Significant experience with SQL
- Significant experience with Excel
- Excitement about productivity tools, spreadsheets, and databases
- Photoshop experience
- Curiosity about and enthusiasm for systems and processes
- A good balance between analytical abilities and creativity
- Scrappy and resourceful when facing challenges of all types
- An eye for detail


*Bonus points:*

- You have experience working for a high-growth startup
- You have experience in CRM, Mixpanel, Google Adwords, and Facebook Ads Manager

And all OLIO team members share these attributes:

- A self-starter with a ‘can-do’ attitude
- Resourceful and creative
- Thorough, but able to move quickly and decisively
- A ruthless ability to prioritise
- Excellent communication skills
- Fun to work with

items.title: Type/Code: Senior Digital Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Full-time

(Brooklyn, NY)

We are looking for an exceptionally talented Senior UI/UX/Digital Designer to join our growing team of creatives and coders on a full-time basis at our studio in DUMBO, Brooklyn. While an on-site teammate is preferrable, we will consider remote applicants.

 

About Type/Code:

 

Type/Code designs and builds digital products and experiences, working with ambitious clients to bring powerful ideas to life. Our clients range from technology startups (Architizer), to cultural institutions (MIT Media Lab, MoMA), to large media properties (GOOD); and we often collaborate with large companies such as Google, GE, and Scholastic. We focus on conceiving, designing, and developing exceptional digital experiences across a wide range of mediums. While a significant amount of our work is client focused, we jump at any opportunity to build self-driven tools and products. Our studio atmosphere is friendly, laid-back, collaborative, flexible, and full of a passionate group of designers and developers who love what they do.

 

Role:

 

You will be working closely with our design and development teams on a range of project types—focusing on web platforms, mobile applications, and digital communication design—along with opportunities to participate in branding, print design, data visualization, motion graphics, and more. You will be involved in the entire lifecycle of our projects: from strategy and design research, to prototyping and iterating on design solutions, to the execution of final design deliverables in close collaboration with our development team.

 

You have:

 

  • 4+ years of experience art directing and designing for digital mediums, specifically user interface design for websites and web applications, across a wide range of devices
  • A portfolio demonstrating creative, impactful, and effective design solutions, across an adaptable range of mediums and styles
  • Effective communication skills—including presenting design strategies to teammates, clients, and stakeholders, and leading design-centric conversations
  • Exceptional typography, composition, hierarchy, and color theory capabilities
  • Ability to strategize with and art direct creative collaborators such as photographers and illustrators when needed
  • A strong understanding of User Experience fundamentals, and a passion for designing digital experiences that are beautiful, intuitive, and a joy to engage with
  • Experience with design research, finding precedents, assembling type, image, and color studies, and rapidly prototyping and iterating on design solutions
  • A mastery of Sketch, Adobe’s Creative Suite (especially Photoshop and Illustrator), InVision, and hunger for continually exploring new design tools and processes with. After Effects/animation experience is a huge plus
  • A cursory understanding of HTML/CSS/JS (the more frontend development skills the better), and a desire to influence/understand how the things you design will be built
  • Experience with working on a distributed team (thriving under collaborative workflows with multiple teammates and disciplines when needed), and ability to produce complex design deliverables with minimal guidance

If this sounds like you, we would love to look through your work and chat some more.

Job Perks: - Competitive salary- Central location in sunny DUMBO Brooklyn with a beautiful view of Manhattan- Regularly stocked snacks, coffee, and beer- Bike and pet friendly- Work machine of your choosing- Health, dental, and vision insurance- Education/Professional Growth stipend - Flexible hours and work-from-home policy

Apply: Send a brief cover letter and a link to your portfolio website to jobs@typecode.com

items.title: FetLife: Product Manager
items.content:
Product Manager

Posted Jun 6

FetLife
Headquarters: The Milky Way
https://fetlife.com
View all FetLife jobs →

At FetLife we are looking for an open-minded kink-friendly Product Manager to join the Team. 

We’re looking for someone who is

  • Goal oriented, data-driven, and follows a scientific approach to problem-solving
  • Passionate about product, product development, and user experience
  • Empathetic to the needs of a diverse group of members and stakeholders
  • Focused on delivering the highest impact and smallest iterative improvement
  • Continuously working on improving themselves and their processes
  • An effective and clear written communicator and collaborator

At FetLife you will be responsible for

  • Working with the community to better understand member needs
  • Defining and breaking up projects into small measurable iterative improvements
  • Expressing requirements through low-fidelity wireframes
  • Validating potential solutions with members of the community
  • Reviewing project outcomes, summarizing feedback, and suggesting next steps
  • Maintaining and prioritizing our product backlog
  • Defining, tracking, and reporting our key metrics

You should have experience

  • Conducting user interviews and communicating your findings
  • Defining and breaking up projects into small measurable iterative improvements
  • Documenting project requirements and creating low-fidelity wireframes
  • Effectively prioritizing projects based on people’s needs and potential impact
  • Finding nuggets of valuable information in a sea of data
  • Continuously iterating over a product until you get it right

Bonus if you have experience

  • Managing a project from idea to final product
  • Working on a small remote team

Why work at FetLife

  • Have your work impact millions of people
  • Get to work with a passionate, dedicated, and diverse group of people
  • Grow as a Product Manager #BigPassionateCommunity #HighTraffic
  • Work on a 100% remote team: US, Canada, Germany, Belgium, Slovakia, and Hungary

More about FetLife

  • Largest kinky social network this side of the Milky Way
  • Over 6 million members and growing every day
  • Grew 100% by word-of-mouth
  • Serve a couple of billion requests a month
  • Top 600 website in most English speaking countries

How to apply

Email jointheteam@fetlife.com, and in the email, please include:

  • Link to your LinkedIn profile or a PDF copy of your resume
  • Relevant work samples
  • Anything else that you feel will help you stand out

If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to email us at jointheteam@fetlife.com. 

Looking forward to getting to know you.

Apply for this position

Email jointheteam@fetlife.com with the above info.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=9, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=14, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Embedded Developer
Industry: Artificial Intelligence, Consumer Electronics, Robotics
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Technologies

c++roboticsartificial-intelligenceschedulingoptimization

Job description

Job Responsibilities:

You will be implementing and integrating algorithms that are applicable for high-level robot task planning and scheduling, creating C++ API interfaces, developing and fine-tuning optimization and scheduling tools.

  • Develop new, or integrate readily available solutions for high-level robot task planning and scheduling.
  • Search for and integrate, implement applicable methods for map segmentation.
  • Develop integrated robotic planning and execution environments.
  • Apply optimization methods for robot task plan optimization.

You will work in a scrum-based agile development cycle. You will be working alongside founders, researchers, and engineers to design and build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption.

You will be measured by deliverables, engineering oriented approach (instead of research focus), code quality and ability to communicate with peers and work in a team.

Experience:

  • Master degree (or PhD but application oriented, rather than research focused).
  • At least 5 years in software development, and two 2 years working in a Robot AI field.

Mandatory Requirements:

  • Experience with optimization techniques for robot task planning.
  • Experience with scheduling algorithms.
  • Experience with stochastic optimization methods and heuristic solvers.

Preferred Requirements:

  • Experience in working hands-on with robots.
  • Experience in creating solutions for industrial or service robotics usage.

Flexible Hours & 100% Remote Work:

These roles permit flexible working hours and are 100% remote.
Contract work or a permanent position: we can accommodate you.

Apply now

About Aeolus Robotics

Aeolus Robotics was founded to bring the first generation of household robot assistants to life, and to market. Integrating prowess from world-leading Taiwanese manufacturers with Silicon Valley AI genius, we are breaking ground in general-purpose consumer robotics with capability in unstructured “human” spaces. Our CTO, an expert in AI and machine learning, led the DARPA effort that spun out the Watson AI project.

We invite top-notch people with a passion for robotics to join us in this technical adventure. Among our many open positions (http://aeolusbot.com/careers) you may just find your dream job, so make sure to check the whole list!

As a well-capitalized start-up we have demonstrated our prototype robot at CES 2018, and have additional key members and breakthrough technological approaches to ensure success in this challenging field. Check our website for more, and search the web for "Aeolus Robot" to find some of the many articles and videos about our prototype demonstrations.

Benefits

  • Roles permit flexible working hours and can be 100% remote.
  • Contract work or a permanent position: we can accommodate you.
  • Build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption.

Marketing Copywriter for digital marketing agency

Posted Jun 5

Ellipsis Marketing LTD
Headquarters: United Kingdom
https://getellipsis.com/ellipsis-is-hiring-a-marketing-copywriter/
View all Ellipsis Marketing LTD jobs →

Ellipsis Marketing, a digital marketing agency, is looking for an expert copywriter who loves solving marketing problems.

Ellipsis solves marketing problems for online businesses. We’re a smart, ethical team that does good work, and is in demand. We need you on board to own and take care of copy for clients. We mostly work with WordPress businesses (both companies selling products, and other agencies selling website services), providing strategic guidance and practical implementation to help clients grow.

Your specific responsibilities will include:

  • Writing long-form, SEO and publishing-ready blog posts
  • Writing and editing product pages
  • Helping clients develop copy and content strategies
  • Crafting sales email newsletter campaigns
  • Other copy work clients need, such as writing up case studies

What you need: You should be a great copywriter, able to tie copy into marketing. You should have experience with WordPress, with “power user” skills and involvement in the WordPress community through WordCamps or meetups preferred. A firm understanding of content marketing, SEO, and experience tying copy to marketing outcomes for products and services are also important.

Who we are: Ellipsis strives to be an ethical company that’s a great place to work, and produces value for its clients. We primarily solve marketing problems for WordPress businesses. Existing projects include managing marketing for a SaaS product, assisting WordPress theme and plugin businesses with their marketing, and helping WordPress agencies get more clients. We do really good work, and are in demand.

How we work: We’re a fully remote company, with everything running through Basecamp for an all-in-one place, relaxed, and non-interruptive working environment. We want you to be empowered to do your best work, and the business is structured around this

How you’ll work: You’ll be a member of the Ellipsis team. This position is freelance, and 5-8 days/month. This typically breaks down into a day or two a week. There’ll be potential to grow these hours to full time should this be of interest.

We're keen to find and grow with the right person, so if you're a great fit for this already – or are great at copy but fascinated by marketing and haven't had the chance to prove it yet – please do apply or get in touch for further details. Thank you.

Apply for this position

Please apply by sending some brief notes to alex@getellipsis.com on why you’d be a good fit for this role including how your experience matches the requirements above, your day rate, and some examples of work you've done which fit the responsibilities.

Dave Bailey, the UK’s leading Tech CEO Coach, is looking for an insanely talented and ambitious Senior Marketer to grow a new, global brand.

*About Courage HQ*

It used to take years to grow from 10 to 150 employees. Now, it takes months. We live in a world of hyper-growth. The pressures and expectations on founder CEOs have never been greater. To succeed in this new, uncertain world, CEOs need to be more adaptable, more decisive and bolder than ever before.

Courage HQ supports early-stage founders on their journey to becoming great CEOs. Our CEO Coaching and Growth Programs help CEOs find their own answers to the right questions, gain new perspectives and find clarity in the chaos.

*The Senior Marketer Role*

* Position Courage HQ as a global thought-leader
* Work with content team to create and promote relevant articles and videos
* Collaborate on Go-To-Market strategies for new products
* Create and execute on a PR strategy
* Design and lead new marketing campaigns
* Manage social media and online channels
* Develop strategic partnerships

*Traits We Look For*

* Entrepreneurial - you’re a fierce individual contributor and love to get your hands dirty
* Ambitious - your moto is to start at the top and go upwards
* Insanely talented - you’re in the top 1% of marketers with a pedigree to prove it
* Curious - you’re always asking the right questions and constantly learning
* Creative - you have an eye for good design and great copy
* Tech-savvy - you live and breath the latest tech and tools

*Qualifications*

* Minimum 2:1 BA degree from a top-tier university
* 5-8 years of professional experience in brand marketing or communications
* A love of working in small, fast-paced, entrepreneurial teams
* Former founders most welcome!

*The Package*

* Salary + Vested Stock Options
* Remote working with flexible hours
* Personal coaching from our CEO Coach, Dave Bailey

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javacloudc#

Job description

The Vice President of Technical Product Management works with our product teams to design, maintain, and improve products and features within our organization's portfolio.

As Vice President of Technical Product Management, you will be expected to make informed Important Technical Decisions (ITDs) for a  product and deliver highly technical product specs to support their implementation.

You will have access to teams of top performers all over the world to aid you in this task.

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Define data structures and object models.

Solve high-value problems using algorithms.

Map solutions to large “building blocks” of existing open source components and cloud services.

Make decisions that reduce scope in favor of simplicity.

Communicate clearly and effectively.

Lead and manage a team.

Create technical design specs that define the core of software products.

Apply modern software design patterns (think cloud, containerization, etc)  to product requirements.

Review and provide feedback to more junior product managers, turning your decisions into detailed engineering plans.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

Bachelors of Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering. Minimum 5 years of hands-on production code development in Java or C#.

Minimum 3 years experience making core technical design decisions.

Ability to identify and articulate patterns in unstructured and unorganized content.

Excellent written communication skills including architecture diagrams, data flows, and system component diagrams.

A passion for creating and continuously improving workflows in a process-driven way.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere
  • Choose your own hours
  • Flat organization
  • Work with talented people all over the world
  • Committed to diversity
  • Competitive compensation
